name: Abhoth
shortDescription: Abhoth lies deep within the heart of Mount Voormithadreth. There, from the cesspit of Y'quaa, it sends forth its revolting children, extending its reach across the Earth.
lore: A pool of filth from which horrible monstrosities emerge. Can communicate telepathically. In the story "The Seven Geases", refuses to devour a supplicant out of fear of indigestion.
gameplayRules:
* : The Lead Investigator spawns 1 Cultist Monster on a space that does not contain a Cultist Monster. Then, if there are 6 or more Cultist Monsters on the game board, advance by 1.
* When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Abhoth awakens, flip this sheet and resolve the "Abhoth Awakens!" effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Abhoth's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside 8 Cultist Monsters and all Abhoth Special Encounters.
awakeningFlavor: For the first time in millennia, Abhoth has ventured forth from its subterranean lair. Its children swarm through the streets of every major city and civilization is on the verge of collapse. Humanity is on its last legs. Soon, Abhoth will reign above all.
awakeningEffects:
space that does not contain a Cultist Monster.

Final Mystery
The Abhoth Epic Monster cannot lose unless 3 Mysteries have been solved.
When the Abhoth Epic Monster is defeated, the Final Mystery is solved and investigators win the game.

The Source of Uncleanliness
*Each time would advance, spawn 1 Cultist Monster on a space instead; spawn the Monster on a space that does not contain a Cultist Monster if able. Then, if there are no Cultist Monsters on this sheet, investigators lose the game.
* : Spawn 1 Cultist Monster on a space that does not contain a Cultist Monster. Then each Cultist Monster recovers all .

Note: The original Doom replacement effect was "Each time would advance, spawn 1 Cultist Monster on a space that does not contain a Cultist Monster. Then, if there are no Cultist Monsters on this sheet, investigators lose the game." The word instead was added to denote this effect as a Doom replacement effect, and the spawn effect was updated to allow Cultist Monsters to be spaw
finalMystery:
The Abhoth Epic Monster cannot lose unless 3 Mysteries have been solved.
When the Abhoth Epic Monster is defeated, the Final Mystery is solved and investigators win the game.
mysteryNames: The Source of Filth and Disease
appearance:
"Then, in that reeky twilight... he descried a sort of pool with a margin of mud that was marled with obscene offal; and in the pool a grayish, horrid mass that nearly choked it from rim to rim.

Here, it seemed, was the ultimate source of all miscreation and abomination. For the gray mass quobbed and quivered, and swelled perpetually; and from it, in manifold fission, were spawned the anatomies that crept away on every side through the grotto. There were things like bodiless legs or arms that f
residence: Cavern of Y'quaa, beneath Mount Voormithadreth, the tallest peak in the Eiglophian Mountains, spanning the middle of Hyperborea (north of the Arctic Circle)
source: The Seven Geases, Clark Ashton Smith, 1934.

city.description: Walking through town, you think you smell sulfur as you cross a busy intersection. You try to locate the source of the odor (). If you pass, you find a trail of gray ooze leading to a nearby sewer hatch; gain this . If you fail, you are struck by a motorcar in your carelessness; gain 1 Injury Condition.

Hushed whispers of people found maimed in the streets are on the lips of every passerby, but they regard you with distrust, and are reluctant to speak with you (-1). If you pass, you learn that the murders may be the work of a mysterious cult called The Unclean Ones; gain this .

The police are puzzled by the recent disappearances. Nothing ties the cases together, and the missing persons share no common trait. You mark each victim on a map of the city (-1). If you pass, you realize that each victim lives in close proximity to a sewer entrance; gain this .

At the library, you check out several volumes that contain maps of the local area and compare them to your notes (). If you pass, you realize that several of the caves in the area were formed within the last few months; gain this . If you fail, the meticulous work drains you; lose .

The archives are closed to the public, but you sneak inside hoping to find a rare text detailing the location of Mount Voormithadreth (). If you pass, you learn much about Hyperborea; gain this . If you fail, the police catch you leaving, and confiscate your books; discard 1 Tome possession.

A brilliant scientist insists that only those with the proper know-how could hope to use his new weapon properly (-1). If you pass, you prove your technical expertise to him; gain the Lightning Gun Artifact. If you fail, you shoot yourself in the foot, and he is not impressed; lose .

A popular traveling circus is in town, and a huge crowd has formed, waiting for a chance to see a dead alien beast. You too, are curious to see what the tent holds, but the line is exceptionally long. You may become Delayed to gain this .

As you walk through a bustling market, you notice a filthy looking man studying you very intently. He flees as you approach, but you give chase (). If you pass, you catch sight of him passing into the sewers; gain this . If you fail, you stumble and hurt yourself; gain 1 Injury Condition.

An elderly innkeeper offers you a reward to kill the rats in her cellar, but you find that the rats have all been eaten by a monstrous beast! A Cultist Monster ambushes you! Whether you defeat the Monster or not, the aged woman is thrilled to be rid of the rats; gain 1 Asset of your choice from the reserve.

A renowned scholar of anatomy is in town to give a seminar. You attend, only to find that many cannot stomach the gruesome lecture (). If you pass, you make it through the entire lesson; gain this . If you fail, you leave something behind in your haste to leave; discard 1 Item possession.

The note slipped under your door is written in code, but you think you can decipher it (). If you pass, it warns you of impending danger, and you check out early; gain this . If you fail, a foul smelling street urchin breaks into your room and attacks you during the night; lose .

You work to translate the journal of a man who claims to have visited Hyperborea in its prime. You notice strange scribbles in the margins (-1). If you pass, you realize that the scribbles are actually a cipher, and complete the work easily; gain this . If you fail, you grow frustrated; lose .

A courier arrives with a letter for you from the Miskatonic University. It claims that they have distilled a potion from the remains of one of the abominations that will help you combat the growing threat. You may move to Arkham and become Delayed to gain this and improve .

Someone is petitioning the constabulary to find a missing girl, but the police are little help. Together, the two of you search for the girl (-1). If you pass, you find her wandering in the sewers with no memory; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, advance by 1.

Old tunnels have been discovered beneath the city after a missing persons investigation. You venture into the dark to see what you can find (-1). If you pass, you find piles of odds and ends covered in gray ooze; gain this and 1 random Item Asset from the deck. If you fail, you are hurt when one of the tunnels collapses; gain 1 Injury Condition.

The dig crew is puzzled by the odd variety of bones they recovered. You help them piece the bones together (-1). If you pass, you realize the bones came from a single malformed creature; gain this . If you fail, you fit them together incorrectly, and are none the wiser; discard this Clue.

Unwashed and somewhat disheveled from the day's activities, the librarian mistakes you for someone else. She presents a rare book to you, telling you that it took her weeks to find (-2). If you pass, you thank her and decide it best to be on your way; gain this and the T'tka Halot Artifact.

A member of the Silver Twilight Lodge confronts you in a smoky speakeasy, offering you assistance in dealing with the rising threat (-1). If you pass, retreat by 1. If you fail, you feel as if the negotiations got away from you; you may gain a Dark Pact Condition to retreat by 1.

Arkham's Deputy Dingby appears to be visiting the city. You try to blend in and pray he does not recognize you (-1). If you pass, you manage to finish your investigation without distraction; gain this . If you fail, his face lights up when he sees you, and he exclaims, "My friend! Together, nothing will escape our expertly trained eyes;" impair .

You witness a gathering of filthy creatures in a darkened alley. You try to stay hidden and eavesdrop on their conversation (-1). If you pass, you recognize the name Abhoth; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, they catch you trying to listen in; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

A seemingly innocuous gentleman offers to mentor you in the ways of sorcery (-2). If you pass, he teaches you to perform great wonders; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, he says that only dark magic can show you the answers you desire; you may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this .

A seedy collector showers you with praise, vowing to do everything in his considerable power to help you fight back against the growing evil in the world, but only if you give him the object of his desire, of course. You may discard 1 Artifact or 1 Relic possession to gain this and improve .

Poring over an ancient text on Hyperborea, you accidentally trigger an old ward meant to keep the author's enemies from stealing his journal (). If you pass, the ward proves ineffective, and you learn much from the journal; gain this . If you fail, the ward burns away your arcane ability; impair .

You spot Deputy Dingby making his way toward you, pistol drawn. You sigh, and try to predict his movements (). If you pass, Dingby apologizes profusely for a case of mistaken identity, and you agree to forgive him if he shows you his case file; gain this . If you fail, Dingy shoots you in the leg; gain a Leg Injury Condition. }

wilderness.description: You have been following the tracks of a three-legged creature for hours, but they have come, at last, to the edge of a wide river (). If you pass, you pick up the trail on the other side; gain this . If you fail, you come down with a fever after spending too much time in the contaminated river water; gain 1 Illness Condition.

After multiple rumors of missing livestock in the area reach your ears, you set out to search for anything unusual (-1). If you pass, you find a massive cavern with hundreds of sets of tracks leading inside; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, a Cultist Monster Ambushes you!

You are attacked by a vicious beast, the like of which you have never seen before (-1)! If you pass, you repel the creature, and follow it to the entrance of a well-hidden cave; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, it tears at your face before fleeing into the woods, leaving a horrific scar; impair .

You find strange marks etched upon the surface of a stone near the mouth of a tiny cave. You inspect the runes closely (). If you pass, you realize they were placed to seal the entrance; gain this . If you fail, you disturb the cave's denizens; spawn 1 Cultist Monster on this space!

You suspect the man who gave you this map did not have your best interests in mind (). If you pass, you somehow manage to follow the crudely drawn map to the mouth of a large cavern; gain this . If you fail, you travel in circles for days without finding anything of use; lose .

You attempt to map the extensive subterranean cave system, hoping to discern which direction it leads and what it might pass beneath (). If you pass, gain this . If you fail, you take a wrong turn and become separated from your companions, never to see them again; discard 1 Ally Asset.

You come upon a flock of buzzards setting in upon the corpse of a large animal. You are startled to see that the animal is nothing like any beast you have ever seen before; gain this . The disturbing image of the dead creature haunts you later as you try to sleep (-1). If you fail, lose .

You come across a severely wounded man on the side of the road. You gently lift him onto your shoulders and head toward town (). If you pass, you get him to the hospital, and he tells you of the creature that attacked him; gain this . If you fail, he passes away in transit; advance by 1.

You suspect that your quarry has passed through this area, and you redouble your search efforts. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat the Monster, gain this . If you do not defeat the Monster, knowing the beast is loose weighs heavily on your mind; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You are awakened suddenly by the snapping of twigs, and heavy, labored breathing just outside of your tent. You try not to make any noise (). If you pass, you find unusual tracks around your camp in the morning; gain this . If you fail, a razor sharp talon slashes at you through the tent, severing a tendon in your arm; impair .

You find sticky gray ooze covering some unusually placed stones. Curious, you try to discern the stones' purpose (-1). If you pass, you find the entrance to a deep, earthen tunnel; gain this . If you fail, you get some of the ooze in your eye; lose .

You stumble upon the lair of an unknown creature while it is away. You suspect the piles of bones that lie within might be human and turn to leave, but the creature returns while you are still present! A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat the Monster, gain this .

You come across the imprints of many human feet in the mud and grass (-1). If you pass, you deduce that the tracks all belong to a single monstrous creature and make yourself scarce; gain this . If you fail, you pay the tracks no mind, and a horrid beast with a dozen legs suddenly attacks you; lose .

As you make your way through the wilds, you feel the gaze of hungry eyes upon you. You feel something wet on your shoulder, and a sticky, atramentous liquid drips down your shirt. A Cultist Monster Ambushes you! If you defeat the Monster, gain this .

Setting up camp in the mouth of a small cave, you think you hear something unusual, and strain to listen (-1). If you pass, you hear the faint call of an unearthly beast echoing from below; gain this . If you fail, you convince yourself that your mind is playing tricks on you; lose .

You gaze across the valley and breathe in the crisp morning air. In the distance you think you see something move (-1). If you pass, you meet the gaze of a pale white being, skin punctured with thousands of tiny holes; gain this . If you fail, you begin to see things moving wherever you look; gain a Hallucinations Condition.

You come across a malformed creature of flesh and bone attacking a group of unlucky tourists. You search for something to distract the beast with. You may discard 1 Item possession to gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you do not discard the Item possession, a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

Without warning, a writhing mass bursts from the foliage, expelling a vile gray liquid from its mouth in your direction (). If you pass, you evade the spray and fend off your assailant; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the liquid burns at your eyes and the skin on your face; impair .

You find a pile of offal just off the main trail, surrounded by unusual tracks. Gain this . Something deep in the ooze catches your eye, but you fear attempting to pick it up (-1). If you pass; gain 1 random Item Asset from the deck. If you fail, you fall into the ooze; gain 1 Illness Condition.

You find one of the grayish abominations afield during an investigation, but it does not spot you. You may become Delayed to observe it further. If you become Delayed, you think you have learned enough to help you combat the creatures with ease; gain this and improve .

Weary from travel, you search a small cave for any signs of recent inhabitance, hoping to find a place to rest. Drag marks in the dirt and claw marks indicate that you might not be alone. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat the Monster, gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You discover a filthy hovel in the wilds and try to discern from a distance if anyone is home (-1). If you pass, you wait until the occupant has left to survey the premises; gain this and 1 random Item Asset from the deck. If you fail, a raving madman attacks you when you enter; lose .

The spirit of a warlock slain by Yeb offers to grant you an otherworldly vision if you can withstand him entering your mind (-1). If you pass, gain this and improve . If you fail, you appear to have adopted some of the warlock's unpleasant personality; impair .

You see something flash silver on a ledge above you, but you must climb to reach it (). If you pass, you find something belonging to a recently missing man; gain this . If you fail, you misstep and go tumbling down the rock face; lose . }

sea.description: You spot a beached ship on the horizon, and try to convince the crew to investigate (-2). If you pass, they give in, and you find a survivor, battered but alive, spouting tales of a terrible sea demon; gain this and retreat by 1.

You dream of a masked figure, looming over your bed, smothering you as you sleep. As the life drains from your body, it asks, "Who are you? Who will you become?" You wake gasping for breath. Your cabin is empty, save for a pale ivory mask at the foot of your bed. Gain the Pallid Mask Artifact.

The crew offers to deal you a hand, but warn you that they play for keeps (). If you pass, you earn a favor from one of the men; gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you lose more than you bargained for; impair and unless you gain a Dark Pact Condition.

During a violent storm, something slams against the side of the ship, swinging the boom unexpectedly in your direction (). If you pass, you reflexively duck, and recover in time to see a writhing form sink beneath the waves; gain this . If you fail, you are knocked out; become Delayed.

A blubbery gray tentacle tries to pull a hapless sailor into the sea! Grabbing his hand, you resolve to hold on with all your might (). If you pass, the assault relents, and the man tells you of other recent attacks; gain this . If you fail, the man is swallowed by the waves; advance by 1.

Several days into your voyage, your ship is attacked by a terrifying gelatinous sea creature, leaving you the only survivor. Gain this . Severely damaged, your ship drifts aimlessly for days. You despair, having given up hope that anyone will ever find you. Impair and become Delayed.

On a forgotten island, a wizened hermit tells you that something vile and unclean stirs in the night. Gain this . He offers to teach you a useful trick if you can prove you are worthy of it (-1). If you pass, gain 1 Spell. If you fail, the knowledge burns at your mind; impair .

The sailors tell you that lately, strange shapes can be seen moving across the horizon in the wee hours of the night. You stay awake through the night to catch a glimpse yourself (-1). If you pass, you see strange gray creatures cresting the surface of the water in the distance; gain this .

Mutterings amongst the crew suggest that all is not well aboard the S.S. Almanac, and you try to eavesdrop to learn more (-1). If you pass, you learn that several days before you boarded, their previous captain was killed by a horrifying abomination that smelled of rot; gain this .

An old sailor teaches you how to fight. Improve . During your training, he warns you to keep an eye out for stowaways aboard the ship (-1). If you fail, some of your things go missing in the night; discard 1 Trinket possession.

You spend your time aboard the ship translating an ancient text regarding Hyperborea. Improve . One night, a frenzied sailor reeking of sewage breaks into your cabin and tries to rip the book from your hands (-1). If you pass, you knock the man out; gain this . If you fail, the man bites you, and the wound festers; gain 1 Illness Condition.

In her dying breath, an aged bounty hunter tells you of the hunting gear she buried in the sand when she gave up her old life. You attempt to find it (-1). If you pass, gain 1 Magical Artifact. If you fail, you hurt your back while digging; gain a Back Injury Condition.

A crazed stowaway has set fire to the cargo, including a valuable package from a recent excavation in Cairo. You may spend to brave the flames and rescue the goods. If you spend the Health, gain this and 1 Relic Artifact.

Due to recent attacks, a skilled occultist is accompanying the merchant vessel on its voyage. You observe him as he works (). If you pass, you are able to replicate the ritual; gain a Wrack Spell. If you fail, you hex yourself; impair .

The net is unusually heavy today, and the sailors ask for your help reeling it in (-1). If you pass, you pull up the corpse of a nine-legged beast with the day's haul; gain this . If you fail, the net is lost and you collapse from the effort; lose .

Gray slime begins to bubble up from beneath the surface of the water. Gain this . The bubbles pop, releasing pockets of bones and offal that cling to the ship (-2). If you fail, the grotesque sight and smell are too much; lose .

A beast with innumerable talons and thousands of blinking eyes swoops down upon you, screeching murderously (-1). If you pass, you fend the creature off; gain this . If you fail, the beast snatches you up in its talons, smashing you roughly onto the deck; gain a Leg Injury Condition.

After a dangerous encounter with an amorphous, slime-covered sea creature, you notice a peculiar rash where one of its tentacles had wrapped around your arm (). If you pass, you resist the disease long enough to get a sample to a doctor; gain this . If you fail, gain 1 Illness Condition.

You attempt to divine the location of a powerful curio said to be the essence of a once powerful hunter (-1). If you pass, gain this and 1 Relic Artifact. If you fail, you grow discouraged; gain a Despair Condition.

While you rest in your cabin, a horrid, unclean entity enters your consciousness (-1). If you pass, the entity commands you bring it a sacrifice before it relents; gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, visions of a bubbling, protean mass haunt you; gain a Hallucinations Condition.

A weak splash prompts you to peek over the side of the ship, and you are astonished to see a man drowning only a few feet away! You may spend to brave the frigid waters and tow him to safety. If you spend the Health, gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck.

From the crow's nest of an antique sailing vessel, you spot something unusual on the shore, but a sudden gale threatens to unseat you (). If you pass, you see a pale creature crawl forth from a tiny cave; gain this . If you fail, you drop your pack as you steady yourself; discard 1 Item possession.

The sailors engage you in a game of dice (-1). If you pass, you catch one of them cheating, and he offers you information about some unusual disappearances to make it up to you; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, they shark your hard earned goods; discard 1 Item possession.

A dense fog surrounds the ship, and you struggle to make anything out (-1). If you pass, you see something move in the water and alert the crew; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the ship slams into something massive, and one of your friends falls overboard; discard 1 Ally Asset. }

mysteryDetails.name: Child of Abhoth
mysteryDetails.flavorText: From the moment its twisted limbs and misshapen body left the bubbling pit deep in the cavern of Y'quaa, its only desire has been to impose its sire's will upon the denizens of the civilized world.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, spawn the Child of Abhoth Epic Monster on a random space.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if the Child of Abhoth Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

mysteryDetails.name: Exploring the Caverns
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The caverns twist and turn into the depths, gray ooze dripping down the rocky walls. Screams of those taken by the Children echo endlessly through the dark tunnels, but there is no help to be had.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place {{icon|et|1

mysteryDetails.name: Sealing the Caverns
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Abhoth's children reside in the deepest tunnels beneath the earth, emerging only to feed and do their sire's disturbing work before returning to the deep to slumber and prepare for their next meal.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Research Encounter, he may spend {{icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Spawn of Uncleanliness
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Stupid, ravenous, and deadly, Abhoth's malformed spawn roam every corner of the globe. Each foul new horror is more disgusting than the last and brings with it uncleanliness and disease.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, each investigator spawns 1 Cultist Monster on the nearest {{icon|Wilderness

mysteryDetails.name: The Source of Filth and Disease
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Abhoth, the progenitor of miscreation, stirs beneath Mount Voormithadreth, spewing forth abominable creatures to spread its filth across Earth. From there it commands its children - those that it does not eat.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Research Encounter, he may spend {{icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Touched by Abhoth
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Those who make contact with the mind of the Source of all Uncleanliness are rarely ever the same again. They revel in dirt and grime and seek only to spread filth during the remainder of their short lives.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, each investigator places {{icon|et|1

name: Antediluvium
shortDescription: Each night, the stars move closer to their ultimate alignment.
gameplayRules:
* When a Gate spawns that corresponds to the Omen, spawn 1 Cultist Monster on that Gate.
* When the Omen advances to the space of the Omen track, investigators as a group lose equal to the amount of Sanity on this sheet. Then discard one Sanity from this sheet.
* When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When advances to zero, flip this sheet and resolve the "The Stars Align!" effect on the back 
thumb|220px|right|Front of Antediluvium's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside 5 Cultist Monsters and 1 Deep One Monster. Set up the Mystic Ruins Encounter deck.Place on each space of the Omen track and equal to on this sheet.
awakeningFlavor: The energy of the civilizations of the past have been harnessed by the Order of Rising Stars, and with it they have dredged up lost R'lyeh from the ocean floor. Within the citadel as its shinging emerald heart, the Sleeper of R'lyeh——the eldritch horror Cthulhu——lives again.
finalMystery:
The Cthulhu Epic Monster cannot lose unless 3 Mysteries have been solved.
When the Cthulhu Epic Monster is defeated, the Final Mystery is solved and investigators win the game.

city.description: A statue in the city square has an unusual inscription (-1). If you pass, you intuit the glyphs to be empowered by temporal magic; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, your curiosity alerts the Order of Rising Stars to the location of the glyphs; advance by 1.

Three men eat together at a diner. You attempt to pick out which belongs to the Order (). If you pass, you ambush him after his meal and grill him for information on the Order; gain this . If you fail, you attack an innocent person; gain a Detained Condition.

The Order of Rising Stars is pursuing you relentlessly. You try to evade them (). If you pass, you learn much of their methods; gain this . If you fail, you go days without rest and begin to see them on every street corner; lose and .

The lights of the city dim, and the stars shine down upon you with a harsh light (). If you pass, you discover a constellation that matches none of your star charts; gain this . If you fail, your interest in the ever-nearing stars borders on obsession; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You study Plato's Critias, hoping to find something that would explain what interest the Order of Rising Star has in Atlantis (). If you pass, you learn about the Atlantean's impressive collection of magical artifacts; gain this . If you fail, you find nothing of worth; lose .

You study a text that you believe to be written in the lost language of Naga-Maya (). If you pass, you learn about the origin of mankind; gain this . If you fail, your extended interest draws the unwanted attention of the Order of Rising Stars; gain 1 Injury Condition.

You break into the home of a suspected Order member and scrutinize her notes (-1). If you pass, you quickly transcribe all that you find; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, she returns while you are rifling through her things; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

The Order of Rising Stars brazenly assaults you in broad daylight. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat the Monster, the local police force tips you off to your assailants numerous connections; gain this .

You delve into library archives in hope of learning about the City of the Great Race (-1). If you pass, you uncover a detailed history; gain this . If you fail, you black out suddenly, waking hours later with memories that are not your own; place on the Ancient One sheet.

Many of the Order of Rising Stars ceremonial things have been left behind, and you think you could use them to piece together where the Order wizards went. You may spawn 1 Gate to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

A strange man claims to be a native of Pnakotus. You ask him for details (-1). If you pass, he reveals that he is a member of the Great Race and shares knowledge of the City with you; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, you learn nothing of value, become Delayed.

A traveling merchant claims to possess something recovered from the lost city of Atlantis (-1). If you pass, you convince him to part with it; gain this and 1 Relic Unique Asset. If you fail, your loud haggling draws the attention of the Order; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

A traveling storyteller offers to expand your mind, if you have the fortitude to receive his gifts (). If you pass, the wisdom of civilizations lost is ingrained in your core; improve 1 skill of your choice. If you fail, you buckle beneath the weight of his words; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

As you sleep, you dream of an emerald city rising from the ocean depths. Gain this . You wake with a sudden jolt to find someone standing over you speaking unintelligible words. A Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You shake hands with a wealthy businesswoman who has taken an interest in your travels (). If you pass, she takes a liking to you and shares her secret to success with you; gain 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, she finds your handshake to be entirely forgettable; lose .

You search ancient texts for any indication of the existence of Hyperborea (). If you pass, you find a fable about a maiden from Koth who made a pact with a time traveling sage, gain this . If you fail, you conclude that the city never existed; discard this Clue.

You turn to the stars for guidance (). If you pass, your mind becomes tied to the astral memories of a blazing star; gain 1 Spell. If you fail, your mind lingers too long in the far reaches of time and space; gain 1 Madness Condition.

Minor temporal anomalies lead you to a gathering hall for the Order of Rising Stars during the middle of a ceremony. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat the Monster, the ceremony is irrevocably disrupted and the flow of time returns to normal, gain this and close the nearest Gate.

A man who claims to belong to the Order of Rising Stars agrees to speak with you (-1). If you pass, he nervously agrees to cut all of his ties with the Order; retreat by 1. If you fail, he panics and calls for the police, screaming that you attacked him; gain a Detained Condition.

You attempt to harness the spiritual energy of civilization to glimpse into the past (-1). If you pass, the energies flow through you and you witness Atlantis become lost beneath the waves; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, you accidentally travel to the future; advance by Omen by 1.

A mysterious traveler wordlessly looks you up and down (-1). If you pass, the traveler joins your entourage without explanation; gain 1 Character Unique Asset. If you fail, the traveler leaves hastily, face dark with worry and confusion; discard all of your .

You investigate ties between the Order of Rising Stars and the fish-like men of the sea (). If you pass, you learn that they have been spotted searching for sunken ruins together; gain this . If you fail, you learn only misinformation; move this Clue to the nearest space.

You scour the ashes of a horrific fire for anything that can be recovered (-1). If you pass, you find a book entirely untouched by the flames, almost is if it had caused the fire itself; gain the Necronomicon Artifact. If you fail, the ash-filled air burns your lungs; lose .

You look into the affairs of the Order of Rising Stars (-1). If you pass, you find that they have been gathering texts regarding the lost continent of Mu; gain this . If you fail, someone tips off the Order to your snooping and they make a hasty exit; move this Clue to the nearest space. }

wilderness.description: You notice that the soil has been disturbed in this area (). If you pass, you discover that an ancient burial site has been desecrated; gain this . If you fail, you twist your ankle in the dirt; lose .

Suddenly, you cannot move or speak, and you are surrounded by chanting Order members (-1). If you pass, you manage to escape with their strange words etched into your mind; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, your vision fades to black; place on the Ancient One sheet.

It appears that the Order of Rising Stars has already drained this site and moved on, but there is some residual energy (-1). If you pass, the area's energy becomes one with your own; gain this and improve . If you fail, the energy sickens you; lose .

The natives in this area come to you with a gift, insisting that the knowledge it contains will help you stop the Order (). If you pass, you are able to master the unusual object; gain this . If you fail, the strange heirloom is beyond your ability to control; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You intercept an encrypted message that speaks of a midnight gathering far from civilization and try to locate the site of the meeting (-1). If you pass, you observe the gathering in secret; gain this . If you fail, you end up in the middle of nowhere; lose and become Delayed.

Thousands of years regress in an instant, and you find yourself gazing at the night sky of millennia past (). If you pass, you sketch an accurate star map before returning to your own time; gain this . If you fail, the stress of the journey weighs heavily on your psyche; lose .

The Order of Rising Stars is holding a ceremony outside of town, and you attempt to attend in disguise (). If you pass, you observe several of their rites; gain this . If you fail, you are discovered and are nearly killed before making your escape; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You follow a group of deep ones as they make their way inland (-1). If you pass, you remain undetected, and observe them meeting with Order members; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, they spot you, and you drop one of your things when you run; discard 1 Item possession.

You overlay a star chart with a topographical map of the local area in search of an Order hideout (). If you pass, you align them successfully; gain this . If you fail, the Order catches you snooping about long before you find their den; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You suspect that you are being followed, but your pursuer is extremely stealthy (-1). If you pass, you find a place to hide and watch as a deep one creeps along your path; gain this . If you fail, you are hounded at every step of your journey; place on the Ancient One sheet.

You believe that you can learn much about the Order of Rising Stars by participating in one of their ceremonies, but you fear the consequences that path might bring. You may advance by 1 to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You enact a ritual to mask the night sky from the Order of Rising Stars (). If you pass, you watch them wander aimlessly in confusion; gain this . If you fail, the stars only become clearer; advance the Omen by 1.

Members of the Order of Rising Stars have opened a portal to the distant past and ventured through it (). If you pass, you manage to discern to what time they have traveled; gain this . If you fail, your meddling causes an anomaly; spawn 1 Gate.

A careless member of the Order of Rising Stars leads you to one of their abandoned hideouts (). If you pass, you find a strange curio wrapped in seaweed; gain 1 Relic Unique Asset. If you fail, you trigger the defensive words that were placed when they departed; gain 1 Injury Condition.

You find a single emerald spire protruding from the earth in an abandoned Order ritual site (-1). If you pass, you identify a displacement of time and space in the area; gain this . If you fail, the spire's haunting melody resonates in your mind; place on the Ancient One sheet.

You sit atop a boulder and meditate, becoming one with the scintillating emerald stars of Xoth (-1). If you pass, you siphon some of the stars' power; close 1 Gate of your choice. If you fail, visions of the origin of the star spawn leave you a gibbering maniac; lose .

The Order of Rising Stars is meeting with several other hooded figures (). If you pass, you glimpse fish-like faces beneath their hoods; gain this . If you fail, the group disperses and you know nothing more than you did when you arrived; move this Clue to the nearest space.

With each step you take, the wilderness around you appears more untouched, more ancient (). If you pass, you are able to understand the magic that is present in this area; gain 1 Spell. If you fail, the primal magic is far beyond your understanding; lose .

You visit with a hermit who claims that he is being hunted by the Order of Rising Stars (-1). If you pass, you realize the ageless hermit is from the city of Koth; gain this . If you fail, the Order interrupts your questioning and drags the man away; place on the Ancient One sheet.

There is a thundering crash and a blazing light streaks toward the earth, all manner of trees and plant life bursting into flames (-1). If you pass, you quickly find where it landed and recover an antiquity of ages past; gain 1 Magical Artifact. If you fail, you are badly burned; lose .

You attempt to absorb all of the arcane energy in the area, such that the Order might not be able to harness it (-1). If you pass, your plan is a success; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, your attempt only makes you an easy target; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

A handsome young man is studying some unusual flora (-1). If you pass, you impress him by identifying the genus and species of the plant; gain the Jake Williams Unique Asset. If you fail, he eyes you warily and departs but not before leaving you with a flirtatious parting wink; lose .

You chart the sites that the Order of Rising Stars has visited (-1). If you pass, you believe that by linking them together you have discovered the next location; gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, you fail to notice one of them approach you; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You intercept a message meant for a priest of the Order of Rising Stars and try to decipher its intent (). If you pass, it turns out to be a transcription of a rite once performed by the people native to this area; gain 1 Spell. If you fail, it appears to you to be utter gibberish; lose . }

sea.description: Unusual flotsam smashes into the side of the ship, and something small catches your eye. As you pull the unusual object aboard the ship, you know instantly that it was never meant for mortal hands and that by taking it you will set yourself along a dark path from which there is no return. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain the Grotesque Statue Artifact.
The only way to activate the strange island shrine and uncover its nefarious purpose is with a sacrifice of blood. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

Deep ones are attacking the ship. Gain this . One leaps at you. A Deep One Monster ambushes you; if you lose from the test, place the lost Sanity on the Ancient One sheet. If you defeat the Monster, you find an Order sigil on its corpse; gain 1 additional Clue.

Stars shift and realign in the night sky, as if you have crossed dimensions into another time. Gain this . Dread sets in and something terrible rises from beneath the waves. The Cthulhu Epic Monster ambushes you! If you are not defeated, you return to the present; gain 1 additional Clue.

Something calls to you from the sea floor (-1). If you pass, you shake free but retain the memory of an ancient slumbering deity; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you wake hours later, feeling as if your mind has been rifled through; place on the Ancient One sheet.

Deep ones are raiding the cargo hold. Gain this . One of them notices you watching. A Deep One Monster ambushes you; if you lose from the test, place the lost Sanity on the Ancient One sheet. If you defeat the Monster, you find an Order missive on it; gain 1 additional Clue.

You hear a chanting and try to quickly transcribe it word for word (). If you pass, you meet with success; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, the words call a beast; a Deep One Monster ambushes you; if you lose from the test, place the lost Sanity on the Ancient One sheet.

You use arcane sight to look into dark waters (). If you pass, you feel an ancient power stirring; gain this . If you fail, you attract unwanted attention; a Deep One Monster ambushes you, if you lose from the test, place the lost Sanity on the Ancient One sheet.

You dream this night of the deep, dark ocean. Something awaits you there, searching, dreaming. It reaches out to you, feeling for a window into the world above. You may advance the Omen by 1 to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

Paranoid from recent events, you are vigilant for any signs of activity in the water (). If you pass, you notice dark waters frothing and churning on the horizon; gain this . If you fail, you hardly notice someone approaching you from behind; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

Crates in the hold are rumored to contain supplies for the Order of Rising Stars (-1). If you pass, you discover what the crates contain and toss them overboard; gain this . If you fail, you cannot find them and the Order receives the full shipment; place on the Ancient One sheet.

You keep thinking that you see gleaming green spires out of the corner of your eye (-1). If you pass, you manage to get a good look at one before it shimmers out of existence; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the sightings haunt you; place on the Ancient One sheet.

You slip into a restricted area to investigate unusual noises coming from the crew quarters (-1). If you pass, you find a journal detailing a gruesome transformation; gain this . If you fail, you find no sign of the crew, only pools and smears of blood; place on the Ancient One sheet.

You find yourself dreaming of a bustling emerald city (-1). If you pass, you observe the ways of the inhuman citizens that reside there; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, you wake up trembling and drenched in seawater; place on the Ancient One sheet.

You arrive at an uncharted island before the Order has had a chance to explore it (-1). If you pass, you find something incredible; gain this and 1 Relic Unique Asset. If you fail, the Order performs a vile ritual and the island is swallowed by the sea; advance by 1.

You pursue a group of deep ones to their city. Gain this . They fiercely defend their territory. A Deep One Monster ambushes you; if you lose from the test, place the lost Sanity on the Ancient One sheet. If you defeat the Monster, you study its corpse; improve .

You sneak aboard a deep one vessel (-1). If you pass, you find and destroy a shrine to their master; gain this and close the nearest Gate. If you fail, you are discovered; a Deep One Monster ambushes you; if you lose from the test, place the lost Sanity on the Ancient One sheet.

The deep one vessel far outpaces your own. You struggle to maintain sight of the ship as it nears the horizon (-1). If you pass, you stay on its tail long enough to know its destination; gain this . If you fail, the ship vanishes into a heavy fog; place on the Ancient One sheet.

The man holds a single finger to his lips, and you find that you cannot speak. He extends his hand to you, and in it lies a glittering ruby. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and the Ruby of R'lyeh Artifact.

The captain is acting strangely and at times seems as if he is less than human (). If you pass, you realize that he is slowly becoming a creature of the sea; gain this . If you fail, you awake one morning to find the ship manned entirely by deep ones; place on the Ancient One sheet.

Some of the ship's crew strike you as odd (). If you pass, you notice that many of them sport fish-like facial features; gain this . If you fail, the crew catches you eying them and teaches you a lesson; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

A waterlogged book is pulled up with the rest of the day's haul (-1). If you pass, you realize after some investigation that the book is written in an Atlantean script; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, the book's latent magic warps the fabric of time and space; spawn 1 Gate.

A feeling of dread seeps under your skin, and you frantically search for the source (). If you pass, you spot the shimmer of a long-dead city beneath the waves; gain this . If you fail, you grow increasingly unstable as your journey continues; gain 1 Madness Condition.

The water begins to churn and roil, and you must react quickly (-1). If you pass, the swirling vortex finds no easy prey today; gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, the spectral visage of a monstrous creature emerges from beneath the sea; the Cthulhu Epic Monster ambushes you! }

mysteryDetails.name: Dread Countenance
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The statuette was recovered from the smashed remains of a whaling vessel. There were no survivors. The shape of the statue's face is exotic and bizarre, yet something about it is oddly familiar.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
If you would gain an Artifact, you may gain the Grotesque Statue Artifact instead. 

At the end of the Mythos Phase, you may spend {{icon|clues

mysteryDetails.name: Emerald Dreams
mysteryDetails.flavorText: With each touch of the arcane, the dreams grow stronger. Visions of an emerald city, once grand, now lost beneath the waves. Visions of its corpse upon the ocean floor. Visions of it rising to glory once again.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When you pass a {{Lore

mysteryDetails.name: Sleeper Ascendant
mysteryDetails.flavorText: When the stars align, a mournful song can be heard along the water's edge. A song of loss and of inescapable dread. As the heavens fall into place, the song grows louder, calling all who hear it to the sea.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When you close a Gate that corresponds to the current Omen, you may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: The Order of Rising Stars
mysteryDetails.flavorText: All across the globe, a new organization rises from the ashes of its predecessors. Their goal is unclear, but they appear to be consolidating power in preparation for some unknown event of immense importance.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After you resolve a Research Encounter, you may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Through the Ages
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Passageways to the past have appeared around the world, heavily guarded by the Order of Rising Stars. Mu, Atlantis, Koth, Pnakotus - what knowledge could the Order be seeking from these storied locales?
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After you resolve a Mystic Ruins Encounter, you may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Time Immemorial
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The machinations of the Order of Rising Stars have reached a critical juncture, and across the world, the Order works to harness the powers that, in eons past, fueled ancient civilizations. But for what purpose?
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place {{icon|et|1

name: Atlach-Nacha
shortDescription: Ever-weaving, ever watching, should Atlach-Nacha ever complete her empyrean masterpiece, it would merge the firmaments of the Dreamlands and reality into a single cosmic ingress, opening the way for the horrors of the Underworld to wage war upon the cities of humanity.
lore:
Beware the moonlit shadows that cling to the corners of the cosmos, for within the cosmic tapestry, there exists a nightmarish weaver, an entity whose macabre dance threads the fabric of reality itself. This is the tale of Atlach-Nacha, the Spider God, whose dark presence weaves a web of horror that ensnares the minds of those who dare to uncover its eldritch secrets.

In the forgotten recesses of the Dreamlands, beyond the realms of mortal understanding, Atlach-Nacha waits in the stygian depths of its desolate domain. An arachnid deity of grotesque proportions, its form defies earthly logic, with countless spindly legs that writhe and skitter in unsettling harmony. In the cold, alien glow that illuminates its web, Atlach-Nacha spins a tapestry of nightmares, drawing upon the fears and phobias that lurk within the souls of mortals.

Legends speak of a forsaken cavern, concealed in the heart of a desolate realm where reality itself seems to unravel. In that stygian abyss, Atlach-Nacha's monstrous lair echoes with the haunting clicks and whispers of a thousand unseen arachnid legs. The air is thick with a palpable malevolence, and the shadows dance with the anticipation of horrors that transcend mortal comprehension.

It is said that Atlach-Nacha, in its insatiable hunger for the forbidden threads of existence, beckons to those who seek forbidden knowledge. Those who, driven by insatiable curiosity or reckless ambition, dare to traverse the astral planes may find themselves ensnared in the eldritch web woven by the Spider God. Once trapped within its gossamer strands, the unfortunate souls become puppets to Atlach-Nacha's nightmarish whims.

The spider deity, with its ceaseless weaving, spins the fates of those entangled in its cosmic snare. Minds unravel like fragile silk, sanity slipping away with each agonizing moment spent within the clutches of the arachnid nightmare. The victims are left as hollow shells, forever ensnared in the inescapable threads of Atlach-Nacha's loathsome tapestry.

Whispers of the Spider God's influence reach across dimensions, seeping into the dreams of those susceptible to its malevolent call. Its web, a reflection of the cosmic horrors that lurk beyond mortal comprehension, stretches across the boundaries of reality, leaving an indelible mark on the minds of those who dare to explore the forbidden corners of the Dreamlands.

And so, in the eerie silence of the cosmic void, Atlach-Nacha continues its unholy dance, weaving a symphony of horror that resonates through the aether. Those who hear its nightmarish melody are forever marked, their souls entwined in the insidious threads of the Spider God's eternal tapestry
gameplayRules:
* : Spawn 1 Gate unless investigators as a group discard a total number of and/or Spells equal to half .
* When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Atlach-Nacha awakens, flip this sheet and resolve the "Atlach-Nacha Awakens!" effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Atlach-Nacha's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside the Leng Spider Monster. The Lead Investigator gains 1 Spell.
awakeningFlavor: The final threads of Atlach-Nacha's cosmic web have been stitched into place. In the skies above, the alien stars of the Dreamlands can be seen blinking into existence. The mother of spiders herself has arrived to witness the downfall of all mankind.
finalMystery: * When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.

city.description: Hundreds of thousands of tiny spiders have cropped up downtown and you look for the source of the infestation (-1). If you pass, you find a colossal egg in an abandoned cellar and crush it; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the spiders grow more plentiful by the day; lose .

A recently opened rift in space reacts to your presence. Strands of raw entropy affix themselves to your limbs as you draw near, offering you the limitless power of the Crawling Chaos. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and close 1 Gate of your choice on any space.

You try to understand the arcane power that is pulling reality closer to the Dreamlands (-1); roll 2 additional dice if you have at least 1 Spell. If you pass, you are able to understand the complexities of the process; gain this . If you fail, it is a terrible strain on your mind; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You attempt to decipher unusual writing scribbled in the margin of a dog-eared encyclopedia of arachnids (-1). If you pass, you uncover writing about a web between worlds; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, reading the words aloud triggers an arcane ward; lose .

You feel the lightest of touches on your shoulder and spot a spider crawling toward your neck (). If you pass, you deftly swat it and it releases a burst of arcane mist when it dies; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, its bite siphons your life force into an arcane vortex; spawn 1 Gate.

An arcane scholar doubts you possess the knowledge to comprehend his theory on the recent dimensional instability (-1); roll 2 additional dice if you have at least 1 Spell. If you pass, you convince him to share with you; gain this . If you fail, his theory confuses you; lose .

A young woman claims she is under the effects of a geas and is to present herself before the Mother of Spiders. You try to reason with her and break the curse (). If you pass, she overcomes her geas; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, she leaves, never to be seen again; advance by 1.

The city is being overrun by giant spiders. You offer your assistance to the militia (). If you pass, they arm you and tell you where the spiders are lurking; gain this and 1 random Weapon Asset from the deck. If you fail, the spiders attack while the militia deliberate; lose .

You speak with a young woman who was attacked by giant spiders. She is distrustful of all things arcane and eyes you warily (+1); roll 1 fewer die for each Spell you have. If you pass, she tells you about the attack; gain this . If you fail, she has you arrested; gain a Detained Condition.

A man in a pristine white suit offers you an ominous leather-bound tome. You need only sign his contract to acquire the book. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain the Necronomicon Artifact. If you do not gain the Condition, his eyes gleam with a frightening animosity; lose .

You bump shoulders with a stranger as you walk along a quiet avenue (). If you pass, you catch him trying to brush a spider onto you as he passes; gain this . If you fail, you later come down with a fever that burns arcane energy from your mind; gain a Cursed Condition unless you discard 1 Spell.

A pile of cobwebbed tomes proves useless when you find all of the pages to be empty. A tiny spider, fat with energy, has consumed the magic from the pages and appears to desire more. You may discard 1 Spell to gain this . If you do not discard the Spell, the spider bites you; lose .

You spot a deadly spider crawling up a stranger's shoulder and attempt to swat it (-1). If you pass, you are thanked profusely for your life-saving heroics; gain 1 Character Unique Asset. If you fail, the spider grows suddenly to a gargantuan size; a Leng Spider Monster ambushes you!

A man attacks you without warning as you enter a dark alleyway. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you take note of his gossamer cloak as he flees; gain this . If you do not defeat it, the man siphons arcane energy from your unconscious body; lose and discard 1 Spell.

Peering through translucent cobblestones, you can see a sea of stars beneath. You study the strange phenomenon (). If you pass, you realize it is a projection of the Spider-mother's lair; gain this . If you fail, your meddling opens a path; advance by 1 unless you discard 1 Spell.

You hear bouts of heated yelling and follow the ruckus (-1). If you pass, you arrive just in time to stop a strange man from feeding spider venom to his victim; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, there is a blood-curdling scream and the yelling stops; lose .

The police have killed one of the giant spiders and allow you to dissect it (). If you pass, you discover how the Leng spiders are able to bridge dimensions; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, you mistakenly pierce an unknown gland, splashing yourself with corrosive venom; lose .

A young girl has fallen into a rift. You dive through in an attempt to save her (-1). If you pass, you find her and bring her back; gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, you never find the girl, and the inky darkness of the dimensional rift seeps into your core; gain 1 Bane Condition.

Someone sends you a translation of an ancient Hyperborean text. Gain this . You try to deduce who sent it (-1). If you pass, you locate the sender and your perseverance earns you a new friend; gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, not knowing drives you mad; lose .

You fixate on aligning yourself with the shifting axis of power surrounding the Spider-mother's web (). If you pass, you become attuned; gain this and improve . If you fail, you disjoin yourself from the locus of energy, splintering your psyche; gain 2 Madness Conditions.

A rift opens in a crowded square, and grasping spider legs reach out into the crowd. You try to tackle its target out of the way (-1). If you pass, knowledge is offered as thanks; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, the spider pulls one of your friends into the rift; discard 1 Ally Asset.

You overhear a distraught hotel manager complaining that giant spiders have infested the hotel basement. Gain this . You offer to help clear them out for free (-1). If you fail, he later finds you bloody and beaten in a pile of spider corpses; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You wake to a squat, bloated spider hanging above your bed. If you have at least 1 Spell, she communicates telepathically that she has broken free of Atlach-Nacha's brood; gain this . If you have no Spells, you immediately pack your things and leave the horrible hotel; lose .

A giant spider is so bloated with magical energy that it can hardly move. You try to siphon some of the magic while it struggles to escape (). If you pass, you steal some of its power; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, it lashes out at you as it skitters away; gain 1 Injury Condition. }

wilderness.description: You accidentally startle a man while he is whispering to something in the dirt. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you find a small spider crushed in the scuffle; gain this . If you do not defeat it, he leaves you beaten and bloodied; gain 1 Injury Condition.

You come across a man who has been trapped in a giant spider web and try to free him (-1). If you pass, he tells you about the giant spider that ensnared him; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you manage only to slice your hand open on the razor-sharp silk; lose .

You have precious little time and few options to deal with the degenerating pillars of reality. You plead with the gods of the Dreamlands for aid. Spawn 1 Gate unless you gain a Dark Pact Condition. If you gain the Condition, you are granted a brief vision of a possible future; gain this .

Sightings of giant spiders have led you to explore a cave in the region (-1). If you pass, you find signs of a struggle and a corpse cocooned in silk; gain this and 1 random Weapon Asset from the deck. If you fail, one of your friends disappears during the search; discard 1 Ally Asset.

You peer through a tear in the æther and think you can see hazy silhouettes weaving spider-like limbs to and fro. You will need to fully immerse yourself in the dark æther to observe any closer. You may gain a Cursed Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue and 1 Spell.

A swath of spiders appears to be marching toward some unknown destination (). If you pass, you follow them and discover a slight tear in the fabric of reality; gain this . If you fail, you disturb their march and they swarm up your leg; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

You follow a set of unusual tracks through some rarely traveled areas of the countryside (). If you pass, you follow the tracks to a den filled with massive spicier egg sacs; gain this . If you fail, you lose your way and spend several hours searching for the way back; become Delayed.

You come across a luminous silver thread suspended eerily in midair. You suspect that if you expended enough arcane energy you could open a rift large enough to get a look at the web the thread is attached to. You may discard 1 Spell to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You observe a celestial phenomenon occurring in the night sky (). If you pass, another world blinks briefly into existence while you watch; gain this . If you fail, your eyes grow heavy as you watch the dancing lights and you dream of other dimensions; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You ask a dingy recluse to show you the latest addition to his insect collection (). If you pass, he shows you a spider that is practically bursting with arcane energy; gain this . If you fail, he launches into a maddeningly lengthy tirade about how spiders are not insects; lose .

You track one of the Spider-mother's brood through a barren expanse (-1). If you pass, you catch it trying to use a strange device to return to its faraway home; gain the Crux of Cykranosh Artifact. If you fail, the spider eludes you long enough to slip into another dimension; spawn 1 Gate.

The venom from a spider bite warps your memory. You struggle to remain in control in the face of disturbing visions (). If you pass, you overcome the venom and the experience makes you stronger; gain this and improve . If you fail, the visions stay with you; gain 2 Madness Conditions.

You search for the inhabitants of a quiet farm (). If you pass, you find numerous giant spicier corpses around the body of a single farmer, still clutching his weapon; gain this and 1 random Weapon Asset from the deck. If you fail, you do not notice the furiously weaving spiders nearby; spawn 1 Gate.

You focus your thoughts, attuning yourself to the silver strands that bind the cosmos together (). If you pass, you need only reach out to pluck one of the strings; close 1 Gate of your choice on any space. you fail, you lose yourself among the stars; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

Thunder cracks through the air, but there are no storm clouds (). If you pass, you deftly avoid a rift as it opens before you; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, you are swallowed by a rift and fall into the Spider-mother's web; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

You siphon arcane power from the space between dimensions to learn about the other side (). If you pass, you glimpse a verdant alien forest in the land of dreams; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, you see only ruin and devastation; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

You stumble upon a pair of Leng spiders orbiting around one another, puncturing the space between dimensions and threading it with strands of glowing gossamer. Gain this . You try to edge away before they notice you (-1). If you fail, they pursue you for hours; become Delayed.

You immerse yourself in the space between dimensions in order to spy on the Spider-mother's brood (). If you pass, you observe many spiders as they traverse their mother's web; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, the warped dimension takes a toll on your body; lose and .

You use your knowledge of the ley lines to search for a place where the Spider-mother's web is close to emerging (). If you pass, you find a portion of the Dreamlands that has bled into reality; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, you end up lost and confused; lose and become Delayed.

You find several hapless men strung up in cocoons and held in place by razor-sharp webbing. Gain this . You try to free them from captivity (-1). If you fail, the webbing proves stronger than you expected and you cut yourself many times while freeing the men; lose .

All earsplitting screech nearly deafens you. A Leng Spider Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you learn much by observing it during the struggle; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail the test, it catches you off guard and knocks you to the ground; gain 1 Injury Condition.

An unfortunate victim is caught in a massive spider web, screaming for help. You think you can perform a successful rescue, but stealing away the spider's meal may drive them into a ravenous frenzy. You may advance by 1 to gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck.

You study the effect of arcane energy on spiders in the wild. Gain this . The experiment draws the attention of the spiders' larger cousins (-1). If you pass, you continue to observe in secret; gain 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, you give yourself away and the experiment is ruined; lose .

A rift propels you through time to mankind's end. You take up the arms of a fallen hero. Gain 1 Weapon Artifact. The Spider-mother herself bears down upon you. The Atlach-Nacha Epic Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, the Spider-mother is weakened; gain this and retreat by 1. }

sea.description: With a terrible roar, reality splits open just off the bow of the ship. You may gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition to take a closer look. If you gain the Condition, you see strands of the Spider-mother's web stitching together multiple dimensions; gain this and 1 Spell.

A storm of shimmering rifts flicker in and out of being, and you try to navigate the ship around them (). If you pass, you observe them knitting together; gain this . If you fail, the ship passes directly through one and it overloads your senses; lose and discard 1 Spell.

A light breeze brings a swarm of thousands of tiny spiders sailing across the sea (-1). If you pass, you note the northerly direction they are traveling; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the ship sails right into them and several of them become stuck in your hair; lose .

You try to navigate through an unnatural storm, but it feels as if all the arcane power in your head is trying to escape (+1); roll 1 fewer die for each Spell you have. If you pass, you think the storm was caused by a rift in space; gain this . If you fail, the ship is nearly destroyed; become Delayed.

Without warning, one of the other passengers leaps on your back and tries to bite your exposed skin. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you find a jar of spiders on his person; gain this . If you do not defeat it, his teeth leave deep marks in the flesh of your shoulder; lose .

Giant spiders hang on invisible threads in the sky, dutifully weaving something you cannot see. You attempt to disrupt their task (). If you pass, you watch as they escape into another dimension; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, they manage to complete their work; spawn 1 Gate.

One of the other travelers belongs to the Spider Mother, but your source did not tell you who (). If you pass, you keep close tabs on all of the other passengers; gain this . If you fail, one of them opens a rift in secret, leaving you to handle it; spawn 1 Gate unless you discard 1 Spell.

You spend your time at sea honing your abilities. Gain 1 Talent Condition. You hardly notice the other passengers (-1). If you pass, you notice a man with a robe entirely woven of gossamer; gain this . If you fail, someone releases deadly spiders into your cabin; Lose .

You search the heaps of charred bodies on a wrecked ship for anything useful (-1). If you pass, you find what you think is the source of the destruction; gain the Lightning Gun Artifact. If you fail, you find nothing and the smoking corpses make you retch; lose .

You feel something tiny inching up your leg and tear through your bedsheets in a panic (). If you pass, you find a spider and smash it, leaving a spot of shining liquid in its place; gain this . If you fail, it bites you and its venom warps your thoughts; lose and discard 1 Spell.

The sailors have locked a giant spider in the hold, and it appears to be guarding something. They offer to let you in to study it, despite the danger (). If you pass, you find that the spider was guarding a small dimensional tear; gain this . If you fail, it defends itself viciously; lose .

A padlocked chest in the Captain's quarters thumps and shakes as if something inside is trying to escape. You attempt to pick the lock (-1). If you pass, you find only an innocuous book within; gain the T'tka Halot Artifact. If you fail, the Captain catches you in the act; gain a Detained Condition.

Fog makes it difficult to spot the place from your vision, forcing you to rely on intuition (-1); roll 2 additional dice if you have at least 1 Spell. If you pass, you find a rift over the water; gain this . If you fail, you begin to think your visions were lies; gain 1 Madness Condition.

In a moment of clarity, a decrepit mariner claims to have been a thrall of the Spider-mother for most of his life. You ask him what he knows (). If you pass, he teaches you some of the things he learned; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, his mind is too far gone; advance by 1.

You recall the knowledge needed to divert energy generated by deep-sea currents to flood an entrance to the Spider-mother's web (). If you pass, the floundering Leng spiders sever the path; close 1 Gate of your choice on any space. If you fail, the power overwhelms you; lose .

The Spider-mother is drawing another research vessel into a dimensional vortex. You take careful aim and toss them a towing line (). If you pass, you are able to slowly pull them out; retreat by 1. If you fail, your ship is drawn in as well; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

You are convinced that ingesting a small amount of venom will make you stronger (-1). If you pass, after a period of brief sickness, you feel strengthened by the poison; gain this and improve 1 skill of your choice. If you fail, one of your friends slips into a coma from the poison; discard 1 Ally Asset.

Once-familiar seas have mysteriously changed, as if you have mistakenly sailed into the seas of another world. Gain this . The confused sailors ask for your help navigating the unfamiliar waters (-1). If you fail, you lead the sailors astray for several days; become Delayed.

Someone has released hundreds of thousands of small spiders onto the ship. You attempt to capture some for study (). If you pass, you gather the specimens in a mason jar; gain this . If you fail, the spiders elude you but you wake the next day covered in spicier bites; lose .

Proximity to the ethereal strands of the Spider-mother's web is disrupting the natural flow of arcane energy. If you have no Spells, you make note of the phenomenon; gain this . If you have at least 1 Spell, your mind becomes a convoluted jumble; gain 1 Madness Condition.

As the sun rises, you find to your dismay that the sails have been covered with sticky spider webs. Gain this . You try to maintain your balance as you climb the mast to clear away the webs (-1). If you fail, you fall from your perch, hurting yourself badly; gain 2 Injury Conditions.

An unsettling passenger with a pet tarantula offers to teach you the secret of taming spiders (). If you pass, you learn to manipulate the minds of spiders; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, you realize too late that it is you who is being manipulated; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You find a colony of Leng spiders on a desert island. A Leng Spider Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you notice a pattern in their movements; gain this . If you fail the test, you hesitate and it incapacitates you, wrapping you in a sticky cocoon; become Delayed.

Unbeknown to you, several giant spiders were being transported in the cargo hold. Now, the frenzied spiders have broken free and are hunting passengers. Gain this . You try to hide (-1). If you fail, they find you and you are badly hurt fending them off; gain 1 Injury Condition. }

mysteryDetails.name: Beasts from Beyond
mysteryDetails.flavorText: As the Spider-mother's web bridges the gap between worlds, the spiders of Leng father in swarms. Putrid, bloated caricatures of their terrifying mother, they verge on pouring through the ever-widening gates.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
After an investigator closes a Gate during an Other World Encounter or a Dream-Quest Encounter, he may engage the Leng Spiders; a Leng Spider Monster ambushes him!

Whenever a Leng Spider Monster loses {{Health

mysteryDetails.name: Caught in the Web
mysteryDetails.flavorText: As the web between worlds near completion, rifts in time and space appear in places where dream and reality are close, the opening verses of a great ceremony that will bind the world of man to the Dreamlands.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: As an encounter, an investigator on a space containing a Gate may attempt to seal one of the rifts ({{Strength

mysteryDetails.name: Severing the Links
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The silver strands of Atlach-Nacha's web siphon arcane energy from across the glove into the ever-growing web, threading the Spider-mother's path through a vast network of alien stars.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: Whenever an investigator passes a {{Lore

mysteryDetails.name: Shroud of the Spider-Mother
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Atlach-Nacha lurks far below the slopes of Voormithadreth. There she weaves her silken shroud, stitching the dreams of the Ancient Ones into the folds of reality, heralding the end-times of man.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Research Encounter, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Sleeper of N'kai
mysteryDetails.flavorText: In the deep hollows of the earth, in the lightless cavern of N'Kai, a squat, toad-like abomination commands formless servants to venture forth and bring him living flesh as a tribute to his horrific splendor.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, spawn the Sleeper of N'kai Epic Monster on space 9.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if the Sleeper of N'Kai Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

mysteryDetails.name: The Brood
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Birthed by Atlach-Nacha in the dark cavities of Cykranosh, the myriad hatchlings dwell in the space between, appearing only to prey on the dreamers that become caught in their mother's ever-expanding web.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
If an investigator would gain an Artifact, he may gain the Crux of Cykranosh Artifact instead.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, an investigator with the Crux of Cykranosh Artifact may lure the Spider-mother's brood into the open; spawn The Brood Epic Monster on his space.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if The Brood Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

name: Azathoth
shortDescription: The Idiot God sits at the center of all things spreading madness and death. Its seeds descend from the stars, threatening to crack the world in half.
lore:
In the heart of the cosmos, where the boundaries of reality blur into a chaotic abyss, there lies an entity of unimaginable horror—a blind, mindless deity that embodies the very essence of cosmic madness. This is the tale of Azathoth, the Nuclear Chaos, whose mindless existence threatens to unravel the fabric of the universe itself.

Azathoth, the Daemon Sultan, resides at the center of the universe in a nightmarish realm known as the Court of Azathoth. An accursed throne amidst the swirling chaos, surrounded by an entourage of mindless, formless servitors that dance in a frenzied, eternal revelry. In the cosmic symphony of chaos, Azathoth is the conductor, orchestrating the discordant melodies that echo through the cosmos.

Legend tells of the perilous journey through the void, where reckless sorcerers and astral travelers, driven by insatiable curiosity, sought the forbidden knowledge that lay hidden at the center of all existence. As they delved deeper into the cosmic tapestry, the air grew thick with the oppressive weight of impending dread.

At the threshold of the Court of Azathoth, where the boundaries between reality and insanity wavered, the seekers beheld a sight that defied reason—a maddening dance of formless entities, gyrating and swirling in an endless pandemonium. And at the center, enthroned in blasphemous majesty, Azathoth, the Daemon Sultan, slumbered in a state of perpetual oblivion.

It is said that the mind of Azathoth is an abyss, a void that consumes all reason and sanity. Its dreams are the chaotic nightmares that seep into the fabric of the universe, whispering madness to those unfortunate enough to listen. The very existence of Azathoth teeters on the brink of annihilation, a cataclysmic force that, if awakened, would spell doom for reality itself.

In the darkest corners of forbidden tomes, the name Azathoth is spoken only in hushed, terrified whispers. Those who seek to invoke its name or unravel the mysteries of its accursed realm risk a descent into the abyss of lunacy. The very thought of Azathoth, the Nuclear Chaos, is enough to send shivers down the spines of even the most seasoned scholars of the arcane.

And so, the legend of Azathoth persists—a harrowing tale of cosmic horror that warns of the dangers that lie at the heart of the universe. To tread too close to the Nuclear Chaos is to court madness, for in the maddening dance of Azathoth's court, the boundaries between nightmare and reality dissolve, leaving only the void of eternal, mindless chaos.
gameplayRules:
*When the Omen advances to the space of the Omen track, advance by 1 for each on that space.
* When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Azathoth awakens, flip this sheet and resolve the "The World is Devoured!" effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Azathoth's sheet
setupInstructions: Place on the space of the Omen track.
awakeningFlavor: Earthquakes and volcanic eruptions tear the Earth's crust apart at a rate faster than the devastation can be recorded or comprehended. As the planet's atmosphere grows increasingly toxic, the insects of Shaggai return to their ships and teleport away, anxious to doom a different world. Eventually, when every living thing on the planet has been reduced to a cinder, a new Outer God emerges from the ruins and joins Azathoth's court at the center of all things.
finalMystery: * When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.

city.description: Inside a warehouse, you hear a clanging sound and discover a creature that resembles a metallic crate walking around on several legs. You try to follow the thing back to the cult's lair (-1). If you pass, gain this and 1 additional Clue.
