A few hours before the performance of the opera Massa di Requiem per Shuggay you have a chance to examine the libretto (). If you pass, you recognize that it's a ritual that honors Azathoth and stop the performance; gain this . If you fail, the performance calls to Azathoth; place on the space of the Omen track.

Scientists report that their sample of radium was stolen! Your investigation indicates a connection to worshippers of Azathoth (). If you pass, you discover signs of cult activity; gain this . If you fail, the scientists tell you what horrors the thieves might unleash using the radium; lose .

A team of geologists have disappeared after studying a chunk of rock that was retrieved from a nearby crater. You visit their lab and feel waves of strange energy emanating from the stone, eroding your body from the inside (). If you pass, you safely examine the green stone; gain this . If you fail, you are forced to leave the area; gain an Internal Injury Condition.

Doctors ask you to observe a trephination. They pull away a piece of his skull, and you examine the brain (). If you pass, you spot an insect-like creature; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you don't see the shan, and it overpowers your mind; shuffle a solved Mystery at random into the deck.

You attend a reading by Edward Pickman Derby from his book Azathoth and Other Horrors and ask him about the occult (). If you pass, gain this . If you fail, he feigns innocence, but later reports the questions to the Cult of the Skull; advance the Omen by 1.

Something in your brain is manipulating your memories, trying to control you (). If you pass, a partially insubstantial insect flies out of your head, leaving knowledge of an alien planet; gain this . If you fail, you can't tell which of your memories are real; gain an Amnesia Condition.

The university allows you to use its telescope to search for signs of a green comet (-1). If you pass, gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you find nothing, looking through the endless depths of space; become Delayed.

With all the lights in the city, you might not notice the comet streaking toward you (-1). If you pass, you safely avoid the impact and can examine the greenish stone; gain this . If you fail, you are caught in the comet's explosive impact; lose .

In a dusty bookstore you find many volumes that seem to create a puzzle (-2). If you pass, you reorganize the tomes to their proper order, revealing a ritual that predicts the future; gain this and move the Omen token to any space on the track without advancing Doom.

You find an astrological calendar among the curios in the back room of an antique store (-1). If you pass, you discover the device can be used to predict the movements of the stars; discard this and move the Omen token to any space on the track without advancing Doom.

The local authorities ask for your assistance in investigating a strange green mist that has settled in an alley (). If you pass, you discover the mist originates from a meteorite; gain this . If you fail, the vapor insinuates itself into your lungs; lose and gain an Internal Injury Condition.

Inside the restricted section of the library, the book you sought is suddenly engulfed in green flames. To claim the ancient text, you will have to bow to the will of Tulzscha. You may spend and gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 Tome Artifact.

You find a safe house used by the shan, but you don't see any signs of their alien technology (). If you pass, you find a secret panel leading to their laboratory; gain this . If you fail, the shan continue their work; place on the space of the Omen track.

You attend the opera Massa di Requiem per Shuggay and attempt to convince the authorities to stop the show (). If you pass, gain this . If you fail, the opera continues; advance by 1 for each Gate on the game board that corresponds to the current Omen.

The maestro possesses the original libretto for notorious opera. You sneak backstage during intermission and steal it. Gain the Massa di Requiem per Shuggay Artifact. You search the pages for the knowledge you seek (-2). If you pass, gain this . If you fail, the libretto's contents wrack your mind; lose .

You meet with a former colleague who has studied the occult and speak with him at length about your findings (-1). If you pass, he shares what he knows; gain this . If you fail, he later betrays you, selling your secrets to the mi-go; gain a Paranoia Condition.

You track worshipers of Tulzscha to an abandoned warehouse and observe their ritual, but the cultists notice you and attack. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you dedicate their ritual to memory; gain this . If you fail the test, the robed figures torture you for information; advance the Omen by 1.

You search the shelves of the dusty bookstore for the rumored tome (). If you pass, you discover the tome and find it contains information about the Court of Azathoth; discard from the Omen track. If you fail, you discover something too horrible to image; lose for each Eldritch token on the Omen track.

You are contacted by a man who claims to be an occult researcher. The man seems almost too willing to exchange information with you (). If you pass, his notes are illuminating, but he reports your findings to the Cult of Green Flame; gain this and place on the space of the Omen track.

A police car has been overturned by a Xiclotlan. You race to rescue the men trapped inside ()! If you pass, the grateful officers share everything they know about the alien creature; gain this . If you fail, the gray monstrosity attacks you; lose .

A noted astronomer has made claims that the end times predicted by the stars are drawing nearer. After studying his notes, you come to the same conclusion. Gain this and place on the space of the Omen track.

You seek help from the local Silver Twilight Lodge (-1). If you pass, they consult their occult texts; gain this and move the Omen token to any space on the track without advancing Doom. If you fail, their psychic attacks leave you dazed, and you awake in jail; lose and gain a Detained Condition.

You scour countless tomes for a way to keep Azathoth at bay, but they only confirm your worst fears. Advance the Omen by 1. Your only hope is a text that suggests truth can be found in madness. You may spend to gain this . }

wilderness.description: A meteor exploded in the air, scattering a glowing green powder. You try to find a sufficient amount of the compound (-1). If you pass, gain this and move the Omen token to any space on the track without advancing Doom. If you fail, you are exposed to the terrible energy emanating from the substance; lose .

Mi-go have dug up the meteor that you were seeking. Curious, you attempt to spy on them (). If you pass, you see them use the stones as a power source; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, they shoot you with a weapon that leaves you unconscious for hours; gain an Amnesia Condition.

An eerie mist surrounds you, and you find yourself in the court of Azathoth! Gain this . Your mind can barely endure what you are seeing (). If you pass, you return to Earth with your mind intact; discard from the Omen track. If you fail, lose .
This far away from city lights, you get an unparalleled view of the night sky. You comb the sky, hoping to catch sight of a meteor shower (). If you pass, gain this and spawn 1 Clue.

You discover a twenty-foot tall, gray metallic cone! Gain this . You try to make sense of the alien technology inside (-1). If you pass, you manage to operate the shan technology; discard from the Omen track.

You examine an odd cave painting by torchlight. It depicts Azathoth sitting on throne in the center of a starry spiral. You search for any signs of the painting's source (). If you pass, you quickly find pottery shards; gain this . If you fail, your torch eventually goes out, and you begin to hear the sound of a flute; advance the Omen by 1.

You ask the villagers about their peculiar folklore (). If you pass, you recognize references to cannibalistic rituals in honor of Azathoth; gain this . If you fail, something about the food they offer you is disturbing; lose .

Something attacks you in the dark. Lose . To your eyes, there's nothing around you but trees (). If you pass, you discover a metallic gray tree with evenly spaced branches and identity a strange alien from the planet Xicloti; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, it strikes you again; gain a Back Injury Condition.

You discover an obelisk at the center of a spiraling nexus of stones (-1). If you pass, you decipher ancient runes that mention the Court of Azathoth; gain this and discard from the Omen track. If you fail, the site confuses and unsettles you; lose .

A jet of noxious, green gas erupts from the ground, and you struggle to remain conscious (-1). If you pass, you find a small chunk of green stone buried here; gain this . If you fail, the fumes cause you to pass out, and the meteorite is gone when you awake; lose .

In the dark of the night, a voice whispers alien secrets to you. Gain this . You feel compelled to obey the voice's demands (-2). If you fail, a shan steals your memories and flies off to do the same to your colleagues; investigators as a group discard Clues equal to the number of Gate on the game board that corresponds to the current Omen.

You discover a cache of oddities buried in a shallow grave. Some of your findings remind you of references to the Outer Gods you've seen in your studies (-1). If you pass, you find a flute imbued with powerful magic; gain the Flute of the Outer Gods Artifact.

You track a family under the control of the shan back to their farm (). If you pass, you observe them and learn of their plans; gain this . If you fail, they take notice, beating you and leaving in the wild; lose and gain an Internal Injury Condition.

An old hermit has been taken over by the shan, and he suddenly assaults you (-1). If you pass, you keep your calm during the surprise attack and take note of the alien language he's speaking; gain this . If you fail, the attack leaves you frightened; gain a Paranoia Condition.

You come across a crater and examine the strange, green meteorite that created it. As you search, you hardly notice you're being watch (-1). If you pass, you quickly leave the area with your findings; gain this . If you fail, a maniac attacks you; gain an Internal Injury Condition.

You track a group of cultists that worship the Green Flame (). If you pass, you are able to watch their ritual; gain this . If you fail, the cultists evade your pursuit and invoke Tulzscha; place on the space of the Omen track.

In your dream, you are dragged down a spiraling vortex to the center of chaos. Amorphous creatures dance to monotonous piping, encircling a being of absolute horror (). If you pass, gain this . If you fail, lose for each Gate on the game board that corresponds to the current Omen.

You explore a strange, conical temple of alien architecture (-1). If you pass, you discover an idol of the Idiot God; gain this and discard from the Omen track. If you fail, you feel alien thoughts imprinting themselves on your mind; advance the Omen by 1.

You have infiltrated the cult of the Green Flame, and you subtly try to disrupt the ritual (-1). If you pass, you learn much from your espionage; gain this . If you fail, the ritual is completed; place on the space of the Omen track.

You hide nearby and watch a group of cultists that burst into viridian flames before burrowing into the earth (). If you pass, gain this . If you fail, a pillar of green fire erupts beneath your feet; lose for each on the Omen track.

A former madman has lived in quiet seclusion since part of his brain was surgically removed. You ask him about his experiences (-1). If you pass, he tells you about the insect that used to live in his head; move the Omen token to any space on the track without advancing Doom.

You find the charred remains of a lunatic who was devoted to Azathoth. You search for some hint about his purpose (-1). If you pass, you stumble across a thickly bound tome; discard this and gain the Cultes des Goules Artifact. If you fail, his sacrifice cannot be undone; advance the Omen by 1.

The hermit's skin seems to writhe unnaturally. He'll help you, if you're willing to strike a bargain. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this . If you do not gain the Condition, the man collapses into a conglomeration of worms; place on the space of the Omen track.

You've been led into a trap! A tall figure wielding a powerful, ancient weapon attacks you (-1). If you pass, you manage to wrestle the weapon away and escape with your life; gain this and 1 Weapon Artifact. If you fail, lose for each Gate on the game board that corresponds to the current Omen. }

sea.description: You overhear the navigator say that the stars are not as they should be. The ship is utterly lost. You believe you understand the significance of the new alignment of stars (). If you pass, gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you become Delayed.
Your ship is destroyed by a glowing rock that fell from the sky! Gain this . You struggle to reach wreckage that can keep you afloat (). If you fail, the undertow pulls you underwater; lose .

You dream of floating through space, watching stars disappear. You try to recognize constellations so you'll remember which stars disappeared (). If you pass, gain this and move the Omen to any space of the track without advancing Doom.
The Nemesis Moon, Ghroth, looms in the sky. You don't know why it's here, but you know that it is the harbinger of doom. Gain this and place on the space of the Omen track.

You wake up to find a large, winged creature in your cabin. It offers you an object to use in your fight against Azathoth. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and the T'tka Halot Artifact.

You watch a meteor shower streak across the night sky (). If you pass, you see their source is a large, dark moon that's getting closer; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, advance the Omen by 1.

A volcano throws smoke and burning ash into the air. Despite the toxic fumes, you force yourself to continue watching (). If you pass, you watch a new island form; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, gain an Internal Injury Condition.

A pale, blubbery-looking sailor tells you of a dream he's been having about a green stone at the bottom of the ocean. Gain this . You try to use his description to determine the actual location (). If you pass, move the Omen token to any space of the track without advancing Doom.

As the storm clouds clear from the night sky, the moon looks larger than usual and is giving off a reddish glow (-1). If you pass, you recognize Ghroth, the Nemesis Moon; gain this . If you fail, you cannot hear the Music of the Spheres; advance the Omen by 1.

One of Azathoth's lizard-like servitors is on this island playing its pipes. You try to recall a way to stop it (-1). If you pass, you perform a banishing ritual; retreat by 1. If you fail, it continues calling to Azathoth; place on the space of the Omen track.

All plant and animal life on this small island has been killed, reduced to black dust. You search for the source of this cataclysm (-1). If you pass, you find the stone altar where someone was foolish enough to invoke Azathoth; gain this .

On a small island you discover a star calendar. You examine the calendar and surrounding area (-1). If you pass, you find the calendar associates the stars to periods of time; gain this and discard from the Omen track. If you fail, the island remains a mystery to you; lose .

You attempt to subdue a madman who is threatening the captain of the ship (-1). If you pass, you detain the man and search his cabin; gain this . If you fail, the lunatic disappears, and the ship is badly damaged by an explosion; move this Clue to an adjacent space and become Delayed.

As you study the stars in the night sky, a member of the ship's crew attacks you in the dark (). If you pass, a shan flees from the sailor's brain; gain this . If you fail, you are savaged by the man until the other crew members can restrain him; lose and gain a Back Injury Condition.

A member of the ship's crew is under the sway of the shan. You try to throw him in the brig (-1). If you pass, you search his cabin and discover star charts; gain this . If you fail, he escapes your restraints and attacks you; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You find a dilapidated shrine to the Outer Gods on a deserted island. The work is arduous, but you attempt to rebuild the shrine (-1). If you pass, the restored shrine should appease the Outer Gods; discard this and move the Omen token to any space on the track without advancing Doom.

You search the night sky for cosmic omens (-1). If you pass, you see bizarre constructs floating high in the air; gain this . If you fail, you feel as if your consciousness is being transported across space; gain a Hallucinations Condition.

You discover a shrine on a deserted island that empowers the Daemon Sultan. Destroying the alter will require more than brute force (). If you fail, you cannot remove the magic; advance by 1 for each on the Omen track.

You know a cultist of Tulzscha is aboard the ship. You consider searching his belongings while he's on deck. You may gain this . If you gained the Clue, he returns unexpectedly; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

Out here, away from the city's lights, you can see clearly that the stars have shifted more than you had predicted. Gain this , then move the Omen token to any space on the track and advance by 1 for each Gate on the game board that corresponds to the current Omen.

You attempt to perform a complex ritual to steal power from the Idiot God (). Roll 1 less die for each Gate on the game board that corresponds to the current Omen. If you pass, gain this and discard from the Omen track. If you fail, your body becomes a conduit for negative energy; gain a Cursed Condition.

A number of comets fall on a nearby chain of island. You rush to collect them (). Roll 1 less die for each on the Omen track. If you pass, you are able to study the meteorites; gain this . If you fail, the seeds of Azathoth remain undiscovered; advance the Omen by 1.

You talk to an old sailor who recognizes the name Azathoth (-1). If you pass, he tells you of a traveler who granted wishes to those who wrote their names in the Book of Azathoth; gain this . He says no good ever came to those who did.

A small child excitedly points to the sky and tells you to make a wish. You scan the horizon to find the shooting star (-2). If you pass, gain this and move the Omen token to any space on the track without advancing Doom. }

mysteryDetails.name: Occult Research
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The shan are controlling innocent victims everywhere, using them to call forth Azathoth.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Research Encounter, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Omen of Devastation
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The Nemesis Moon appears in the night sky, visible to all and heralding an imminent doom.{{Ref
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When an investigator closes a Gate that corresponds to the current Omen, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Seed of the Daemon Sultan
mysteryDetails.flavorText: A strange green comet has fallen from the sky. Even after the impact, the meteorite continues to slowly burrow itself deeper into the earth.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place the {{Icon|mystery

mysteryDetails.name: The Green Flame
mysteryDetails.flavorText: In response to the cult's invocation, a jet of green flame emerged from the fissure, racing across the ceiling and walls as if a living thing.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, spawn the Tulzscha Epic Monster on a random space.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if the Tulzscha Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

mysteryDetails.name: The True Name
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Fragments of Azathoth's true name exist in long forgotten tomes. It is said that if a person speaks his name aloud three times, the blasphemous sound will grant the speaker great power.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place a number of {{Icon|eldritch tokens

mysteryDetails.name: Voice of Azathoth
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Most musicians describe this 18th century Italian opera as unplayable. It comes as no surprise that the composer was executed for heresy.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When an investigator would gain an Artifact, he may gain the Massa di Requiem per Shuggay Artifact instead.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, an investigator may spend {{icon|clues

name: Cthulhu
shortDescription: Eons ago, Cthulhu came from the stars with his Star Spawn brethren. He now sleeps in the sunken city of R'lyeh, waiting for the stars to be right to rise again.
lore: The Great Old One Cthulhu is arguably the most famous of H.P. Lovecraft's creations.
gameplayRules:
* When an investigator moves onto a space containing an , he becomes Delayed and loses .
* : Each investigator on a space that does not contain an places an Eldritch token on his space.
* When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Cthulhu awakens, flip this sheet.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Cthulhu's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside 1 Deep One Monster, 1 Star Spawn Monster, and all Cthulhu Special Encounter cards.
awakeningFlavor: At last the time has come, the deep ones have broken the elder sign that kept their master asleep. Cthulhu rises again, and madness fills the dreams of every living thing.
finalMystery: * When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
appearance: He is typically described as having the head of an octopus, wings of a dragon, and a body of a man, with two arms and two legs (one of the more anthropomorphic of the old ones).
residence: At his house in R'lyeh, dead Cthulhu waits dreaming. Eons ago, Cthulhu came to the earth with his star spawn. Together they waged a war against the Elder Things, driving them back into the Antarctic. Some time later a great cataclysm sunk many of the star spawn's great cities, including their greatest city of all, R'lyeh, where the high priest Cthulhu sat his mighty throne. This corresponds to Space 3 on the board.
source: The Call of Cthulhu, H.P. Lovecraft, 1928.

city.description: The librarian tells you that the book you're looking for was checked out by someone named Mr. Marsh. You scout the city to find him before he leaves town (). If you pass, you manage to steal the book from his hotel room; gain this . If you fail, move this Clue to the nearest space.

You recognize allusions to Cthulhu in a sculptor's recent works. You speak to the artist about his inspirations (). If you pass, gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, he tells you a terrible vision of the future; lose .

The police ask for help in tracking down a cultist sect (-1). If you pass, you help them launch a midnight raid; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the cult foils your investigation and rob your hotel; discard 1 Item Asset.

A man tells you about his terrible dreams of underwater cities. You suspect you understand the source of such nightmares (). If you pass, you warn him about his heritage; gain this . If you fail, a Deep One Monster ambushes you.

You dream of a city built from massive green stones set at non-Euclidean angles. You try to retain as many details as you can to investigate when you wake up (). If you pass, you identify the location by the stars overhead; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the details of the dream are too horrible to remember; lose .

After the police raid a local Order of Dagon, you have a chance to search the temple (). If you pass, you find ledgers and historical documents; gain this and a Mists of Releh Spell. If you fail, you feel the statues and icons in the building staring at you; gain a Paranoia Condition.

The cult of Cthulhu anticipated your arrival. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, gain this . If you do not defeat it, you cannot recall how you escaped; gain an Amnesia Condition and move this Clue to the nearest space.

You see dozens of people with the distinct features of deep one hybrids. They watch you constantly, and you'll have to fight to escape (). If you pass, you identify more families descended from deep ones; gain this . If you fail; they attack and turn you over to the police; lose and gain a Detained Condition.

Your guide leads you into a blind alley and attacks you. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you take a medallion adorned with dragons and octopuses; gain this . If you do not defeat it, you wake up on a ship; gain an Amnesia Condition and move to the nearest space.

You hear a piteous croak and see a deep one examining itself in the mirror. A Deep One Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, he speaks to you just long enough to share who he used to be; gain this .

In your dreams, you explore a city under the ocean. Deep ones guide you to a lavish throne room where the mighty Dagon offers you a bargain. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition. If you gain the Condition, you wake up next to a strange text; gain 1 Tome Artifact.

The police are forced to release the ringleader cult. You argue to keep him in custody (). If you pass, you are able to interrogate him; gain this . If you fail, he visits your dreams before he disappears; lose and move this Clue to the nearest space.

When you touch the strange stone idol, you feel it trying to drain your life force (-1). If you pass, you know how Cthulhu draws strength from his followers; gain this . If you fail, part of your life experiences disappear; lose and discard all Improvement tokens.

Gangsters have locked you and an informant in a warehouse with a creature from the sea. A Deep One Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you have a conversation with the informant before the deep one kills him; gain this .
After reading the journalist's notes about Cthulhu worship, you dream about the great old one. When you wake up, you're on an island you've never seen before. Lose and move to the nearest space.

You talk to elderly sailors at a rest home (-1). If you pass, the retired sailors tell you an abundance of Cthulhu lore; gain this . If you fail, someone notices your frequent visits; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You hope to buy a controversial, new painting that depicts a creature rising from the sea (-1). If you pass, you study the details and then destroy it; gain this . If you fail, another buyer offers you a different deal; advance by 2 unless you gain a Dark Pact Condition.

You are visited by an old man named Marsh. He seems to know a lot about you and he offers you a deal. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this . If you do not gain the Condition, Marsh brought more members of his family; lose .

About to step back into your hotel room, something seems off to you (-1). If you pass, you notice that someone has picked the lock, and the police help arrest the cultists waiting for you; gain this . If you fail, you walk into a trap; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You read the logs of 18th century merchant ships trading with the deep ones. You become obsessed with the vivid tales of the lost cities and foul rituals (). If you pass, you manage to gather the dates and facts with a clear head; gain this . If you fail, lose and gain a Hallucinations Condition.

You see a photograph of a large stone tablet found on an obscure Pacific island. You try to translate the arcane writing carved into the tablet (). If you pass, you learn how to prepare for Cthulhu's return; improve 1 skill of your choice. If you fail, you cannot interpret the text; advance by 1.
The anthropologist you were supposed to meet has gone missing. His office has been torn apart and reeks of sea water and blood. Lose and move this Clue to the nearest space.

A doctor has you committed to his asylum, and you appeal to the local authorities to free you as soon as possible (). If you pass, you identify the doctor as a priest of Dagon; gain this . If you fail, your release takes too long; lose and gain an Amnesia Condition.

You ask police inspector John Legrasse about his experiences with the cults (-1). If you pass, he gives you a file with information; gain this . If you fail, a cult member overhears him shouting at you, and you suffer with horrific dreams that night; lose and gain a Hallucinations Condition. }

wilderness.description: In a remote area, you discover an ancient ritual underway stop to observe. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, the cultists abandon their ritual; gain this . If you do not defeat it, you are incorporated into the ceremony; gain a Cursed Condition.

This cavern collapsed thousands of years ago. Your excavations reveal ritual carvings that you think correspond to modern cults (-1). If you pass, you gain insight into the cult of Cthulhu; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you contemplate how long the worshipers of Cthulhu have waited for their master; lose .

You uncover an ancient stone statue of Cthulhu carved from an unknown green stone. Just looking at it threatens your mental stability (). If you pass, you examine the statue thoroughly; gain this . If you fail, you stare at the horrific carving in horror; gain a Hallucinations Condition.

You try to track down an old hermit who supposedly knows the secrets of Cthulhu's cults (). If you pass, the man is insane, but his stories prove accurate; gain this . If you fail, the man has been taken by pirates; move this Clue to the nearest space;

You try to interpret the strange constellations in the night sky above you (-1). If you pass, you understand the occult phenomenon that is coming to pass; gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, the stars tell you nothing; move this Clue to the nearest space.

Cultists have snuck into your camp, trying to steal your equipment (). If you pass, you catch one of them and get a chance to question him; gain this . If you fail, discard 2 Item Assets and move this Clue to the nearest space.

You have a vivid dream of R'lyeh and fear that you won't be able to wake up if you can't find your way out of the city (). If you pass, the dream provides you insight into R'lyeh; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you remain unconscious for a day; lose and become Delayed.

The mi-go have lured you into the wild to put an end to your investigation. You try to drive the creatures off before they can do any lasting damage (). If you pass, gain this . If you fail, become Delayed and move this Clue to the nearest space.

One of the serpent people contacts you telepathically to make a deal and share information about the deep ones. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this . If you do not gain the Condition, you soon regret it; lose and gain a Poisoned Condition.

You follow the trail of thieves who have stolen some golden jewelry (-1). If you pass, you recover the loot while they sleep; gain this . If you fail, a priest of Dagon reaches them first, and you don't recall much after that; gain an Amnesia Condition and move this Clue to the nearest space.

You search the night sky to see where the stars are aligned (-1). If you pass, you see the patterns; gain this and discard from a space of your choice. If you fail, you carelessly stumble into a ravine; lose and gain a Leg Injury Condition.

Cultists dance around a statue of Cthulhu. You try to steal the idol without being seen (). If you pass, you bring it back for study; gain this . If you fail, the cultists assault you before vanishing into the night; lose and move this Clue to the nearest space.

A truck filled with deep one hybrids has followed you. As they get close, the smell becomes hard to endure (-1). If you pass, you stay quiet and eavesdrop on their conversation; gain this . If you fail, they catch you and put you on a ship; lose and move to the nearest space.

An old man has locked himself in a cell in the wilds because he fears becoming a deep one. You speak to him in the final stages of the change. Lose . You listen carefully as he describes what he sees (-1). If you pass, discard from a space of your choice.

You wake up to find a circle of candles and shells around your tent. A green statue of Cthulhu has been placed just inside the circle. Gain a Cursed Condition. You're terrified to touch the idol (). If you pass, you take it for later study; gain this .

You find an elder thing searching through your belongings. It takes particular notice of a map you've drawn. Discard from a space of your choice. You try to communicate with it (-2). If you fail, it throws you aside; lose and gain a Back Injury Condition.

You pay your penny at the carnival to see a sideshow exhibit, a "fish-man". After the show you attempt to sneak into the tent (-1). If you pass, you hear the deep one talking to itself; gain this . If you fail, the creature notices you snooping around; a Deep One Monster ambushes you!

In an underground chamber you find the bodies of both serpent people and deep ones. Just as you wonder if there were any survivors, you are assaulted. A Deep One Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you find secrets of arcane science in the serpent people's laboratory; gain 1 Spell.
You finally reach the wreckage of the plane. There are no survivors, and it looks as if someone already stole the ocean maps you were seeking. Lose and move this Clue to the nearest space.

With the cult nowhere to be seen, you hope to take their stone idol without being noticed (-1). If you pass, you escape with the idol; gain this . If you fail, you sink into quicksand, and some of your possessions are irretrievably lost before you escape; discard 2 Item possessions.

You explore an abandoned village that appears to have torn itself apart (). If you pass, you discover the residents had faught over an ornate, golden knife; gain this . If you fail, you find a golden knife too beautiful to leave behind and cut yourself in your ferver to claim it; lose and gain a Cursed Condition.

An altar to Cthulhu is perched over an underground river. If you get too close, it may collapse (-1). If you pass, you find a safe path to study the altar; gain this . If you fail, the ground slides into the water; gain a Leg Injury Condition and move this Clue to the nearest space.

Everyone in this village has the Innsmouth look. You'll have to sneak away if you hope to leave (-1). If you pass, you escape; gain this . If you fail, you're stuck in your hiding place and must endure hearing their blasphemous rituals at night; lose and gain a Paranoia Condition.

Since you last replenished your supplies, you've had trouble focusing. You search for a possible explanation (). If you pass, you discover a small, gold disk was slipped in with your provisions; gain this . If you fail, your mental state deteriorates; lose and gain a Hallucinations Condition. }

sea.description: You wake up on a reef with no sign of your ship. An enormous star spawn rises from the sea and places its thought into your mind. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and a Mists of Releh Spell. If you do not, discard this Clue and a Star Spawn Monster ambushes you.

Looking across the water, you see visions of an ancient island city populated by horrible creatures. The city is horrible to behold (). If you pass, you learn about R'lyeh; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, your mind cannot stand the sight; gain a Hallucinations Condition.

In the middle of the night you see an army of deep ones climbing in and out of the water (-1). If you pass, you wait until they're gone and then search the area; gain the Grotesque Statue Artifact. If you fail, lose and a Deep One Monster ambushes you.

Your ship encounters another vessel engaged in deep-sea excavation. You sneak aboard their craft to see what they've found (). If you pass, you see strangely-crafted golden jewelry; gain this . If you fail, the divers catch you and throw you into their brig; gain a Detained Condition.

Some dark shape is moving under the waves (). If you pass, you avoid the creature; gain this . If you fail, your ship is thrown into the air; a Star Spawn Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, retreat by 1.

You listen intently as the island natives tell a folktale (-1). If you pass, you recognize it as a description of how the elder things fought Cthulhu; gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, the story has a damaging effect on your mind; gain a Hallucinations Condition.

As you stare across the water, a webbed hand reaches from below the surface and grabs your leg! A Deep One Monster ambushes you. If you defeat it, gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you do not defeat it, gain a Leg Injury Condition.

During the night, you hear the sounds of the crew battleing some unseen enemy. Suddenly, you are face-to-face with one of the fish-like monstrosities! Gain this and lose . A Deep One Monster ambushes you. If you defeat it, you find an odd relic; gain the Ruby of R'lyeh Artifact.

A man stands on the reef, holding a golden sword and surrounded by the corpses of deep ones. About to boast, he is interrupted by a Star Spawn that rises from the water and devours him. Discard this Clue and gain the Sword of Y'ha-talla Artifact, then a Star Spawn Monster ambushes you!

Cultists have taken the ship. Only one of them stands between you and an escape craft. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, the man bows obediently, offering his help; gain this . If you do not have a Dark Pact Condition, a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

A passenger has fallen asleep on the deck and is talking in his sleep. You try to hear what he's saying (-1). If you pass, you hear him praise Dagon; gain this . If there is an on your space, his unconscious prayers were heard; a Deep One Monster ambushes you!

In your dream, you've become a deep one and hear Cthulhu in your head. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, lose and . You try to focus on hearing Cthulhu's message (-2). If you pass, gain this and 1 additional Clue.

A cultist calls for help. A Deep One Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, the creature kills the cultists, who was holding an odd item; gain 1 Magical Artifact. If you do not defeat the Monster, you are traumatized; gain a Hallucinations Condition.

A sailor tells you about a new island that has started to emerge in the South Pacific. Advance by 1. The story is facinating, but as he continues, the tale grows more difficult to listen to. You may spend to listen until the end. If you spend the Sanity, the tale proves useful to your investigation; gain this .

The ship's doctor says that you've been in a coma and that there is no Cthulhu or cult (-1). If you pass, you aren't fooled and get him to reveal secrets about the cult; gain this . If you fail, you doubt your identity and experiences; gain a Paranoia Condition and discard all Improvement tokens.

Cthulhu's gaze falls upon this island. If there is an on your space, discard all Improvement tokens. You search the caverns on the island (). If you pass, you find stone tablets that tell the story of R'lyeh; gain this . If you fail, you awaken a star spawn in the depths of the cave; a Star Spawn Monster ambushes you!

At the highest point of the island, the stones seem to be organized in a particular pattern (-1). If you pass, you see a central stone is marked with an elder sign; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you accidentally disturb the protective ward; a Star Spawn Monster ambushes you!

A creature that has climbed aboard the ship seems somehow familiar. Discard 1 defeated investigator token from the game board, then a Deep One Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, the fate of your colleague haunts you; lose and gain this . If you do not defeat it, advance by 1.

The deep ones are searching the island for you and can sense the mark of the great old one (-1). Roll 2 less dice if you have a Dark Pact Condition. If you pass, you somehow escape with your findings; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you endure a grisly ordeal; resolve the effect on each Condition you have.

You try to undo a hex cast by a passenger (-1). If you pass, gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you can only redirect the hex to yourself; lose and unless you shuffle a solved Mystery into the deck.

The high priest of Dagon summoned the Lurker at the Threshold to this island to make a desperate bargain. You can make a deal of your own, however. Shuffle a solved Mystery into the deck unless you gain a Dark Pact Condition.

The captain says that there's been an occult-related murder. You are warned that the victim's cabin is an extremely gruesome scene. You may spend to search the room. If you spend the Sanity, you discover a tome that pertains to your investigation; gain the De Vermis Mysteriis Artifact.

The ship's captain is acting suspiciously. You spy on his cabin at night (-1). If you pass, you find him bartering with a deep one and question him later; gain this . If you fail, a Deep One Monster ambushes you! If you do not defeat it, the captain's plan cannot be stopped; advance by 1.

From the island, you see the creature throw the ship away like a toy and then fly toward you. A Star Spawn Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you sense a bond between it and Cthulhu; gain this . If you defeat the Monster, you know its master felt the defeat; retreat by 1. }

mysteryDetails.name: Queen of the Deep Ones
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Mother Hydra rises from her home in Y'ha-nthlei to oversee the teeming masses of her children.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, spawn the Hydra Epic Monster on space 8.

When an investigator would gain an Artifact, he may gain the Sword of Y'ha-Talla Artifact instead.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if the Hydra Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

mysteryDetails.name: R'lyeh Risen
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Eons ago, the city of R'lyeh was plunged to the bottom of the ocean by some forgotten disaster. It has remained trapped there, waiting for the right time to resurface. Now, that moment has finally arrived.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place the {{Icon|mystery

mysteryDetails.name: The Deep Ones Attack!
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Terrible storms have battered fishing villages across the globe, but it's merely the prelude to an invading army of deep ones!
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, each investigator places {{Icon|et|1

mysteryDetails.name: The Stars Are Right!
mysteryDetails.flavorText: All around the world, Cthulhu's worshipers and those sensitive to his dreams have been plagued by madness. They rush to the sea to witness the Ancient One's return.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, move each {{Icon|clue

mysteryDetails.name: Threatening Seas
mysteryDetails.flavorText: All across the world, storms have formed over the many submerged cities that deep ones call home, such as Y'ha-nthlei and Ahu-Y'hloa.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, each investigator places {{Icon|et|1

mysteryDetails.name: Watching the Stars
mysteryDetails.flavorText: From the sunken city of Yhe, Cthylla rises to fulfill her destiny. Daughter of Cthulhu, she will give birth to the reincarnation of her father should his body ever be destroyed.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, spawn the Cthylla Epic Monster on space 12.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if the Cthylla Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

name: Elder Things
shortDescription: Eons ago, the elder things were driven underground by the changing climate, hibernating in the cities they had built into the mountains or in the depths of the ocean. With the disturbance of the Miskatonic Expedition, they have begun to reclaim the world they once dominated.
gameplayRules:
* After an investigator resolves an Other World Encounter, he may move to Plateau of Leng.
* When 4 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When advances to zero, flip this sheet and resolve the “A Dark God Awakens!” effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Rise of the Elder Things's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside all Rise of the Elder Things Special Encounters. Set up the Antarctica side board.
awakeningFlavor: It wasn't an invasion. The elder things were fleeing the wrath of a Dark God they had once controlled.
finalMystery:
As an encounter, if 4 Mysteries have been solved, an investigator on City of the Elder Things may confront the Dark God beyond the mountains; he draws and resolves A Dark God Special Encounter.
When there are on this sheet equal to half , the Final Mystery is solved and investigators win the game.

city.description: Professor Ellery is working on a device that blocks the psychic dominance of the elder things, but he needs funding in order to produce a prototype. You may gain a Debt Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

The city is alive with rumors of alien beings (). If you pass, you find a reliable source that points you towards a suspected hide-out; gain this . If you fail, your source betrays you; a Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you do not defeat it, you see the elder things have begun an invasion; advance by 1.

You pore over an ancient tome for hours, searching for references to the elder things (-1). If you pass, you uncover a reference to a previously unknown god; gain this and 1 random Tome Asset from the deck. If you fail, you search until morning and sleep through the next day; become Delayed.

A survivor of the Miskatonic Expedition is spotted drinking at a local bar. You join him in the hopes that he'll open up to you (-1). If you pass, he tells you everything he knows; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you drink too much; gain an Amnesia Condition.

You suspect the mayor is not in his right mind and search for evidence to convince the police (-1). If you pass, the mayor is removed from office; gain this . If you fail, he has one of his supporters "take care of you;" a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

The chief of police has allowed you to lead a raid on a suspected elder thing hideout (-1). If you pass, you free a group of slaves chained in the basement; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you barely escape with your life; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You've managed to locate a survivor of the Miskatonic Expedition in a local sanitarium. He is willing to tell you what he saw beyond the mountains. Gain this . You can hardly bear to listen to the horrifying tale (). If you pass, you may spend to gain 1 additional Clue.

A series of grisly beheadings has the city in an uproar (-1). If you pass, your investigation leads you to a laboratory where alien beings are being created, gain this . If you fail, your investigation makes you the next target; gain 1 Pursuit Condition.

The homeless have been disappearing. You stake out the city park in the hopes of discovering where they've all gone (). If you pass, you uncover an elder thing internment camp; gain this . If you fail, you find the missing citizens, but they attack you; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You discover that a number of Professor Lake's research notes are up for auction this very night! The information inside may be vital, and you bid more than you can afford ()). If you pass, you may gain a Debt Condition to gain 1 Old Journal Unique Asset and 1 Tome Artifact.

You meet your companion in an abandoned warehouse only to find that he has betrayed you. Discard 1 Ally Asset, then an Elder Thing Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you question your former companion at length; gain this and retreat by 1.

The city is completely under the sway of the elder things, but the library contains a copy of Professor Dyer's expedition report. You must hide your fear to get past the librarian (). If you pass, gain this . If you fail, an angry mob forms to pursue you; gain 1 Pursuit Condition.

You've found an incantation that can disrupt the magical hold on the minds of the dominated citizens (-1). If you pass, you put the magic to great use; gain 1 Spell and retreat by 1. If you fail, the magic backfires; lose .

A mob is gathering outside of the city council, angry over the disappearance of several citizens. You attempt to calm the crowd (). If you pass, you listen to the crowd about their concerns; gain this . If you fail, things take a turn for the worse; lose and .

You pursue the thrall to the roof of the hotel. He jumps off the edge and lands on the roof of an adjacent building. You gather yourself for a mighty leap (). If you pass, you make the jump and tackle him; gain this . If you fail, you don't make the jump; lose .

You've become increasingly desperate in your fight against the elder things and are exploring darker measures. A member of the Silver Twilight Lodge offers you aid in combating the mind control of the elder things. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to improve and 1 other skill of your choice.

The cab driver strikes you as suspicious, but you cannot determine why (). If you pass, you realize the carved soapstone hanging from his mirror is a relic of the elder things; gain this . If you fail, you feel an alien presence invading your mind, and you awake in an alley; lose .

The mayor is speaking in codes, and you are convinced he is a target of mind control (-1). If you pass, you discover the mayor is a sorcerer battling the elder thing incursion; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, you misinterpret his warning; a Shoggoth Monster ambushes you!

The warehouse is supposed to be abandoned, but strange noises have been heard from inside (-1). If you pass, you discover a makeshift prison for humans and alert the authorities, gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you find nothing; advance by 1.

You notice strange lights coming from the local radio station. You investigate and find an elder thing device broadcasting an unknown signal (-1). If you pass, you successfully disable the device; gain this and 1 random Magical Asset from the deck. If you fail, your meddling causes a psychic backlash; lose .

A local newspaper runs a story endorsing further expeditions into the antarctic. You try to sneak into the newsroom (). If you pass, you meet the author of the article and interrogate him; gain this . If you fail, the police are called and arrest you; gain a Detained Condition.

You attend a meeting of the American Archaeological Society. Something about the way they speak and act seems alien (). If you pass, you resist their hypnosis; gain this . If you fail, you agree that humans and aliens can live in harmony; lose .

Professor Pabodie has offered to sell his innovative drill to you in order to further your investigation ( — 1). If you pass, you convince him to donate it instead; gain this . If you fail, he wants more than you anticipated; you may gain a Debt Condition to gain this Clue.

You have gone to consult with Dr. Ambrose Dexter, a professor of the occult, but his findings are difficult to interpret (-1). If you pass, he allows you access to his library; gain this and 1 random Tome Asset from the deck. If you fail, his mind is no longer his own and he hexes you; gain 1 Bane Condition. }

wilderness.description: You find someone wandering in the wild and notice that he is shackled. You attempt to remove the chains (-1). If you pass, he tells you of an elder thing camp and leads you there; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you strain your back trying to remove the chains; gain a Back Injury Condition.

You stumble across a mi-go camp (-1). If you pass, you discover a captured elder thing and realize the two sides are fighting; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the mi-go realize you are there; gain a Hunted Condition.

You uncover ancient ruins of unknown provenance and take you time studying them (). If you pass, you suspect the ruins are the remains of a destroyed city built by the elder things; gain this . If you fail, you tarry too long; you become Delayed.

You've fled into the wild in the hopes of escaping pursuit. The only way across a treacherous ravine is a rickety old rope bridge (). If you pass, you steel yourself and escape; gain this and 1 Pursuit Condition. If you fail, fear overwhelms you, and you fall; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You find an altar surrounded by carvings in a ruined city (-1). If you pass, you realize this settlement must have worshiped the Dark God; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the carvings creep into your mind; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You watch as a group of elder things assaults a mi-go patrol (-1). If you pass, you take note of how they fight; gain this and improve . If you fail, you get too close to the action and are seared by a stray shot from a beam weapon; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

While setting up camp near the ancient ruins, the members of your expedition begin to behave oddly. Gain this . You recognize the corrupting power of the elder things and are forced to flee; discard 1 Ally Asset.

A member of your crew went into a nearby cavern and hasn't been seen for hours (-1). If you pass, you discover that he had fallen down a chasm and rescue him and his research; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, he is never seen again; lose and discard 1 Ally Asset.

You've been lost in the ruins for days. In the heart of the abandoned city you discover a fountain and a basin of water (). If you pass, you resist drinking from the fountain and find your way out; gain this . If you fail, you are too thirsty to resist and drink the foul water; gain 1 Illness Condition.

There is an ancient tablet at the bottom of the ravine whose secrets you require. You look for a way down to retrieve it (). If you pass, you retrieve the tablet safely; gain this . If you fail, the path you've discovered is treacherous; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

Captured by the mi-go, you are surprised to find that they wish to communicate with you. Lose . They offer you weapons to fight the elder things in exchange for a favor; you may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain the Alien Device Artifact.

You hear a rustling in the tall grass and move to investigate (). If you pass, you are able to spy on a group of elder things and learn more about their biology; gain this . If you fail, they pursue you, and you twist your ankle in your haste to flee; lose and gain a Leg Injury Condition.

You've been tracking a shoggoth for days, hoping that it will lead you to the missing citizens (-1). If you pass, you find an elder thing camp and report it to the authorities; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you become lost in the woods; discard and become Delayed.

You find an ancient mural and attempt to decipher it (-1). If you pass, you discover the ritual is meant to summon creatures from another world; gain the Dhol Chants Artifact. If you fail, you wake up in a clearing with no memory of how you got there; gain an Amnesia Condition.

You find yourself in a vast, empty wasteland. A formless darkness swirls about you, and a sonorous voice commands you to set it free (-1). If you pass, you wake up in bed with knowledge of the Dark God; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, you are unable to resist; advance by 1.

A group of elder things is passing by your camp, unaware of your presence. You attempt to pursue them without being noticed (). If you pass, you follow them to their camp; gain this . If you fail, you begin to suspect that you are being led into an elaborate trap; gain a Paranoia Condition.

You find an elder thing outpost hidden in a cave. You may discard 1 Item possession and 1 Spell to create a magical explosive device and seal the cave. If you discard the possessions, retreat by 2. If you do not discard the possessions, an Elder Thing Monster ambushes you!

The shoggoth pipes and burbles as it charges towards you like a nightmarish freight train. You must remain calm to avoid it (). If you pass, you evade the creature and it breaks off its pursuit; gain this . If you fail, you flee aimless into the wild; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

The mi-go find you in the ruins of an ancient city. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, flip that Condition. Shaken by your encounter, you take refuge in a still-standing building for the night (-1). If you pass, you notice an elder thing carving; gain this .

A massive windstorm rages through the camp, damaging your equipment. Discard 1 Item possession. In the aftermath, you attempt to salvage what you can (). If you pass, you notice the tracks of elder things outside your camp; gain this .

You've been exploring the ancient city for hours. The sun has set, but you continue your investigation (). If you pass, you find a series of hieroglyphs; gain this . If you fail, you don't notice a trap before it is too late; lose and gain 1 Illness Condition.

You have located a staging ground for abducted humans, waiting to be shipped to Antarctica. You attempt to free the captives, but they relent. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you learn the victims are under the control of the elder things; gain this .

You plumb the depths of the cave and discover an old book on a small altar (-1). If you pass, you notice runes of warding around the book and dispel them; gain this and 1 random Tome Asset from the deck. If you fail, you set off the wards; gain a Cursed Condition.

In the dead of night, a member of the group suddenly attacks you (). If you pass, you are able to restrain him and break the control of the elder things; gain this . If you fail, you cannot stop him from following you; discard 1 Ally Asset. }

sea.description: Leaning against the deck railing at night, you hear a disturbing piping noise from the sea. You try to convince the captain to steer clear of it (). If you pass, the captain increases speed to leave the noise behind; gain this . If you fail, the sound unnerves you and the crew; lose .

You discover an elder thing has been smuggled aboard your ship. You attempt to uncover its purpose (-1). If you pass, you realize it is studying magic; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, the elder thing throws you overboard; lose and gain a Hypothermia Condition.

You realize that the ship's captain is a thrall of the elder things and try to free him from their dominance. You may discard 1 Spell to gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you do not discard the Spell, the captain reacts poorly; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

A cave in the side of the island's cliff houses an ornate shrine. You search for a path that leads to the cave (). If you pass, you learn more about the shackled god of the elder things; gain this . If you fail, you fall into the sea and have to swim back; gain a Hypothermia Condition.

One of the passengers is not what he seems (). If you pass, you realize that he is an agent of the elder things and steal a map from his cabin; gain this . If you fail, he realizes you are watching him and disappears, leaving you wondering if he existed at all; lose .

In the ship's cargo hold, you discover a jar containing a volatile black slime. Gain this . Another jar is broken and empty. A Proto-Shoggoth Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you are able to study the material at your leisure; gain 1 additional Clue.

You discover a derelict vessel adrift on the open ocean. You go aboard to investigate and discover that a member of the crew has gone insane and murdered the rest; a Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you free him from mind control, gain this .

The storm that surrounds the island doesn't seem natural. You are convinced some device of the elder things is causing the strange weather. You may discard 1 Spell to dispel the storm and explore the island. If you discard the Spell, you retrieve alien objects for study; gain this .

You hope to uncover a link in a human smuggling ring used by the elder things (-1). If you pass, you discover a map that shows a hidden route to Antarctica; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the smugglers return while you're still there; an Elder Thing Monster ambushes you!

You've followed the map this far. The tablet must be here somewhere (). If you pass, you discover a tablet regarding the Dark God; gain this . If you fail, you take too much time searching and overexert yourself rowing back to the ship; discard and gain a Back Injury Condition.

Standing between you and an elder thing tablet is a monstrous-looking penguin. You may discard 1 Item or Trinket possession to distract the penguin and reach the tablet. If you discard the Asset, gain this . If you do not discard the possession; a Giant Penguin Monster ambushes you!

The sunken wreckage contains an ancient relic. You just have to swim down to retrieve it (-1). If you pass, you are able to secure it and bring it on board; gain the Eltdown Shards Artifact. If you fail, you push yourself to the brink of exhaustion; lose and gain a Hypothermia Condition.

You've met Captain Douglas aboard his ship in the hopes that he can provide new information on the elder things (). If you pass, he tells you what he knows; gain this . If you fail, he doesn't trust you and throws you overboard; lose and gain a Hypothermia Condition.

Some members of the crew have been acting suspiciously since you left port. You sneak out of your cabin at night to observe them (-1). If you pass, you see them communicating with one of the elder things; gain this . If you fail, they catch you on deck; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You've found the relic, but it is locked behind a runic alien device (). If you pass, you decipher the runes and are able to retrieve the precious gemstone; gain the Crystal of the Elder Things Artifact. If you fail, you unleash the relic's guardian; a Shoggoth Monster ambushes you!

You have been caught in a storm and fear that you have been blown off course (). If you pass, you spot your island destination in a flash of lightning and correct your course; gain this . If you fail, you sail right by your destination and must circle back; become Delayed.

You corner an elder thing in the cargo hold. It turns its gaze upon you, and you feel it constricting your mind (-1). If you pass, you resist its mind control, but the elder thing escapes; gain this and improve . If you fail, you escape, but your allies are not so lucky; discard 1 Ally Asset.

You've traveled to an island rumored to be the home of a cult of magicians (-1). If you pass, you stumble across their arcane vault and take your pick; gain 1 Magical Artifact and improve . If you fail, the cultists wipe all memory of the island from your mind; gain an Amnesia Condition.

A rogue elder thing enters your cabin and communicates that it will help you if you hide it from the other elder things; you may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and improve . If you do not gain the Condition, the creature attacks; an Elder Thing Monster ambushes you!

Something has the penguins of the island in a frenzy (). If you pass, you notice a newly carved image of the Dark God on a cave wall; gain this . If you fail, you find out the penguins are blind and vicious; a Giant Penguin Monster ambushes you!

Your ship is tossed about in the storm, and you tumble overboard, barely managing to catch yourself on the railing (. If you pass, you notice the lights of a city under the ocean; gain this . If you fail, you plunge into the cold water; gain a Hypothermia Condition.

You've led a small landing party onto a stray glacier. With a rumble, the ice cracks beneath you (). If you pass, you keep calm and discover alien carvings inside the ice; gain this . If you fail, you fall into the icy water; discard 1 Item Asset and gain a Hypothermia Condition.

Locked in a wall of ice is an obsidian tablet covered in pictographs. You must be careful when retrieving the tablet for study (). If you pass, you recover the tablet and are able to translate its text; gain this . If you fail, you accidentally destroy the tablet with your pickax; discard this Clue.

Your ship has run aground on an uncharted island. You take the opportunity to explore while you wait for the tide (). If you pass, you find a cache of soapstones; gain this . If you fail, you miss the tide and have to swim back to the ship; gain a Hypothermia Condition. }

mysteryDetails.name: An Alien Ritual
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The elder things have abducted countless humans, brainwashing them and forcing them to perform some heinous ritual for an unknown purpose.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place a {{icon|mystery

mysteryDetails.name: An Expedition Compromised
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Some members of the expedition crew had gone missing and have been acting strangely since their return. Geological and alien samples are disappearing or being destroyed in the night.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place a {{icon|mystery

mysteryDetails.name: At the Mountains of Madness
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The reason the elder things left Antarctica is unclear. Exploring the frozen continent is the only way to find the answer.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place {{icon|et|1

mysteryDetails.name: Binding the Dark God
mysteryDetails.flavorText: While the Dark God is still weakened, a new prison can be created to contain it. Through a series of rituals, the Dark God can be bound to another world.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place a {{icon|mystery

mysteryDetails.name: Discovery of an Ancient Civilization
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The return of the Miskatonic Expedition brought rumors of a strange, unknown civilization nestled in the heart of the Antarctic wastes, but lately there have been reports of these previously unknown creatures all over the globe.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Research Encounter, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Invasion of the Elder Things
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Millennia ago, the elder things waged war with the mi-go. Research into the conflict has revealed that the beam weapons of the mi-go proved particularly effective against the elder things.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, spawn the Crazed Elder Thing Epic Monster on Miskatonic Outpost. It cannot lose {{Health

mysteryDetails.name: Mysterious Disappearances
mysteryDetails.flavorText: People have been reported missing all over the world, but more alarming are those who have returned, proclaiming the benevolence of the elder things and the potential for a grand alliance.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: As an encounter, an investigator on a {{Icon|city

mysteryDetails.name: The Dark God's Prison Crumbles
mysteryDetails.flavorText: All around the world, the fabric of reality has weakened. Portals to other worlds have torn the sky. As the Dark God's binding crumble, a dark storm cloud gathers over the antarctic circle.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, search the Gate stack and discard pile for all Gates that correspond to spaces on the Antarctica side board. Randomize the Gate stack and place those Gates on top in a random order.

When an investigator closes a Gate during an Other World Encounter, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

name: Hastur
shortDescription: Far from Earth beneath the star of Aldebaran, the Unspeakable One sleeps imprisoned within the core of one of the dark stars of the Hyades. Trapped there in a war long forgotten, he dreams of escaping to exact his terrible will upon the cosmos.
gameplayRules:
* : Investigators as a group lose equal to the number of Gates on the game board unless the Lead Investigator gains a Blight Condition.
* When 2 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Hastur awakens, flip this sheet and resolve the "Hastur Awakens!" effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Hastur's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside 1 Byakhee Monster and all Hastur Special Encounters.
awakeningFlavor: Insanity spreads like wildfire as the agents of Hastur prepare the cities of earth to be swallowed by Lost Carcosa.
finalMystery:
As an encounter, if 2 Mysteries have been solved, an investigator on a space containing a Gate may confront Hastur; he draws and resolves an Unspeakable One Special Encounter.
When there are on this sheet equal to half , the Final Mystery is solved and investigators win the game.
mysteryNames: He Who Is Not to be Named
appearance: The modern description of Hastur typically describes him as a tentacled vaguely humanoid shape clad in a tattered yellow robe.

city.description: You find a leather-bound first edition of The King in Yellow on display at the local Historical Society. You are advised that reading the play is dangerous, but are given permission to do so should you desire. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You methodically check buildings downtown for the Yellow Sign (-1). If you pass, you find the sign etched onto one door with a knife, and take note of who comes and goes; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you are arrested for trespassing; gain 1 Detained Condition.

You believe you have found a painting that leads to Lost Carcosa and study it carefully (-1). If you pass, choose one⸺observe who comes and goes to gain this and 1 additional Clue; or destroy it to close 1 Gate of your choice on any space. If you fail, you are trapped by the painting in your carelessness; move to the nearest space containing a Gate.

The Silver Twilight Lodge wants to help you quell the epidemic of insanity, but does not yet trust you enough to reveal its secrets (-1). If you pass, choose one⸺trade information with the Lodge to gain this and 1 additional Clue; or form a deeper trust to gain a Promise of Power Condition.

A snaggletoothed fence claims to have recently sold a wealthy politician an oil painting that transports the viewer to the shores of a lake on another world. He will divulge the politician's identity, if you pay him a hefty sum. You may gain a Debt Condition to gain this .

At an elegant dinner party, you notice that the other guests are becoming bloated from the meal, yet they still shovel food into their mouths. You try to stop them (-1). If you pass, they are freed from their trance, and are grateful; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, they eat themselves to death; lose .

The mafia offers to sell you information on recent occult dealings (-1); roll 2 additional dice if you have a Deal Condition. If you pass, you work out a trade; gain this or 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, your offer is found to be inadequate, and they send men after you; gain 1 Injury Condition.

You endure hours of aimless rambling by a scholar of the occult, hoping to learn something about the fabled city of Carcosa (-1). If you pass, you learn that the city can be reached through art; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, you are driven mad; gain 1 Madness Condition.

A somewhat unsettling man offers to tell you the tale of the King in Yellow over dinner (-1). If you pass, he is impressed by your ability to retain your mental faculties; discard this and gain the Hildred Castaigne Unique Asset. If you fail, the tale troubles you deeply; gain 1 Madness Condition.

A sharp featured young woman claiming to be a master of several questionably legal techniques has offered to join you, under the condition that you never try to unearth anything about her past. You may gain a Dark Pact to gain this and the Corinna Jones Unique Asset.

A shop in town is reputed to carry a copy of the King in Yellow, but there is no order to the books on the shelves (-1). If you pass, you find it after hours of searching; gain the King in Yellow Artifact. If you fail, you fail to notice the proprietor sneaking up behind you; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

A small package arrives for you in a plain paper sack. Opening the package reveals a pale mask, and upon touching it you are inundated by visions of a prison deep within a faraway star. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain the Pallid Mask Artifact and improve 1 skill of your choice.

By speaking aloud the name of the Unspeakable One, you think you can better understand his power. You may spawn 1 Gate to gain this . If you do not spawn the Gate, much of what you have come to learn is of little use to you; discard this Clue.

In an abandoned warehouse, a group of Yellow Sign cultists are forcefully inducting a prisoner to their ranks. Observe the ceremony and allow the cult's power to grow to gain this and impair ; or interrupt the ceremony and escape with the prisoner to gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck.

You cash in favors to gain an audience with a man claiming to have been to Carcosa and back (). If you pass, he teaches you a little of what he learned; gain this or gain 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, you have exhausted your resources to no avail; gain a Debt Condition.

The mafia knows something, but they refuse to deal with anyone they do not already know. If you have a Deal Condition, they will tell you what you want to know if you do their dirty work; you may spend to gain this . If you do not have a Deal Condition, they refuse; discard this Clue.

Word on the street is that the police found a strange symbol drawn in blood connecting multiple grisly murders. Your inquiries to the department have all been denied, and you consider breaking into the station to look through their files. You may gain a Wanted Condition to gain this .

The Emerald Lama's perpetual pilgrimage has brought him to a heretofore unknown temple in the city, and he has offered to confer his divine blessing upon all who wish to visit him there. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and a Promise of Power Condition.

You believe you can convince one of the recently indoctrinated to change his ways (-1). If you pass, you manage to persuade him; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, your obsession with saving him blinds you to the truth; impair or .

You hire the finest burglar you can afford to break into the police station and steal a case file on the Cult of the Yellow Sign (). If you pass, the burglar finds what you need; gain this . If you fail, the burglar is caught, and you drain your bank account posting his bail; gain a Debt Condition.

The Silver Twilight Lodge has taken an interest in the things you have uncovered about the Cult of the Yellow Sign. The Lodge offers you great power if you will go about your business and let them handle the rest. You may advance by 2 to gain this and a Promise of Power Condition.

One of your friends has been acting strangely and asks to meet with you in private. Your friend asks if you have seen the Yellow Sign and begs you to help pave the way for the king. If you have an Ally Asset, you may gain a Blight Condition to gain this and a Promise of Power Condition.

You tell anyone who will listen that the dark rumors revolving around The King in Yellow are more than just a publicity stunt (-1). II you pass, you find someone who shares your concern; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you are met with laughter and scorn; lose .

You negotiate with the police chief to release an ex-convict from the county jail (). If you pass, he agrees, and the grateful inmate sets about making things right; gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you are arrested under suspicion of collaboration; gain a Detained Condition. }

wilderness.description: You spot a traveler behaving erratically on the road and attempt to follow from a distance (). If you pass, the stranger eventually stops and draws a strange sign in the dirt; gain this . If you fail, you are spotted and the strange traveler is now following you instead; gain a Blight Condition.

You prepare to make camp for the night, and check the surrounding area for any sign of danger (). If you pass, you find the Yellow Sign etched upon a stone, and erase it; gain this . If you fail, your sleep is fraught with dreams of a mad king in tattered golden robes; gain a Blight Condition.

Someone has been following you ever since you started asking questions about the Yellow King. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you see that your assailant has etched hundreds of Yellow Signs onto his body with a knife; gain this .

You hear a monotonous chanting and track it to its source (). If you pass, you spot a group of men kneeling before a black spire in the distance; gain this . If you fail, you make too much noise, and whoever you were looking for is now looking for you as well; gain a Pursuit Condition.

You spy on a known disciple of the Yellow King as she works in her dilapidated but on the fringes of civilization (). If you pass, you steal her journal; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, she catches you, and word spreads quickly of a thief matching your description; impair .

You follow the bloodstained map to the best of your abilities (-1). If you pass, you find an abandoned house, filled with many fine silks and other fineries, all covered in blood; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you lose your way; become Delayed.

A man offers to share the glory of the Tattered King with you. You may gain this . If you do not gain the Clue, you track the deranges man into the wilds (-1). If you pass, you find several terrified captives tied up in a clearing and release them; gain this Clue and retreat by 1.

You speak with some farmers to learn the location of a renowned adventurer in the area (-1). If you pass, choose one⸺learn from the man's wisdom to gain this ; or convince him to join you to gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck.

Rumors of a kidnapping lead you to the edge of a vast wilderness, but saving the captive will require more than your strength alone. If you have an Ally Asset, you and your companions rescue the captive; gain this . If you do not have an Ally Asset, you are injured in the attempt; lose .

You come across a skeleton clutching a weathered journal (). If you pass, you catch a note inside the cover warning you from reading the rat of the journal; gain this . If you fail, one of your companions falls under the sway of its accursed pages; gain a Blight Condition.

You search a wooded area reputed to be in use by a secretive cult, and find the Yellow Sign carved into many of the trees. Gain this . If you have an Ally Asset, one of your companions is driven mad by the symbol, and attacks you in a fit of bloodlust; lose and discard 1 Ally Asset.

You try to befriend a traveler who claims to be headed to hear a local group speak about the Yellow King (). If you pass, choose one⸺follow the traveler to gain this ; or warn the traveler to gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, the traveler is never seen again; discard this Clue.

An apparition donned in flowing golden robes visits you in your dreams, speaking to you in an alien tongue (-1). If you pass, you believe that you are being offered a gift; gain the Tattered Cloak Artifact. If you fail, the gift is given to one of your companions instead; gain a Blight Condition.
