You pose as a disciple of the Yellow King in order to gather information, but you find yourself needing to partake in their daily ceremonies (). If you pass, you mimic the rituals perfectly; gain this . It you fail, you are discovered to be an impostor; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

A crazed hermit demands your blood in exchange for information. You may spend to gain this . Eyes shot with blood, the frenzied hermit looks for his next meal. If you have an Ally Asset, the hermit attacks your companion with ravenous fervor; discard 1 Ally Asset and lose .

Winged beasts have been terrorizing the countryside, and you attempt to track them to their source (). If you pass, you watch a man in yellow robes summon forth one of the strange creatures; gain this . If you fail, your meddling does not go unnoticed; a Byakhee Monster ambushes you!

You come across the Yellow Sign carved into a smooth rock face, glowing as if lit from within. You sense power emanating from its contours, evaluating you front a distance. If you have a Deal Condition, the power imbues you with its vile blessing gain this or improve 1 skill of your choice.

The Cult of the Yellow Sign is hunting your friends (). If you pass, you conceal yourselves well enough that the cult gives up: gain this . If you fail, the cult captures your friends and performs a dark ritual upon them; gain a Blight Condition.

A voice replete with malice and deceit speaks to you when you are alone. It identifies itself as a simple shepherd and promises you limitless power should you help to weaken the bindings of its otherworldly prison. You may discard this and spawn 1 Gate to gain a Promise of Power Condition.

Away from distractions, the import of the things you have seen weighs heavily upon you (-1). If you pass, you make a connection you had not previously realized; gain this and improve . If you fail, the stress is too much; lose .

After tailing the men to a forgotten temple, you search the premise to see what they found (-1). If you pass, you find disturbingly lifelike painting of a city on a lake; close 1 Gate of your choice on any space. If you fail, you hurt yourself while exploring the ruined structure; lose .

You follow a trail of lies hoping to locate a victim occult brainwashing (). If you pass, choose one⸺question the victim about her captors to gain this ; or convince her to leave with you to gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, it is as if she disappeared into thin air; discard this Clue.

You hear cacophonous chanting in the woods and try to locate the source (). If you pass, you catch a glimpse of a monk in emerald robes, upturned gaze basking in the light of the stars; gain this . If you fail, the discordant chanting erodes your sense of purpose; gain an Amnesia Condition.

Much to your horror, one of the Thousand Young visits you with a proposal on account of its mother, Shub-Niggurath, who is not yet prepared for the homecoming of her nefarious mate. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and close 1 Gate of your choke on any space. }

sea.description: You spot a black spire rising ominously from the water, and study it from a distance (). If you pass, you discern it to be alien in nature; gain this . If you fail, you direct the ship closer to get a better look, and its dark energy erodes your mind; impair or .

A chilling shriek echoes over the waves, and you spot a dark shadow descending upon the deck of the ship. A Byakhee Monster ambushes you! If youk defeat it, you study its remains and learn a great deal from the alien physiology; gain this and 1 Talent Condition.

Since leaving port, something strange has been affecting the behavior of the crew one by one, as if they were afflicted by a spreading madness. One night, you are invited to dine with them and partake in the gifts of the king. You may gain a Blight Condition to gain this .

The sailors wager useful information against your rations in a game of cards (). If you pass, you learn that the captain often speaks of the Tattered King; gain this . If you fail, you become malnourished on the voyage and down with scurvy; impair .

The ship's captain offers to take you on as his protégé if you can convince him that the sickness has yet to reach you (). If you pass, gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, the captain believes himself to be the last sane person alive, and drowns himself; advance by 1.

The night sky is blanketed by foreign stars with a strange black glow (-1). If you pass, choose one⸺study their positions to gain this ; or perform a ritual that will return the sky to normal to retreat by 1.

The ship is suddenly blanketed by a thick fog and you struggle to see more than a few yards off the bow (-1). If you pass, you spot a gargantuan black spire and divert the ship in time; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the ship slams into something large; lose .

You search for a wreck reported to be carrying an object of great importance (-1). If you pass, choose one⸺report the location to maritime authorities to gain this and 1 additional Clue; or salvage the wreck to gain the Key to Carcosa Artifact. If you fail, the ship is never found; advance by 1.

A tantalizing voice whispers to you in your dreams of the wonders of Carcosa, you need only open your mind. You may spend to gain this . If you have a Deal Condition, the voice says that only the unburdened may enter Carcosa; resolve the effect of each Deal Condition you have.

You sneak aboard a cargo ship after you see it being loaded with crates marked by the Yellow Sign (). If you pass, you discover that the crates are filled with priceless works of art; gain this . If you fail, you are discovered by the ship's crew; gain a Pursuit Condition.

Ever since your ship left port, an eerie mood has fallen over the crew and other passengers. If you have an Ally Asset, one of your friends asks you, with a deranged smile on his face, if you have seen the Yellow Sign; you may gain a Madness Condition to gain this .

One of your companions points out a green light playing across the waves, and you search for the source (). If you pass, you see a monk in emerald robes floating above the water, gain this . If you fail, obsession with the shimmering light warps your companion's mind; gain a Blight Condition.

Each night the captain throws decadent parties below deck, but you suspect something is wrong with the food (-1). If you pass, you resist the temptation to partake and meditate instead; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, you fall to temptation; gain 1 Madness Condition.

A fellow passenger claims to have unearthed star maps showing the location of the Unspeakable One's prison. He would be happy to share them with you should you invest in his next archaeological venture. You may gain a Debt Condition to gain this .

You stow away aboard a trading vessel rumored to be owned by retainers of the Yellow King (). If you pass, you make a copy of their shipping log; gain this . If you fail, you are caught hiding amongst the cargo and indebted to the ship's captain; gain a Debt Condition.

You barter with a shady boatswain for passage on a ship you believe to be trafficking humans (). If you pass, choose one: study the crew to gain this ; or free the captives to gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you are violently discouraged from snooping; lose .

You infiltrate a ship operated by the Cult of the Yellow Sign. If you have an Ally Asset, your companion's carelessness frequently endangers your tenuous position; impair or . You investigate the shady operation (). If you pass, you learn where the ship is headed; gain this .

You enlist with the crew of a cargo ship owned by the Cult of the Yellow Sign. If you have a Deal Condition, they vet you carefully; resolve the effect of each Deal Condition you have. Having infiltrated the operation, you think you can hijack the ship. You may gain a Wanted Condition to retreat by 1.

The agents of evil are everywhere. If you have a Deal Condition, every shadow holds movement, every footstep on the deck is the darkness come to collect; lose . You notice men watching your every movement (). If you pass, you find evidence linking them together; gain this .

Your ship is attacked, and fish-like creatures drag you into the briny waters. Their shaman gifts you with a vision of a terrible creature of the deep engaged in an endless war with an entity of the cosmos. You may spend and impair to gain this and a Promise of Power Condition.

You enter a boxing match to gain the favor of the captain. You may gain an Injury Condition to gain this . After the fight, you hear a scuffling noise corning from below deck (). If you fail, you realize too late that your quarters have been robbed; discard 1 Item Asset.

You study a cluster of black spires recently discovered protruding from deer waters (). If you pass, you know them to be of alien origin; gain this . If you fail, your mishandling of the spires draws the attention of a winged abomination; a Byakhee Monster ambushes you!

Something deep within you has been calling you to the ocean. Staring into its black depths you realize you must chose between two evils. Spawn 1 Gate unless you gain a Dark Pact Condition. If you gain the Condition, the sleeper in the depths inform you about the Unspeakable One; gain this .

One of the sailors begins to sing a haunting dirge for the lost city of Carcosa (). If you pass, you shake free of the song's melody and ask him to sing something else; gain this . If you fail, the song embeds itself in the mind of one of your companions; gain a Blight Condition. }

mysteryDetails.name: Beneath an Alien Sky
mysteryDetails.flavorText: A sudden celestial phenomenon appears to be projecting the image of twin suns into the sky, and at night, the stars become unfamiliar and dark, almost as if the earth has been transposed into another location.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: Whenever an investigator closes a Gate during an Other World Encounter, he may spend {{Icon|clue|2

mysteryDetails.name: Cities on the Lake
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Far away, in the Hyades star cluster, two cities lie upon the shores of Lake Hali. In Yhtill, Queen Cassilda tries desperately to keep her dynasty from falling to the Tattered King of Carcosa, the city across the lake.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
As an encounter, an investigator on a space containing a Gate may travel to the shores of Lake Hali; he draws and resolves a Cities on the Lake Special Encounter.

Whenever an investigator closes a Gate during a Cities on the Lake Special Encounter, he may spend {{Icon|clue|2

mysteryDetails.name: Finding the Way
mysteryDetails.flavorText: It is said that hidden paths exist from the human world to Carcosa. Paintings and carvings of the lost city can, over time, provide a means of passage between the two worlds, if one can survive the crossing.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Research Encounter, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: He Who Is Not to be Named
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The shadow of madness permeates every avenue of reality as Hastur, the Unspeakable One, stirs. He waits within his dark prison, yearning to bring the sprawling, corrupt cities of humanity under his rule.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, move each {{Icon|clue

mysteryDetails.name: Ravages of the Blight
mysteryDetails.flavorText: A savage infection spreads throughout the known world. Traditional medicine appears to have little to no effect, and those who survive are often deranged parodies of the person they were before the sickness.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: Whenever an investigator discards a Blight Condition, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Spawn of Hastur
mysteryDetails.flavorText: To gaze upon the progeny of the Unspeakable One is to invite your very core the exact darkness which you mean to defeat. No being, no matter how pure, can escape Hastur's shadowy caress unmarred.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, spawn 1 Gate. Then, spawn the Spawn of Hastur Epic Monster on that space.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if the Spawn of Hastur Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

mysteryDetails.name: The King in Yellow
mysteryDetails.flavorText: A production of "The King in Yellow" is drawing patrons from across Europe to a secretive London playhouse, but none who have witnessed the lost play's fatal climax have emerged from the theater's gilded doors.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place the {{icon|Mystery

mysteryDetails.name: The Yellow Sign
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Each day, grim reports of ordinary people turned psychotic dominate the headlines. Each crime scene is more gruesome than the last, linked together only by the presence of a peculiar yellow glyph.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, each investigator places an {{Icon|et

name: Hypnos
shortDescription: Hypnos, Lord of Sleep, whispers softly to wayward dreamers, drawing them into his realm of madness.
gameplayRules:
* When an investigator performs a Rest action, he cannot recover both and .
* : Each investigator moves 1 space toward the nearest space on the Dreamlands side board unless he spends .
* When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Hypnos awakens, flip this sheet and resolve the "Hypnos Awakens!" effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Hypnos's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside all Hypnos Special Encounters. Setup the Dreamlands side board.
awakeningFlavor: The Lord of Sleep has conquered the waking world, and those who walk to the land of dream tread on the boundaries of his starry home.
finalMystery: * When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.

city.description: You pore over the pages from the dream journals of patients from an asylum (-1). If you pass, you notice a series of dots in the margins; gain this and 1 additional Clue. Each of the journals has different markings. You record the markings in case it someday proves useful.

A gentleman in flowing white silks claims to know what you seek (-1). If you pass, you convince him to share what he knows; gain this and, if you are on the Dreamlands side board, gain 1 Task Unique Asset. If you fail, he morphs into a hideous nightmare; a Ghoul Monster ambushes you!

A deranged madman claims to have achieved mastery over servants of the Abyss. Gain this . He sics one of the beasts on you. A Nightgaunt Monster ambushes you! If you fail the test, the last thing you see is the ground fading away beneath you; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

Paralyzed with fright, you search for a way to escape a pit of serpents (-1); roll 2 additional dice if you are on the Dreamlands side board. If you pass, you realize that it is just a dream; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the snakes strike at you and you jolt awake, bleeding; lose .

You dream that your teeth decay and fall from your mouth (-1). If you pass, the dream changes and you uncover arcane energy layered within the dream; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, you wake in a cold sweat touching your teeth to make sure they are still whole; lose .

You witness a scene from your past in a dream but from a different point of view (-1); roll 2 additional dice if you are on the Dreamlands side board. If you pass, you see something you previously missed; gain this and 1 Task Unique Asset. If you fail, the experience is traumatic; lose .

You enter the dreams of one of your companions and discover a memory within his mind that could answer your questions. However, accessing the memory will sever you from the waking world. You may gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

Rumor has it that people have been vanishing during the night. You search the area for anything out of the ordinary (-1). If you pass, you uncover a potential conspiracy; gain this and 1 Task Unique Asset. If you fail, you are arrested for trespassing; gain a Detained Condition.

You tell a young man balancing precariously on a rooftop that he is not dreaming (-1). If you pass, he tells you of a magical place he dreamed of as a child; gain this and you may discard the top card of the Dream-Quest Encounter deck. If you fail, he jumps from the rooftop; lose .

You are ten years old, and your childhood friend begs you to come play with him in a nearby warehouse (-1). If you pass, you remember that your friend died years ago in his sleep; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the warehouse is filled with nightmares; lose .

Your hotel room is filled with smoke and flames. You may spend to gather your research materials before they burn. If you spend the Health, you wake from the dream with charred notes that you did not have before; gain this . If you do not spend the Health, discard all of your Clues.

Not even the social elite have been able to avoid the sleepwalking phenomenon that has been plaguing the city, and you investigate amidst the chaos (-1). If you pass, you learn who has been afflicted; gain this . If you fail, you are violently discouraged from prying further; lose .

You come across a daytime sleepwalker and attempt to dispel the unusual affliction (-1). If you pass, you end up with a new member of your entourage; gain 1 Character Unique Asset. If you fail, the magic fizzles and the dreamer attacks you; lose .

A quiet exhibit has several masterwork sculptures on display (-1). If you pass, a bust inscribed with the word "ΥΠΝΟΣ" catches your eye, and you leave feeling changed; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, you become lost amongst the statues; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

You wake with a bauble of unknown origin in your pocket (-1). If you pass, you find the name of its previous owner barely visible on the bottom; gain this and 1 random Trinket Asset from the deck. If you fail, someone sees you handling it and accuses you of theft; gain a Detained Condition.

Locating an improperly filed volume has you teetering on the edge of madness. You may spend to gain 1 Tome Artifact. If you do not spend the Sanity, you are informed the next day that someone else has checked out the book; move this to the nearest Dream-Quest space.

A local laboratory is conducting a sleep study. You would be free to partake in any number of activities to entertain yourself during the process. However, the university disavows any responsibility for ill effects suffered from lack of sleep. You may spend to gain this and 1 Talent Condition.

You speak with the mother of a boy who vanished in his sleep (-1). If you pass, she tells you of a place he described from his dreams; gain this and you may discard the top card of the Dream-Quest Encounter deck. If you fail, she accuses you of taking him; gain a Detained Condition.

You speak with a man who warns you that trouble from the Dreamlands is seeking you out (-1). If you pass, you recognize him and he offers to accompany you; gain the Randolph Carter Unique Asset. If you fail, you disregard his warning and take no precautionary measures; advance by 1.

Someone has gone missing after several nights of sleepwalking, and you help search for him (-1). If you pass, you find him sleeping in a tree and he tells you about his adventures in the land of dreams; gain this . If you fail, the search is long and exhausting; lose and .

A luminous shape of inky black liquid coalesces before you (-1); roll 2 additional dice if you are on the Dreamlands side board. If you pass, you see the features of a hideous face; gain this . If you fail, you glimpse the space beyond the face and see time unshackled before you; lose .

A grizzled captain claims that his ship can take you anywhere if you can afford its fare (-1). If you pass, you sail his ship into the stars; gain 1 Boon Condition and move to Celephaïs. If you fail, you find that he has left you stranded; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

You attend a night class on the meaning behind common dreams and nightmares. Gain this . You realize suddenly that you forgot to put on clothes before you came and look for something to cover yourself (). If you fail, the eyes of all humanity are upon you; lose .

You dream that you are crushed by an avalanche of falling rocks. When you wake, your room is filled with large heaps of stone and dirt. Amongst the debris, you find a wreath of laurels, completely undamaged. If you are on the Dreamlands side board, gain this and lose . }

wilderness.description: You scan the night sky as you prepare to make camp for the evening (-1). If you pass, you notice a constellation that matches one that you saw in your dreams; gain this . If you fail, a pulsing golden star enraptures you with its malevolent luminescence; lose .

You chase an ashen figure through the muck of a wooded fen (-1). If you pass, you get a look at the figure's empty black eyes before you wake; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, your injuries from the dream remain when you wake; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You attempt to control the chaotic events within your own dreams (-1); roll 2 additional dice if you are on the Dreamlands side board. If you pass, you are able to easily perform fantastic feats; gain this . If you fail, things cascade out of your control; advance by 1.

Drowsiness overcomes you as you struggle to stay awake (-1). If you pass, you see a golden light before you pass out; gain this and you may discard the top card of the Dream-Quest Encounter deck. If you fail, you fall asleep and dream of death and famine; lose .

A wizened oracle interprets your dreams for a small price. Gain this and a Debt Condition. She warns you that your future holds many sorrows, and offers to read your palm (-1). If you pass, you learn much; gain 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you scoff at the notion; advance the Omen by 1.

A young boy sleeping in the crook of a tree on the side of the road disappears before your eyes (-1). If you pass, you find a map of the Dreamlands that he left behind; gain this . If you fail, you are starting to think you might he hallucinating; gain a Hallucinations Condition.

A shadowy figure with a jewel-inlaid scepter visits you in a nightmare. His gaze bores through you, stitching a door to infinity into your chest. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this . If you do not gain the Condition, the nightmare shatters; lose and gain an Amnesia Condition.

A sudden drowsiness washes over you as you scale a rocky precipice, and you use the last of your strength to try to reach the top (-1). If you pass, you collapse at the peak next to a wreath of bay laurels; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you fall; lose .

You dream of a strange, dark power. When you wake, you speak the words of the ritual from your dream (-1). If you pass, the arcane energy takes hold within you; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, your skin withers to dust, leaving your flesh raw and uncovered; lose .

A sharp whining forms in your mind, growing until it becomes a shriek. If you are on the Dreamlands side board, gain 1 Madness Condition. You try to shut out the noise (). If you pass, you quiet the horrible sound; gain this . If you fail, the sound grows only louder and never fades; lose .

You keep an eye out for other travelers as you traverse the heavily wooded trail (-1). If you pass, you encounter a group that shares rumors of dreams that can harm your physical body; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you do not see another living soul for days; lose .

Something terrible is following you, and you search desperately for a safe place to hide (-1). If you pass, you find a suitable shelter; gain this . If you fail, the creature chases you deep into an unfamiliar forest; move to The Enchanted Wood, then a Zoog Monster ambushes you!

Something terrible is about to happen to your friend, but you find that your voice has been silenced. You try to communicate without using words (-1). If you pass, you alert him to the danger; gain this . If you fail, you are both enveloped in darkness; lose and .

You find a seemingly innocuous stone tablet in a quiet clearing. Touching it floods your mind with visions of the origin of the universe. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain the Elder Key Artifact. If you do not gain the Condition, the tablet calls a guardian; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You dream that you are a sorcerer of widespread fame and great ability (). If you pass, the arcane theories you employ are sound and you recall them after you wake; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, the incantations you use are gibberish; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

You try to follow screams for help, but the acoustics of the canyon are playing tricks on your ears (-1). If you pass, you discover someone who claims to have been attacked by a sleepwalking man; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you become lost without rations; lose .

You soar like an eagle, taking in a bird's-eye view of the earth below (-1); roll 2 additional dice if you are on the Dreamlands side board. If you pass, you see a flash of silver far below; gain The Silver Key Artifact. If you fail, you lose control of the dream and plummet to the ground; lose .

A shadowy being whispers to you from a distance, instructing you to follow (. If you pass, you manage to keep up; gain this and move to The Enchanted Wood. If you fail, you lose your way and become tangled in a thorny briar; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You follow a sleepwalking man through the wilds, but he is moving with unnatural speed (-1). If you pass, you see him get sucked into the sky by a golden light, leaving only a pocket journal behind; gain this and 1 Task Unique Asset. If you fail, you lose your way; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You sense that you are being stalked by a terrible presence, but no matter which way you run, you always return to the same clearing (-1). If you pass, you find a path that did not exist before and the evil presence fades away; retreat by 1. If you fail, you remain trapped; lose .

You spot a young man on the road and try to catch up with him (-1). If you pass, he claims that he has little time left and gives you his things; gain this and 1 random Trinket Asset from the deck. If you fail, you catch up to him but his life appears to have been drained away; lose .

There is no ground, only the infinite void, and you cry to convince yourself it is not real (-1); roll 2 additional dice if you are on the Dreamlands side board. If you pass, the stars of the Corona Borealis blaze around you as you fall; gain this . If you fail, you continue to fall without end; lose .

You slip away from the madness that is consuming the cities of the waking world, losing yourself in the forests of the Dreamlands, testing the limits of your physical body and in some cases exceeding them. If you are on the Dreamlands side board, gain 1 Talent Condition and lose .

As you enter a relatively untraveled area of the woods, a quiet but irresistible voice in your head urges you to dig (-1). If you pass, you excavate the bust of some unknown Greek deity; gain this . If you fail, you overexert yourself digging through the night but find nothing; lose . }

sea.description: One of the crew is sleepwalking on the deck and normal means do not wake him (-1). If you pass, you realize that he is hypnotized and restrain him until he regains his faculties; gain this and retreat by 1. if you fail, he struggles against you; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

Without warning, you feel yourself being drawn into the unknown (-1). If you pass, you notice a sliver of red-gold light in the sky; gain this . If you fail, you are propelled through the cosmos until you come to rest amongst distant stars; gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition.

The captain has requested that you search for any sign of a missing sailor (-1). If you pass, you find a marble statue resembling the man in the cargo hold; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you go without sleep to search for the man but find nothing; lose .

Shimmering colors on the water present a vision of a fantastical dreamscape, and a scintillating light from a space beyond the surface entices you to leave your earthly existence behind and jump in. You may gain a Lost in Time and Space Condition to gain this and 1 Boon Condition.

A protective ward is inscribed upon the door to the captain's quarters (). If you pass, it dissipates and you find a shipping manifest; gain this and 1 Task Unique Asset. If you fail, the Corona Borealis reaches out for you across time and space; gain 2 Madness Conditions.

Your eyes grow heavy, and you feel that something malicious urges you to fall asleep (-1). If you pass, you resist and notice the stars are casting a red-gold light upon you; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you dream of the pulsing stars of the Corona Borealis; advance the Omen by 1.

You notice one of the crew on deck as you head to bed (). If you pass, he stares blankly up at the red-gold stars of the Corona Borealis but does not move for many hours; gain this . If you fail, he silently leaps into the sea; gain 2 Madness Conditions.

You search for the source of an incessant shuffling below deck (-1). If you pass, you find a man sleepwalking in a corridor and wake him from his trance; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, someone attacks you from behind; lose .

You enter your cabin and find that someone has spread bay laurel leaves across the floor (-1). If you pass, a brief somnolence passes over you but quickly fades; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, a dark enchantment falls over you; gain 2 Madness Conditions.

A man offers to sell you a Grecian bust for a modest sum. You may gain a Debt Condition to gain this . If you gain the Condition, you recognize the face carved into the statue as another traveler who boarded the ship but went missing; gain a Paranoia Condition.

You attempt a ritual that will allow you to visit faraway places while you sleep (-1). If you pass; you encounter other dreamers on your journey; gain this . If you fail, you encroach too deeply upon realms of horror not meant to be seen by any sane, living creature; lose .

You attempt to identify the faded words carved into an ancient, weatherbeaten tablet found buried in the sands of a lonely beach (-1). If you pass, you discern the names of several long-dead cities; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you disturb the tablet's dormant magic; lose .

Nodens, Lord of the Abyss, appears before you, charging you with mending the Dreamlands. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition co gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you do not gain the Condition, he abducts you in his fury; move to The Underworld and become Delayed.

One of the other passengers warns you about his mother's recent sleepwalking habit (. If you pass, you keep an eye out for the elderly matron, occasionally catching her wandering about the ship at night; gain this . If you fail, you wake to her looming silently over your bed; lose .

You visit with an old sea hag, and she offers you a relic that can capture another's dreams, though it may destroy your body to claim it (-1). If you pass, it acknowledges you as its master; gain the Crystallizer of Dreams Artifact. If you fail, it tears your flesh to shreds; lose .

You have a nightmare that you are standing on deck while the ship is being buffeted by a terrible storm (). If you pass, you realize that you are not actually dreaming; gain this . If you fail, you loiter on the deck until the boom swings into your head; lose .

A merchant vessel has gone missing and you join the rescue crew (-1). If you pass, you discover the ship has been taken by ghouls; gain this and a Ghoul Monster ambushes you! If you fail, you find the ship but everyone on board is dead save for a rather pleased-looking cat; advance by 1.

A rush of adrenaline surges through you as you realize you are trapped in a nightmare, and you attempt to uncover an exit (-1). If you pass, you slip into the nether, freeing yourself; retreat by 1. If you fail, you remain trapped in a room with your greatest fears; lose .

You dream that masters from all over the world have come to teach you their trades (-1). If you pass, you remember some of your dream when you wake; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, you wake up confused and extremely seasick; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

A hooded man has been watching you since your journey began. You sneak away from your quarters to spy on him instead (-1). If you pass, you notice that he does not sleep; gain this . If you fail, your surveillance has not gone unnoticed; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You scan the endless stars in the night sky for unusual celestial activity (). If you pass, you note the supernatural pulsing of the Corona Borealis; gain 1 Boon Condition. If you fail, you do not notice beams of red-gold light streaking heavenward; advance the Omen by 1.

You strike up a game of cards with a quiet, hooded traveler (-1). If you pass, he gives you a curio from his pack but does not speak; gain this and 1 random Trinket Asset from the deck. If you fail, he pulls back his hood to reveal empty black eyes; lose .

You swim in an endless ocean of æther, trying to understand the anomalies around you ()-1). If you pass, you learn much about the foundation upon which the universe is built; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, the winds of infinity erode your mind and body; lose and .

One of the sailors believes he will die if he dreams, and begs you to watch over him while he sleeps. You may spend to gain 1 Task Unique Asset. If you do not spend the Sanity, the sailor has disappeared the next morning; move this Clue to the nearest Dream-Quest space. }

mysteryDetails.name: Descending the Steps
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Was it a dream, or was it a vision? Perhaps both, perhaps neither. Will you remember it when you wake? The only thing you know for certain is that you must make the journey. There is no other choice.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator closes a Gate during an Other World Encounter or a Dream-Quest Encounter, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Dream Within a Dream
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Dream permeates reality. The border between what is and what is not becomes hazy and unfocused, as if it were a memory from time immemorial. What was once peaceful rest has become deadly nightmare.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
As an encounter, an investigator on a space containing a Dream Portal may discard that Dream Portal to attempt to distinguish reality from fantasy; he draws and resolves a Dream Within a Dream Special Encounter. Then spawn that Dream Portal. 

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if there are {{Icon|eldritch tokens

mysteryDetails.name: Dreamwalker
mysteryDetails.flavorText: All around the world, captivities of Hypnos lie in eternal slumber, trapped by dream they perceive as real, all the while being drained of their vitality to feed the insatiable hunger of the Lord of Sleep.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: As an encounter, an investigator on the main board on a {{Icon|city

mysteryDetails.name: Master of Dreams
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The Lord of the Dreamlands beckons to those who would listen. Those who dream wake with wounds akin to those sustained in their dreams, and those who wake dream of lands far beyond their ken.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, each investigator moves the nearest {{Icon|clue

mysteryDetails.name: The Hubris of Man
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Once thought to be myth, a key of insurmountable power might be used to release humanity from the shackles that bind it to the Dreamlands, stifling Hypnos' captivating lullaby.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
If an investigator would gain an Artifact, he may gain the Elder Key Artifact instead. 

As an encounter, an investigator that has the Elder Key artifact and is on Unknown Kadath may attempt to free humanity from the grasp of Hypnos ({{Lore

mysteryDetails.name: Visions of Hypnos
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Hypnos appears to all who enter his realm, and he who witnesses the glorious and terrible visions of Hypnos may find that his mind has already fallen under the sway of the Master of Dreams.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Dreamlands Encounter, he may attempt to resist Hypnos's visions ({{Will

name: Ithaqua
shortDescription: The weather has grown cold, and the aurora borealis glows bright in the northern skies, visible even during the day. A strange madness has begun affecting those around the arctic circle, and travelers returning from the north speak of visions of an ancient civilization.
gameplayRules:
* : Each investigator gains a Hypothermia Condition unless he spends .
* When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Ithaqua awakens, flip this sheet and resolve the "Ithaqua Awakens!" effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Ithaqua's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside 1 Gnoph-keh Monster, 1 Wendigo Monster, and all Ithaqua Special Encounters.
awakeningFlavor: Ithaqua has escaped his bonds, released by the wizard Eibon who hoped to control him. Ithaqua has grown too strong for Eibon's magic to contain and the Wind-Walker no roams free, covering the world in an endless Winter.
finalMystery: * When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.

city.description: The city is blanketed in snow, and you search for any sign of your contact (-1). If you pass, you find him in a half-buried pub, and he shares what he's learned; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you stay out in the cold for too long; lose and gain a Hypothermia Condition.

You've been trapped by the blizzard for days, and your mind begins to waver (). If you pass, you occupy yourself by rereading your notes and notice something you hadn't before; gain this . If you fail, your mind crumbles before you can escape your shelter; gain 1 Madness Condition.

The power has gone out, and you search in the darkness for a source of light (). If you pass, you find a lantern and a loose floor board hiding an ancient scroll; gain this . If you fail, you stumble in the dark and hurt yourself; lose and gain a Leg Injury Condition.

The blizzard has buried the city in snow. You negotiate for full access to the city's library in exchange for your assistance (). If you pass, digging out the snow and searching the library will take some time; you may become Delayed to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

Searching the library's more esoteric books, you come across a passage relating to the previous ice age (). If you pass, you identify the mark of the wizard Eibon in the page's margin; gain this . If you fail, something about the passage infects your thoughts; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You meet a man driven mad by hunger. You attempt to reason with him, but he is beyond help. A Wendigo Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you search his belongings and find a totem related to the Wind-Walker; gain this .

You receive an anonymous letter offering information that could be important to your cause. You arrive at the designated meeting place only to walk into a trap. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you recognize the creature as a worshiper of Ithaqua; gain this .

At the crime scene, you find the victim has been mauled as if by some savage animal (). If you pass, you inspect the wounds and recognize human teeth marks; gain this . If you fail, the killer returns while you are distracted; a Wendigo Monster ambushes you!

You search through the library's occult literature for any hints at the cause of the strange weather (). If you pass, you are unable to find any thing that can explain the sudden storm, but you do learn much about the occult; improve . If you fail, the search is tiring and fruitless; lose .

A supply truck has gone missing in the snow storm while carrying food and medicine (). If you pass, you find the truck in a ditch and assist in transporting the supplies; retreat by 1. If you fail, you become lost in the blizzard; lose and become Delayed.

You find an extremely rare text in the city's library, but you are not allowed to borrow the book. You offer all that you can afford (-1). If you pass, gain 1 Tome Artifact. If you fail, you remember everything you can; you may spend to gain this .

The creatures from the north have grown more aggressive due to the storm. This city, like many others, is under the assault of the beastly gnoph-keh. A Gnoph-keh Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you protect the city and its citizens; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck.

You hear screams from a nearby home and rush to investigate. The door has been left ajar and you find a man holding a bloody knife (). If you pass, you act quickly and subdue the madman, saving his victim; gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you are too scared to act and watch as he consumes the flesh of his victim; lose .

A stranger approaches you on the street, but something seems wrong (). If you pass, you notice the mad hunger in his eyes and flee; gain this . If you fail, he lunges at you and takes a bite out of your arm; lose and gain a Paranoia Condition.

A robed figure is attacking a woman in the park, and you spring to the rescue. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you interrogate him until the police arrive; gain this . If you do not defeat it, you cannot stop the woman from being sacrificed to the spirit of the wendigo; lose .

The blizzard has trapped you in the city's library. The storm will not let up until morning, and you take the time to rest and prepare for the challenges ahead. Recover and or discard a Hypothermia Condition.

A series of grisly murders has led you to suspect the mayor. You search his office for signs of corruption (). If you pass, you uncover a totem to the Wind-Walker in a hidden drawer; gain this . If you fail, the mayor returns and calls the police; gain a Detained Condition.

In your dreams, you request the assistance from the mighty Nodens. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this . If you do not gain the Condition, the weather grows worse and worse, covering the world in ice and snow; gain a Hypothermia Condition and advance by 1.

You find an account of the wizard Ommum-Vog, but it is in a language that you do not immediately recognize (-1). If you pass, the text is illuminating; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, you spend too long searching for a translation and sleep late the next day; become Delayed.

At a scholar's estate sale, you find a number of journals detailing the history of Hyperborea and the wizard Eibon. The books are expensive but highly illuminating. You may gain a Debt Condition to gain this and 1 Old Journal Unique Asset.

You chase a suspected killer through the winding alleys. The suspect ducks into an abandoned warehouse, and you lose sight of him (-1). If you pass, you manage to corner him and notice the wild bloodlust in his eyes; gain this . If you fail, he escapes into the population; lose .

In your dreams, you are a feral creature that hungers for human flesh (-1). If you pass, you manage to control your urges and explore the ancient Dreamlands; gain this and improve . If you fail, your impulses bleed into the waking world; lose and gain a Hunger Condition.

You meet with a scholar who claims to know the reason for the unnatural weather. You try to convince him to join your cause (-1). If you pass, his insight proves useful; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, he hexes you with powerful magic; lose .

The police have captured a man suspected-of killing and eating his neighbors. You are asked to observe the interrogation (-1). If you pass, you can tell the man in not in his right mind and suspect he has been possessed by a wendigo spirit; gain this . }

wilderness.description: You are buried to your waist in a sudden deluge of snow and must dig yourself out to continue your journey (). If you pass, you reach the rumored shrine and examine it; gain this . If you fail, you are stuck until a rescue team finds you; lose and gain a Hypothermia Condition.

You find webbed footprints in the snow and attempt to track the creature (-1). If you pass, you follow the wendigo's tracks to its lair; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the tracks turn back on themselves; a Wendigo Monster ambushes you!

You converse with an Algonquian medicine man who believes you can commune with the wendigo, the evil spirits of greed and gluttony, by meditating in the extreme cold. You may gain a Hypothermia Condition to gain this .

You hear an eerie howling on the wind at night (). If you pass, you identify the sound of the wendigo and move your camp; gain this . If you fail, what you thought was the howling wind proves to be much more dangerous; a Wendigo Monster ambushes you!

You must reach the shelter of the clifftop cave before being caught in the oncoming blizzard (-1). If you pass, you find cave paintings inside that tell the history of Hyperborea; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you're too slow and the wind and snow take their toll; lose .

You strike out to investigate the reports of monstrous creatures in the wild (). If you pass, you discover fresh tracks that belong to the gnoph-keh; gain this . If you fail, you become disoriented in the snow-covered wilderness and give up hope; lose .

You follow a suspected murdered in the wilds, expecting to gather some evidence (-1). If you pass, he leads you to shrine with beastly totems; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, he lures you into a trap and you barely escape with your life; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You meet with your informant well outside the city limits (-1). If you pass, he tells you this unnatural weather is caused by Hyperborean magic; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, he betrays you and sells your secrets to the wizard Eibon; advance by 1.

The snow has piled high and finding your way will be difficult (). If you pass, you reach the rumored shrine and discover it empowers Ithaqua; gain this . If you fail, snow continues to fall and you lose your way; move 1 space along a Train or Uncharted path and become Delayed.

As you trek through the wild, the storm grows lighter and the sky changes overhead (). If you pass, you realize that you have somehow entered the Dreamlands and explore the snowy plateau; gain this . If you fail, you seem to have lost your way and must turn back; become Delayed unless you spend or .

A mysterious man appears in your dreams and offers you knowledge about the Wind-Walker. You may gain a Dark Pact to follow the man further into the Dreamlands. If you gain the Condition, you learn much and awake clutching an old book; gain the Livre d'Ivon Artifact.

Rumors have led you to this place. Supposedly, the shrine you will find here is the cause of the growing storm (). If you pass, you discover the ritual ground where someone has made a sacrifice to the Wind-Walker; gain this . If you fail, you begin to lose your mind to the cold; lose .

People have been going missing from nearby villages. You follow some tracks you believe will lead you to the reason for the disappearances (). If you pass, you find the mangled corpses of the missing persons far from any village; gain this and lose .

You have been asked to assist on an archaeological dig where you discover an ancient relic (-1). If you pass, you identify it as a tool used by the wizards of Hyperborea; gain the Hyperborean Crystal Artifact. If you fail, you are of no help, and your confidence is shaken; lose .

According to an anonymous tip, this cave is somehow related to the abnormal weather (). If you pass, you find cave paintings depicting Ithaqua and Nodens locked in combat; gain this . If you fail, you do not notice the cave is inhabited by gnoph-keh until too late; lose .

You are aghast to see a gaunt but familiar face. Discard 1 defeated investigator token from the game board. Then a Wendigo Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you fear hunger might overtake you as well; lose and gain this . If you do not defeat it, advance by 1.

According to the map, the alien ruins should be here. You begin to dig out the snow in search of the ancient city (-1). If you pass, you uncover alien structures and find a scroll preserved in a stone chest; gain the Pnakotic Manuscripts Artifact.

You trek into the wilds in search of a cause for the abnormal weather. After some time, you find a strange totem half buried in the snow (-1). If you pass, you uncover the totem and study it at length, identifying it as a relic that empowers Ithaqua; gain this .

You find a beastly totem buried in the snow. Gain this . While examining the curio, a horrifying creature attacks. A Gnoph-keh Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, the encounter has readied you for the challenges to come; improve .

The cold has been worst in this area, and you search for the cause (-1). If you pass, you find a shrine that empowers Ithaqua and learn its weaknesses; gain this and improve . If you fail, the cold becomes unbearable, and you are forced to turn back; gain a Hypothermia Condition unless you spend .

Something has the wildlife in an uproar (-2). If you pass, you discover something buried in the snow; gain this and 1 Magical Artifact. If you fail, just being in this place sets you on edge; lose unless you move to an adjacent space.

Someone is performing some ritual sacrifice to empower the Wind-Walker. Further more he seems to be unaffected by the terrible cold. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you disrupt the ritual and examine the scene; gain this .

In your dreams, you travel to the northern plateau and confront Ithaqua (-1). If you pass, you are able to fend off the Ancient One; gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, Ithaqua's might leaves you cold and desperate; gain a Hunger Condition and a Hypothermia Condition.

In this place, with the night sky overhead, you can commune with the Elder God Hypnos (-1). If you pass, Hypnos grants you a vision of the Wind-Walker and the knowledge you need to stop it; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, the Elder God punishes you for your arrogance; gain 1 Bane Condition unless you spend . }

sea.description: The seas have become more treacherous as the temperature drops, but you press on to reach your goal (). If you pass, you find the ship wreck you were searching for; gain this . If you fail, an iceberg strikes the hull, and you're forced to abandon ship; lose and .

You hear a noise on the deck, and when you investigate you are surprised to find a stowaway with a feral look in his eye (). If you pass, he calms down and tells you what he's seen; gain this . If you fail, he attacks you before the crew throws him in the brig; lose .

You explore a massive iceberg and discover a stone tablet frozen deep inside. You cannot make out the writing without liberating it from the ice (). If you pass, the tablet tells of the Wind-Walker; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you accidentally destroy the tablet; discard this Clue.

A ship carrying vital medical supplies has capsized in icy waters. You may gain a Hypothermia Condition to dive into the surf and retrieve the medicine. If you gain the Condition, the ship's crew shares the supplies and their stories; gain this and 1 Provisions Unique Asset.

The spirit of the wendigo assails you in your slumber, spreading its lustful nature (). If you pass, you banish the spirit from your dreams and awake with new purpose; gain this . If you fail, you begin to feel a gnawing hunger that rapidly intensifies; gain a Hunger Condition.

You take shelter from the snow in a cave while exploring a small island (-1). If you pass, you find elaborate cave paintings that depict the Elder God Nodens banishing Ithaqua to another world; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the storm grows worse, and you cannot return to the ship for some time; become Delayed.

Out here on the open seas, it is clear that something unnatural is affecting the weather. Between the abnormally bright northern lights and the ice sheets forming over even the deepest oceans, you know some foul magic is at work. Gain this .

Supplies have gone missing from the galley (). If you pass, you find a man suffering from extreme hunger and muttering about Algonquian folktales; gain this . If you fail, there are not enough rations and hunger begins to gnaw at the crew; lose and gain a Hunger Condition.

In your cabin, you are visited by a vision of the wizard Ux Loddhan. He offers to help your cause in exchange for an undefined favor. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

This part of the ocean has begun to freeze over, and you scan the horizon for a clause (). If you pass, you notice an eerie glow below the surface of the water; gain this . If you fail, the water around the ship freezes solid; become Delayed.

The Elder God Nodens visits you in your dreams and offers you the knowledge you need to prevent Ithaqua from breaking free if you have the necessary resolve (-1). If you pass, gain this and improve . If you fail, the Elder God's presence is too much for your mind to bear; lose .

A winter storm seems to be following the ship. You search the cargo hold for some reason for the phenomenon (-1). If you pass, you find an iron-bound chest surrounded by frost and ice; gain the Heart of Winter Artifact. If you fail, the weather grows colder; lose and

You discover human bones in a cage in the cargo hold. While investigating, a beastly figure tackles you. A Wendigo Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you keep your calm and trap the creature in the cage; gain this .

You discover one of the sailors performing some ritual on the ship's deck at night. You follow him to his cabin and question him (-1). If you pass, he is resistant to your interrogation, but you manage to learn of his allegiance to the wizard Eibon; gain this .

If you've interpreted the runes correctly, this ritual should create a barrier that will slow the advance of the storm (-1). If you pass, gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, the magic channels the cold of the storm through you; lose and gain a Hypothermia Condition.

A massive, bird-like creature descends on your ship, tossing the crew overboard (). If you pass, you manage to fend off the beast, and one of the sailors identifies it as a shantak; gain this . If you fail, the beast grabs you in its talons and carries you away before tossing you into the waters below; lose and move to an adjacent space.

One of the sailors wears a strange amulet that seems somehow familiar to you (). If you pass, you recognize it as a relic of Hyperborea and ask where he got it; gain this . If you fail, you cannot identify its origin, but the pendant appears in your dreams, held by a wizard; lose .

An ice sheet has spread across the surface of the ocean. You lead an expedition onto the ice (-1). If you pass, you discover a portal to another world at the center of the ice sheet; gain this . If you fail, you fall through a patch of thin ice; lose and gain a Hypothermia Condition.

As the ship steers into the eye of the storm, the weather clears, and the stars you see overhead are not as they should be (). If you pass, you realize the ship has somehow entered the Dreamlands; gain this . If you fail, the storm has transported the ship far away; move to a random Sea space.

As the temperature drops, the ocean spray freezes on the deck and railing of the ship, and the waters surrounding the ship turn to ice. The captain steers the ship away from the storm (-1). If you pass, for a moment, you believe you see a robed figure standing on the ice; gain this .

In the captain's cabin, you find an ancient-looking tome (-1). If you pass, the book tells of the magic of Hyperborea; gain this and 1 Spell. If you fail, the captain returns while you are puzzling over the book and throws you in the brig; gain a Detained Condition.

The island was being used to perform some ritual but seen to have been deserted (). If you pass, you find beastly tracks in the snow and quickly gather your findings and leave; gain this . If you fail, a terrible creature attacks during a snow flurry; a Gnoph-keh Monster ambushes you!

Due to the weather, every passenger must work on deck to keep the ship on course. Improve . One of the sailors is very knowledgeable about tales of ancient times, and you try to convince him to tell you what he knows while you work (-1). If you pass, gain this .

You explore a massive iceberg floating on the open ocean (-1). If you pass, you discover a citadel built from ice and recognize this as the lair of Rhim Shaikorth; gain this . If you fail, a huge white worm bursts from the snow and freezes your companion in solid ice; discard 1 Ally Asset. }

mysteryDetails.name: A Spreading Storm
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Scientists are at a loss to supply an explanation for the massive storm system originating from the arctic circle and spreading across the northern hemisphere.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Research Encounter, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Exploring Hyperborea
mysteryDetails.flavorText: All across the northern hemisphere, people have said to have visions of an ancient civilization. The visions are strongest in Greenland where the cities of Hyperborea are cast into reality.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place a {{Icon|mystery

mysteryDetails.name: Growing Hunger
mysteryDetails.flavorText: An unnatural hunger has begun to manifest. There have been disturbing reports of towns tearing themselves apart, the citizens feasting upon their fallen neighbors before turning on one another.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place {{Icon|et|1

mysteryDetails.name: Hyperborean Aurora
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The aurora borealis has been reported to appear overhead as far south as London and New England. Wherever the lights can be seen, the sky seems to hum with arcane energy.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place a {{Icon|mystery

mysteryDetails.name: Supplying the North
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The increasingly harsh winter has disrupted the vital flow of basic necessities to those cities and towns in the northern hemisphere that are now cut off from the world by the deluge of ice and snow.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place {{Icon|et|1

mysteryDetails.name: The Gnoph-Keh Attack!
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Not content to let the weather cause havoc, Ithaqua has unleashed his terrifying minions upon the frozen cities of the world. The gnoph-keh attack with a bestial fury, sowing chaos wherever they appear.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: As an encounter, an investigator on a {{Icon|city

name: Nephren-Ka
shortDescription: Evil stirs beneath the sands of Egypt as the Brotherhood of the Beast, a cult with mysterious loyalties, searches for the final resting place of the Dark Pharaoh Nephren-Ka, seeking to fulfill the prophecy of his resurrection.
lore:
In the shadowed annals of ancient Egypt, where the sands whispered secrets and the pyramids cradled forgotten mysteries, there arose a pharaoh whose name echoed through the corridors of time like a chilling wind. His name was Nephren-Ka, a ruler whose thirst for power reached beyond the realm of mortal understanding.

Nephren-Ka, adorned in regal splendor, walked a treacherous path bathed in the dim glow of forbidden knowledge. Beneath the veils of opulence and majesty, he harbored a sinister desire—an insatiable hunger for immortality that led him down a darkened corridor, away from the light of the sun and into the heart of unspeakable darkness.

Hidden deep within the labyrinthine chambers of his pyramid, Nephren-Ka delved into the forbidden arts, calling upon eldritch forces that slumbered in the abyss between worlds. The air within his unholy sanctum became thick with the stench of ancient malevolence, as he uttered incantations that no living soul was meant to comprehend.

With each sacrilegious ritual, Nephren-Ka's connection to the mortal coil waned, and an otherworldly pallor overcame his countenance. His eyes, once radiant with life, now mirrored the void of eternity. The whispers of the damned echoed in his ears, guiding him through the macabre dance of forgotten incantations that promised everlasting existence.

As the years unfurled like a tattered scroll, tales of Nephren-Ka's unholy pursuits spread fear among the people. Legends spoke of ghastly visions haunting the dreams of those who dared to gaze upon the ruins of his accursed pyramid. Unspeakable horrors were said to stir in the depths beneath the shifting sands, and the very air seemed to carry the weight of an ancient malevolence.

But even the mighty are not immune to the relentless march of time. Nephren-Ka's once-grand empire crumbled into the dust, swallowed by the same desolation that birthed his insatiable ambition. The remnants of his dark legacy lingered like a lingering curse, waiting to ensnare those who dared tread upon the ruins of his once-majestic kingdom.

And so, the legend of Nephren-Ka endures—a cautionary tale whispered in the dark corners of forgotten temples and within the haunted winds that sweep across the barren expanse of the Egyptian sands. The pharaoh who sought to defy the natural order, to transcend mortality, now stands as a spectral reminder of the abyss that awaits those who dare to grasp at the forbidden threads of eternity.
gameplayRules:
* : Each investigator may move 1 space toward The Bent Pyramid. Then each investigator that did not move loses .
* When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Nephren-Ka awakens, flip this sheet and resolve the "Nephren-Ka Awakens!" effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Nephren-Ka's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside all Nephren-Ka Special Encounters. Set up the Egypt side board.
awakeningFlavor: The lightless temple beneath The Bent Pyramid has risen above the sands, and the insidious Nephren-Ka has returned, though he has yet to realize the full extent of his power.
finalMystery:
As an encounter, if 3 Mysteries have been solved, an investigator on The Bent Pyramid may confront Nephren-Ka; he draws and resolves a Dark Pharaoh Special Encounter.
When there are on this sheet equal to half , the Final Mystery is solved and investigators win the game.

city.description: You are hired to deliver a strange package to a retired professor on the edge of town (). If you pass, you see the package shift, and carefully open it to reveal a poisonous asp; gain this . If you fail, you see the professor's name in the following morning's obituaries; advance by 1.

At a well hidden pawn shop, the proprietor offers, for a fair price, to bestow upon you the magic of her ruby-encrusted scarab amulet (-1). If you pass, gain this and 1 Glamour Spell. If you fail, she calls you greedy and turns the power of the amulet against you instead; impair .

You search through police files for old records on Church of Starry Wisdom activity (-1). If you pass, you learn that they funded a dig in Egypt; gain this , and you may shuffle the Expedition Encounter deck. If you fail, the police grow suspicious and refuse you further aid; impair .

You wake to find hieroglyphs scratched into your door, and try to understand their meaning (). If you pass, you recognize the symbols for death and fire, and leave through the window; gain this . If you fail, the door bursts into flame when you try to leave, burning you badly; lose .

You find markings in the margin of a timeworn text on resurrection. You ask the librarian for a list of who has checked out the book (). If you pass, she finds the names for you; gain this . If you fail, she refuses, and you are attacked during the night; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You visit with a world renowned cartographer, and he gladly shows you the maps he has drawn of the passages and chambers within the Great Pyramids. Gain this . You hastily make copies of the maps for your own collection (-2). If you pass, the copies prove useful; gain 1 additional Clue.

You bump into a young man, knocking him off his feet (-1). If you pass, you catch him grabbing your wallet, and he promises to help you if you do not turn him over to the police; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you realize later that you have been robbed; impair .

Seemingly from nowhere, the city is engulfed suddenly in a tremendous sandstorm. You tell yourself that you have to keep moving (-1). If you pass, you manage to find shelter until the storm passes; gain this . If you fail, you collapse in the street, blinded by the stinging sands; impair .

The Brotherhood of the Beast has you marked as a thrcat in this city, and you try to keep a low profile while you spy on them (). If you pass, you remain undetected, and witness them turning the city's water supply black; gain this . If you fail, a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You inspect the municipal library's transcribed copy of the Rw nw prt m hrw, the Book of the Dead, after the book was found on the body of a dead cultist (-1). If you pass, you realize that all of the pages regarding resurrection have been torn out; gain this and 1 additional Clue.

A team has returned from the pyramids with many treasures, but claim the objects are cursed. You insist that you can handle them safely (-1). If you pass, they let you take one to study; gain this and 1 Relic Unique Asset. If you fail, they dispose of the dangerous treasures; discard this Clue.

An archaeologist probes you for information about a recent dig (). If you pass, you realize he belongs to the Brotherhood of the Beast and that they are searching for something; gain this . If you fail, you speak without reservation, and hear later that the dig site was raided; spawn 1 Monster on the Active Expedition space.

You attend a banquet for the reveal of a beautiful jewel uncovered recently in Cairo. When you leave, you are startled to find the jewel in your coat pocket. You think at first to return it, but it begins to whisper praise and promises of power in your ear. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and the Shining Trapezohedron Artifact.

The Brotherhood of the Beast offers to let you attend one of their meetings, provided that you pledge your allegiance to the Dark Pharaoh. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 Relic Artifact. If you do not gain the Condition, a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

The library is rumored to have one of the lost manuscripts of the Necronomicon, but their filing system is absolutely atrocious (-1). If you pass gain this and the Necronomicon Artifact. If you fail, you cannot find the book, but its proximity erodes your mental state; impair .

The young Egyptologist's interest is peaked by your arcane ability, and she offers to teach you a blessing from the Book of the Dead if you share your knowledge with her (-1). If you pass, gain this Clue and 1 Glamour Spell. If you fail, her teachings prove too difficult to comprehend; lose .

A large crowd has gathered around a man who has handcuffed himself to a street lamp. The crowd cheers with glee as he miraculously escapes his bindings (-1). If you pass, you manage to deduce how he did it, and he introduces himself as Erich Weiss; gain the Erich Weiss Unique Asset.

An eccentric collector offers you a piece of his collection of Egyptian heirlooms, provided that you can distinguish it from amidst a room full of clever replicas (-1). If you pass, gain this and 1 Relic Unique Asset. If you fail, his private security throws you out onto the street; lose .

A package from someone named Abdul Reis el Drogman is addressed to a local merchant. To your horror, a corpse bursts from the package upon delivery. A Mummy Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, the grateful merchant rewards you handsomely; gain this and improve .

You watch the house of a known Starry Wisdom Cult member, and wait for him to leave (). If you pass, you find his journal, and learn that the cult worships a winged creature with burning eyes; gain this . If you fail, you prick your finger on a trap he left behind; gain a Diseased Condition.

The Order of the Silver Twilight claims to have conducted surveillance on the Church of Starry Wisdom, and that it would be mutually beneficial to join them. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to learn of the Church's ties in Cairo. If you gain the Condition, gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You search the weathered papyrus scrolls for information about Nephren-Ka, but the ancient Egyptians tried to expunge all records of the Dark Pharaoh from existence, so information is scarce at best (-1). If you pass, you find a brief mention of his rule; gain this .

You knock on the door of the plain blue house indicated in the unsigned letter you received earlier in the day. Nobody answers, but you enter and search the house anyway (-1). If you pass, you find documents linking the Church of Starry Wisdom with a dig site in Egypt; gain this .

Since touching the idol at the Egypt exhibit, you have heard whispers when you are alone (-1). If you pass, you translate the words before the voices stop; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the voices only grow louder; lose for each Relic possession you have. }

wilderness.description: You meet a confused looking traveler on the road and offer your assistance (-2). If you pass, the traveler claims to have been exploring a dark passage deep within the Great Pyramid of Giza only moments before; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck.

A dark wind brings soft whispers of death and famine to your ears, simultaneously offering you the power to prevent it. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and improve and . If you do not gain the Condition, the wind murmurs of evil to come; gain 1 Bane Condition.

Washing your face in a pool of still water, your reflection shows you not in life, but in death (). If you pass, you swallow your fear and study the reflection, noting a dark pyramid rising ominously in the background; gain this . If you fail, you recoil, and the image vanishes; advance by 1.

Rumors of Brotherhood of the Beast activity lead you to several outlying farms, but the area appears to be completely abandoned. You take a look around to see if you can figure out why (). If you pass, you realize that the harvest has been decimated by swarms of locusts; gain this .

You hurriedly search the cultist's campsite while they are away (-1). If you pass, you find a scroll detailing Nephren-Ka's reign and fall, along with an object he allegedly used to control his subjects; gain this and 1 Relic Unique Asset. If you fail, a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You attempt to stay hidden while following members of the Brotherhood of the Beast to their ritual site (). If you pass, you see them slaughter a goat and then resurrect it; gain this . If you fail, you stumble into their poisoned spike trap; lose and gain 1 Illness Condition.

Your skin is beginning to rot where an apparition of Nephren-Ka touched you in a dream. You may spend to carve the infection from your arm. If you spend the Health, the flesh crumbles to sand; gain this . If you do not spend the Health, gain a Diseased Condition.

A dark power compels you to travel through the unknown for miles. You come at last to a shrine covered in hieroglyphs, upon which lies the source of the calling. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, the power compels you to smash the object to bits; discard this . If you do not have a Dark Pact Condition, you take it; gain 1 Relic Unique Asset.

The Brotherhood of the Beast is known to partake in occult practices in the area, and you search for the spot (-1). If you pass, you locate the ritual site and destroy it; gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, the cult's work goes uninterrupted; spawn 1 Monster on the Active Expedition space.

You discover a warning written in hieroglyphs on the lid of a now broken sarcophagus. You try to translate (-1). If you pass, you learn that a piece of Nephren-Ka's body was housed in this tomb, far from the rest, that it might never be whole again; gain this . If you fail, you fall ill after being exposed to the stale air; gain a Diseased Condition.

A set of hastily scrawled treasure maps, recently recovered from a raid on the Brotherhood of the Beast, lead you to a secluded area reported to house some of the Dark Pharaoh's cursed treasure. It is well hidden from anyone unsure of what to look for. You may become Delayed to gain 1 Relic Artifact.

You are captured and strapped to a stone altar by the Brotherhood of the Beast. You struggle against your restraints (-1). If you pass, you break free and escape; gain this . If you fail, they bleed you as part of a sinister ceremony; lose .

After an inexplicable firestorm, you search the burnt earth for what might have caused it (-1). If you pass, you find the remnants of a shattered gem amongst a pile of smoldering rags; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, exposure to the smoke burns your eyes; impair .

You try to convince your companions that the Brotherhood of the Beast is searching for a way to resurrect the Dark Pharaoh. (-1). If you pass, they acquiesce, and you work together to come up with a plan; retreat by 1. If you fail, they berate you for your naiveté; impair .

Someone has etched a series of hieroglyphs into the earth. You translate them to the best of your knowledge (). If you pass, the markings depict a sunken pyramid rising up from the sand; gain this . If you fail, a hooded man attacks you without warning; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You observe the cultists from a distance, but have trouble identifying their faces (-1). If you pass, you notice key members of both the Brotherhood of the Beast and the Church of Starry Wisdom; gain this and 1 additional Clue.

After tailing a suspicious man for several hours, he turns suddenly to make sure he is alone. You try to remain completely still (). If you pass, you observe him meeting with a tall, imposing man dressed in gold; gain this . If you fail, he catches sight of you and flees; discard this Clue.

A looming, faceless apparition offers to lend you its power, foretelling of an eternity of misery and sorrow under the cruel reign of Nephren-Ka, the Dark Pharaoh. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to retreat by 1. If you do not gain the Condition, advance by 1.

You follow a group of cultists to a back country shrine, where they leave an offering to the Dark Pharaoh. As more cultists arrive, you decide it best to leave, but you try to find your way back the next day (-1). If you pass, you ransack their offering; gain 1 Relic Unique Asset.

You inspect the charred remains of a ritual sacrifice, hoping to discover information about the perpetrators (). If you pass, you find the hieroglyph "ankh" carved into the skull; gain this . If you fail, the sight of the human sacrifice is too much to bear; lose .

Locusts have destroyed the foliage in the area, leaving you without enough rations (-1). If you pass, you realize that the locusts were summoned by the Brotherhood of the Beast; gain this . If you fail, you split what meager rations you have remaining; if you have an Ally Asset, lose .

You come across a forgotten sack at an abandoned campsite. Lifting the flap to peer inside, you find a deadly asp coiled atop a stack of papers (-1). If you pass, you snatch the papers quickly and shut the flap; gain this . If you fail, you startle the snake, and it bites you; gain 1 Illness Condition.

The stones of the long forgotten temple have been smeared with glyphs written in blood. You recognize them as hieroglyphs and translate (-1). If you pass, the message reads "the time has come;" gain this . If you fail, you translate the message as "the end has come;" gain 1 Madness Condition.

You barter with a recluse to tell you what he knows about the Brotherhood of the Beast (). If you pass, he tells you that the Brotherhood is looking for a suitable vessel for the return of Nephren-Ka; gain this . If you fail, he bites your arm; lose and gain 1 Illness Condition. }

sea.description: A violent gale roars across the sea, and you think you hear a strange chant upon the wind. Suddenly, the water turns to sand, and your ship appears to be stranded (-1). If you pass, you manage to dispel the illusion; gain this . If you fail, move to The Sahara Desert and become Delayed.

A ship belonging to the Brotherhood of the Beast is carrying catalysts to be used in Nephren-Ka's resurrection. You try to sneak into the ship's cargo hold (-1). If you pass, you discover a carefully wrapped treasure; gain 1 Relic Artifact. If you fail, you are captured; gain a Detained Condition.

You notice a shady passenger aboard the ship, and sneak into his cabin to snoop (-1). If you pass, you find documents linking him to the Brotherhood of the Beast; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, he catches you red-handed; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

The disembodied head of an Egyptian pharaoh speaks to you in your dreams. "You are mine!" he says, and you can feel your memories vanishing. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, discard all of your . If you do not have a Dark Pact Condition, you wake up, heart racing; gain this Clue.

During the long days at sea, you study the history of ancient pharaohs and try to commit their genealogy to memory (-1). If you pass, you uncover the secrets of Nephren-Ka's past; gain this and improve . If you fail, the hours wasted studying drain you; lose .

Looking out over the water, you strain to identify a large, floating mass in the distance (). If you pass, you see that thousands of dead fish have floated to the surface of the water; gain this . If you fail, you are so distracted that you fall over the railing and crash to the lower decks; lose .

You gaze wistfully at the stars, wishing only that they would provide you with the answers that you crave (). If you pass, you see a shooting star cross the sky, and you feel empowered; improve . If you fail, the burden of your quest crushes your spirit; gain a Despair Condition.

The ghost of a priest wronged in life by the Dark Pharaoh visits you at night. He offers to lend you his strength, if you can contain it (-1). If you pass, gain this and 1 Glamour Spell. If you fail, your body breaks under the strain; impair .

Your ship is being tailed. You chart a course using sea channels to outpace them (-1). If you pass, one of the crew is impressed and joins your entourage; gain 1 Character Unique Asset. If you fail, the unknown ship will not relent; gain 1 Bane Condition.

A vision of an ancient pyramid rising out of the desert sand comes to you in your dreams. Gain this . When you wake, you try to convince the captain to change course (-1). If you pass, you may shuffle the Expedition Encounter deck.

Dozens of voices speak to you when you close your eyes. You attempt to find a correlation to what they say (); roll 1 fewer die for each Relic possession you have. If you pass, the voices whisper of Nephren-Ka's resurrection; gain this . If you fail, lose and gain 1 Bane Condition.
