One of the passengers, craving adventure, wishes to join you, but owes a sum of money to a shady group from Cairo. You try to pay it off lest it end in violence (-1). If you pass, gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, the debt is exacted from you as well; lose .

The first mate offers to give you something he found if you can solve his riddle (-1). If you pass, gain this and 1 Relic Unique Asset. If you fail, he teases you relentlessly for the rest of the journey for being unable to solve the riddle; lose .

The crew will offer you a share of the loot they recovered from the Brotherhood of the Beast if you can remove the hex that lies upon it (-1). If you pass; gain this and improve . If you fail, you accidentally free a trapped monstrosity; spawn 1 Monster on the Active Expedition space.

You seek audience with an oracle said to have lived in the time of the pharaohs (). If you pass, she speaks of the Dark Pharaoh, Nephren-Ka, and the places where he conducted his cruel experiments and sacrificial ceremonies; gain this , and you may shuffle the Expedition Encounter deck.

You barter with the captain to tell you what he knows about the Brotherhood of the Beast (). If you pass, he agrees, but only if you help the crew with their duties; gain this and improve . If you fail, he suspects you are one of the cult yourself, and rifles through your things; if you have a Relic possession, gain a Detained Condition.

You plead with the captain for passage, but he is distrustful (); roll 1 fewer die for each Ally Asset you have. If you pass, you discover that he recently came into the possession of a piece of the Dark Pharaoh's treasure; gain this . If you fail, he charges an exorbitant price; impair .

An account of Nephren-Ka's atrocities was written in code after all traditional records were stricken from existence. You attempt to translate during your time at sea (-1). If you pass, you learn that he ruled from within a dark pyramid; gain this . If you fail, the work makes you seasick; lose .

After a run-in with the Church of Starry Wisdom, a spectral terror appears in the sky, its burning eye flaring as it spins a dark hex upon you. You attempt to disrupt its awful power (). If you pass, the terror fades; gain this . If you fail and you have a Dark Pact Condition, flip that Condition.

The crash of thunder rolls loudly across the water, waking you from a deep slumber. At the foot of your bed, a swarthy man in pharaonic garb stands, watching. He does not speak, but he extends his hand. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

An unnatural storm rages, and a colossal wave tosses you overboard. As the sailors scramble to pull you up, you feel something brush against your side. A Spawn of Sebak Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you get a good look at the crocodilian beast before being rescued; gain this .

You notice an oblong box being loaded onto the ship. After the voyage commences, you try to find it in the cargo hold (). If you pass, you discover a mummified corpse in the box and dispose of it; gain this . If you fail, you are attacked that night; a Mummy Monster ambushes you!

The sailors warns you to stay off the deck at night. Curious, you sneak above deck, only to witness a member of the Brotherhood of the Beast undergo a monstrous transformation. Gain this . A Mummy Monster ambushes you! If you defeat the Monster, gain 1 additional Clue.

You watch the crew carefully during the lengthy voyage (). If you pass, you deduce that some of them to belong to the Brotherhood of the Beast and keep your distance; gain this . If you fail, you fall ill under mysterious circumstances; gain a Diseased Condition. }

mysteryDetails.name: Exploring Egypt
mysteryDetails.flavorText: In Nephren-Ka's time, he enslaved the people of Egypt, performing unspeakable rituals from within a lightless pyramid. The land has long since healed from his bloody reign, but a dark secret still remains.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place {{Icon|et|1

mysteryDetails.name: Haunter of the Dark
mysteryDetails.flavorText: When professor Enoch Bowen brought the mesmerizing jewel home to Providence, Rhode Island, none could have fathomed its dark past, or what nefarious manifestation of evil it held trapped within its light.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, spawn the Haunter of the Dark Epic Monster on Arkham. An investigator on Arkham chooses an encounter as if the Epic Monster is not on his space unless he has the Shining Trapezohedron Artifact.

If an investigator would gain an Artifact, he may gain the Shining Trapezohedron Artifact instead.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if the Haunter of the Dark Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

mysteryDetails.name: Stricken from History
mysteryDetails.flavorText: So heinous were the deeds of the Dark Pharaoh, that it was ruled, after his death, that his existence be purged from all written records. Some evidence may yet be found, however, by those who know where to look.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, each investigator moves the nearest {{Icon|clue

mysteryDetails.name: The Beast
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The resurrection of Nephren-Ka, the Dark Pharaoh, is prophesied to be heralded by a sinister and terrible portent — the awakening of the Great Sphinx of Giza, and its subsequent reign of destruction.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, spawn The Beast Epic Monster on The Bent Pyramid. It cannot lose {{Health

mysteryDetails.name: The Black Wind
mysteryDetails.flavorText: A vicious, tempestuous storm wreaks havoc upon the people and lands of Egypt, leaving naught but desolate wasteland in its wake, and yet, it may only be masking an even deadlier threat.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place {{Icon|et|1

mysteryDetails.name: Worshipers of a Forsaken Pharaoh
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The Church of Starry Wisdom was founded upon the premise of unlocking the mysteries of the Shining Trapezohedron. Now, they aim to bring about the return of Nephren-Ka, the Dark Pharaoh.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Location Encounter on the Egypt side board, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

name: Nyarlathotep
shortDescription: He has many names and wears many faces. He alone of the Outer Gods walks the Earth, the puppetmaster pulling the strings of a thousand cults, wearing the masks of a thousand gods.
lore:
In the shadowed pages of forbidden tomes, there lies an ominous narrative, a tale that speaks of Nyarlathotep, the Crawling Chaos—a malevolent entity whose dark presence traverses the realms of mortal understanding. Born from the obsidian depths of the Outer Gods, Nyarlathotep manifests as an enigmatic and shape-shifting deity, a force that weaves its malevolence through the fabric of reality.

Known by the moniker of the Dark Pharaoh, Nyarlathotep is an anomaly among the cosmic horrors, delighting in the orchestration of madness and chaos upon the mortal realm. Unlike its incomprehensible kin, Nyarlathotep assumes myriad forms, often adopting guises that range from beguiling charisma to grotesque horror, leaving mortals in perpetual disarray.

Legends and lore recount the entity's descent upon Earth, clad in masks of allure or nightmare, as it traverses cities and villages in an insidious procession. The indelible mark of Nyarlathotep taints reality itself, spreading like a virulent contagion, and those who encounter its elusive presence find their sanity unraveled, their minds ensnared by the malevolent will of the Crawling Chaos.

The whispers of Nyarlathotep resonate through the corridors of time, captivating seekers of forbidden knowledge who dare to tread the precarious line between curiosity and insanity. Its dark influence infiltrates the dreams of the susceptible, constructing a tapestry of nightmares that entwines the minds of those drawn into the eldritch realms. Once ensnared by its insidious charm, individuals become pawns in a cosmic game, forever bound to the unpredictable will of the enigmatic deity.

lathotep's motives remain shrouded in mystery, and its machinations unfold with an unpredictable rhythm. Encounter with this cosmic malevolence is a confrontation with the embodiment of chaos, a force that waltzes on the precipice between nightmare and reality.

Thus, if ever the distant whispers or chilling touches of the unseen assail your senses, heed caution, for Nyarlathotep may be at work, unfurling its dark tapestry within the concealed recesses of shadows, ready to ensnare the unsuspecting in its web of eldritch horror.
gameplayRules:
* When you have equal to or greater than your maximum , you are devoured.
* : Investigators as a group gain equal to half .
* When 2 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Nyarlathotep awakens, flip this sheet and resolve the "Nyarlathotep Awakens!" effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Nyarlathotep's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside all Nyarlathotep Special Encounters.
finalMystery:
After you resolve an Expedition Encounter or a Mystic Ruins Encounter, you may gain the Eye of Light Unique Asset or the Eye of Darkness Unique Asset.
At the beginning of the Mythos Phase, if 2 Mysteries have been solved, and all investigators are on the same space, and they possess both the Eye of Light and the Eye of Darkness, each investigator may spend a total of 6 and/or to complete the Final Mystery; investigators win the game.

city.description: A man in a white coat with brilliant blonde hair offers you the information you seek. He insists that his assistance comes with no strings attached, but something about him feels out of place. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

A cloaked figure asks you to deliver a package in return for some information (-1). If you pass, you realize that the package contains reagents for a dark ritual and abscond with it; gain this . If you fail, you are an unwitting pawn in the schemes of darkness; gain .

You reason with a frightened young man who you suspect is a recent recruit for a local cult (). If you pass, you convince him to tell you of the cult's location and he promises to stay out of trouble; gain this . If you fail, he invokes a dark hex and escapes into the night, gain 1 Bane Condition.

The Order of the Bloated Woman contacts you with a proposal. In return for revealing the secrets of their sect, you must provide them with a single vial of your blood. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You find the long-winded journal of an extremely verbose cultist (-1). If you pass, you manage to sift through the absurdly detailed accounts and begin work to undo the unspeakable evils that were perpetrated by the author; gain this and you may discard .

You meet with the Order of the Bloated Woman in the inner sanctum of their local headquarters. Gain . You do your best to convince them you can be trusted (). If you pass, they gift you a curio from their treasury; gain this and 1 Tempted by Darkness Unique Asset.

The endless crises are starting to wear on you. Staying on the straight and narrow when everyone around you is slowing you down has become infuriating, and you would give anything for just a little more power. You may gain a Corruption Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You try to appeal to the people of the city to unite against the common enemy (); roll 2 fewer dice if you have a Dark Pact Condition. If you pass, they pass you information; gain this . If you fail, they deem you untrustworthy and play directly into Nyarlathotep's schemes; advance by 1.

You try to translate an ancient Egyptian text that instructs the reader on the creation of defensive wards (-1). If you pass, you are able to replicate a ward that was used in times of old to hide the viewer from the sight of the Dark Pharaoh; gain this and you may discard .

A representative from the Order of the Bloated Woman wishes you to side with her organization against local competition. In return, she will grant you access to the Order's vast network of assets. You may gain a Corruption Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

One of your contacts is concerned about your exposure to dark forces and is wary of working with you (). If you pass, she acquiesces and teaches you to better protect yourself; gain this and you may discard . If you fail, she skips town; discard this Clue.

A clandestine organization tests your ability to resist interrogation (). If you pass, they deem you worthy of a secret that may save all of mankind; gain this and you may discard . If you fail, your willpower is found to be lacking; lose .

According to the library's records, the book you have found does not exist. As your fingers graze its weathered pages, you can feel the book evaluating your usefulness. You may gain a Corruption Condition to gain the True Magick Artifact.

The Silver Twilight Lodge invites you to one of their meetings. Gain this unless you have 2 or more . The group tries to convince you to come into the inner sanctum (-1). If you fail, you are unable to resist and see things that should not be seen; gain 2 Madness Conditions.

The strange stone is reported to be linked to the Father of Bats, but touching it even for a moment requires inhuman endurance (). If you pass, you learn some of the Father's plans; gain this . If you fail, darkness beyond reality fills your mind; gain .

His toothy smile makes your skin itch and crawl, but he claims to have intimate knowledge of the schemes of the Outer Gods. You wonder how this could possibly be true, but his information seems legitimate. You may gain a Corruption Condition to gain The Messenger Unique Asset.

Two competing agencies claim to know the secrets of the enemy. You suspect that one of them is working for him, and try to determine which (). If you pass, you choose your friends wisely; gain this . If you fail, you choose your alliances poorly; gain .

The Voice of the Messenger floods the city, and you fall to your knees, covering your ears. Lose for each you have. In the madness that follows, you try to calm the people (). If you pass, they recount the words spoken to them by the Voice; gain this .

Agents marked by the yellow sign deliver to you a grim missive. The dark within the Hyades will keep the enemy at bay, so long as you fulfill your end of the bargain. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to retreat by 1.

Your mole within the Brotherhood has been discovered and is being held for execution. You attempt a jailbreak, but are forced to choose between saving your contact's life and stopping a fell ritual. You may advance by 1 to gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck.

The police will help those who can be trusted. Gain this unless you have a Deal Condition. You return the favor by helping with an investigation into the Cult of the Bloody Tongue (-1). If you fail, they believe you to be purposefully misleading them; gain a Detained Condition.

You procure a cursed object reputed to be from the Dark Pharaoh's treasury (). If you pass, you manage to dispel its potent hex; gain 1 Relic Unique Asset. If you fail, the curse of the Dark Pharaoh brings ruin and misfortune to your life; gain 1 Bane Condition.

You climb your way up the political chain, hoping to place yourself in a position to affect change in a rapidly darkening world, but you find that few can achieve power without sacrificing their innocence. You may gain a Corruption Condition to gain this and improve .

You attempt to gather information about the vanished Carlyle expedition, but the people seem loathe to trust you (); roll 1 fewer die for each you have. If you pass, you manage to pick up a new lead; gain this . }

wilderness.description: Whispers in your ear cause you to spin about, but there is no one there. (). If you pass, you remain focused and can identify certain words in the whispers; gain this . If you fail, you succumb to the whispers' promises of power and fortune; gain a Corruption Condition.

You gaze into your reflection in a pool of water. You see yourself in another time, stronger, more powerful, and surrounded by others in positions of importance. But you sense a darkness within your other self as well. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You search the scorched area to the best of your abilities (-1). If you pass, you find evidence that an expedition once based its camp here; gain this . If you fail, you remain too long in the tainted area and a sickly blight seeps under your skin; gain .

You find a small, gem-encrusted amulet. Gain . Enamored by its sparkle, you gaze into its starry, multicolored facets, and it offers to show you what it has seen (). If you pass, the amulet bonds with you; gain this and 1 Tempted by Darkness Unique Asset.

You find a dying Yithian that was left for dead by the Cult of the Sand Bat. You know that you should put the doomed creature out of its misery, but at the same time, you could learn much from watching it expire. You may advance by 1 to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

This area has been contaminated by communion with the Bloody Tongue. You carefully make your way toward of the ritual site (). If you pass, you find the ceremonial setting still intact; gain this . If you fail, extended exposure to the area affects you severely; gain 1 Bane Condition.

The wall of a long forgotten cave is covered in intricate murals (-1). If you pass, you recognize that the images are depicting the Outer God Nyarlathotep and you take solace that the entities in the mural are resisting him; gain this and you may discard .

You find a black stream flowing where none should be, and it whispers secrets to you that no man should know. It entreats you to drink deeply of its murky waters. You may gain a Corruption Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

The sun is suddenly blotted out by a black wind, and you feel insanity peeling away the layers of your psyche (); roll 2 fewer dice if you have a Corruption Condition. If you pass, you hear words on the roar of the wind; gain this . If you fail, your mind is shattered; lose .

You try to breach the dense fog growing in your mind (-1). If you pass, you break through into the sunlight, basking in its warmth and relishing another day of life before you wake to the madness of reality; gain this and you may discard .

The black of night falls heavily upon your shoulders, seeking entry into your being. You have kept it at bay for so long, but with how complicated things have become, you cannot help but wonder which path to take. You may gain a Corruption Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

An ethereal voice beckons you to follow, and you are unable to resist. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, gain a Corruption Condition. You feel as if you are an outside observer in your own body, but you try to remember what the voice says (). If you pass, you retain your memories; gain this .

The Cult of the Sand Bat traps you and attempts to control your mind (); roll 1 fewer die for each you have. If you pass, the ritual has no effect; gain this . If you fail, you lose control of your body for several hours as you do their bidding; advance by 1.

A hidden glade exists outside of time and space (-1). If you pass, you manage to locate it, and its keeper provides you with a gift so that you can easily return; gain the Hemisphere Map Artifact. If you fail, you find only despair in the wilderness; gain a Corruption Condition.

You try to find your way through a dense fog that seemingly appeared from nowhere (). If you pass, you find your way safely; gain this . If you fail, you remain in the fog for hours, and you feel as if the fog is alive and attempting to smother you; gain 1 Bane Condition.

You make a pact with Nodens to secure the future of the Dreamlands (); roll 2 fewer dice if you have a Deal Condition. If you pass, he tells you of the movements of the enemy; gain this . If you fail, he believes you to be corrupted by Nyarlathotep and smites you; lose .

A hardy looking man questions you regarding what you know about Nyarlathotep (); roll 2 fewer dice if you have a Corruption Condition. If you pass, he joins forces with you; gain the Jack Brady Unique Asset. If you fail, he believes you to be an enemy and attacks; lose .

You rest against a cool flat stone and observe the starry sky above (). If you pass, your knowledge of astronomy alerts you to an impending eclipse; gain this . If you fail, you feel as if the stars are gazing down upon you with malicious intent; gain .

You follow a meowing tabby cat as it weaves to and fro through a wooded glade (-1). If you pass, you arrive at last at a clearing where Bast herself grants you protection from the evil that threatens the cats of the Dreamlands; gain this and you may discard .

You try to decipher scrawlings left behind by the Carlyle expedition (-1). If you pass, you learn that they broke the seal atop the Bent Pyramid, and also how to repair it; retreat by 1. If you fail, you begin to lose hope that you can do anything to stop what is coming; gain .

The infection in your body is not a physical one, but you work to purge it nonetheless (). If you pass, your strength and determination win the day, and you feel refreshed and ready to take on the world; gain this and you may discard .

An elderly woman living in the woods tells you of her lifelong struggle against Nyarlathotep. She says that she is too old now to continue to fight, but that she would pass on her knowledge to you for a small sum of money. You may gain a Debt Condition to gain this and improve .

You find someone trapped by a labyrinth within their own mind, and you attempt to guide them out with your voice (). If you pass, you have made a new and loyal friend; gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck.

The sky turns bloody and red, and your skin crawls as the Dark Pharaoh steps forth from an unseen dimension. Your heart screams at you to resist, but what he has to offer could change everything. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 Relic Unique Asset. }

sea.description: Here, away from civilization, you feel as if you can be free from the shackles that bind you (-1). If you pass, you notice dramatic changes in the behaviors of your traveling companions as you sail farther out to sea; gain this and you may discard .

Words roll across the waves, reverberating through the channels of your thoughts (); roll 2 fewer dice if you have a Corruption Condition. If you pass, you shiver and draw your coat close around you, rejecting the message imparted upon you by the otherworldly words; gain this .

A booming voice echoes across the water, terrible and wonderful. It speaks to your innermost desires and promises to give you what no power on earth could possibly grant. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

Visions of those you have hurt weigh heavily on your conscience (); roll 1 fewer die for each you have. If you pass, you suspect you have been intentionally led down thus path by another and forgive yourself; gain this and you may discard .

When the crew asks you to join them up on deck, you find it nearly impossible to resist (). If you pass, you reject their offer but secretly watch as they conduct dark rituals; gain this . If you fail, you black out, waking hours later with no memory of your actions; gain a Corruption Condition.

Your ship is boarded by deep ones, but they do not attack. Instead their leader snarls at you, claiming that they will join forces with you to lay waste to the plans of one of your mutual enemies. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You meet with the deep ones, who claim that their master is willing to hear you out (). If you pass, you learn of a great enmity between the Dreamer and the Messenger; gain this . If you fail, they dismiss you, unwilling to work together against a common foe; advance by 1.

A pharaonic entity appears above the ship, radiant and terrifying. Lose for each you have. It presents you with a confusing riddle (-1). If you pass, your answer satisfies it and it leaves you a parting gift; gain this and 1 Tempted by Darkness Unique Asset.

You fade into the Dreamlands as you sleep. You travel for many years, eventually coming to the obsidian gates of Kadath. A lone gatekeeper agrees to tell you of the castle's master in exchange for part of your soul. You may gain a Corruption Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You search the horizon for signs of danger (-1). If you pass, you see a black infection spreading through the water in the distance; gain this . If you fail, the ship sails directly into an unnatural fog; gain .

You study the flow of the currents, searching for any irregularities (). If you pass, the currents predict some imminent celestial event; gain this . If you fail, the longer you study the ocean, the greater the urge to dive in and become one of the sea's children becomes; gain .

The memory of the being that charged you to come to this tiny island is hazy. You know that you should leave the unbroken seal before you untouched, but you want answers, and it is the only way you can think to get them. You may advance by 1 to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You set out on a voyage of self-reflection, hoping to clear your mind and renew your crumbling faith in humanity (-1). If you pass, you spot an omen of hope in the starry night sky; gain this and you may discard .

The crew has been paid by the Order of the Bloated Woman to transport a prisoner, but they would be willing to release their captive for the right price. You may gain a Debt Condition to gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck.

Stowed away aboard the Dark Mistress, you find a hidden compartment. Inside, you find an elaborate Chinese fan. Touching the fan, even for a moment, fills you with fear, and you question whether you should leave it be. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain the Black Fan Artifact.

You chart a voyage through unknown waters (). If you pass, you arrive at your destination before the Order of the Bloated Woman has a chance to desecrate it; gain this . If you fail, bureaucracy and incompetence slow your journey, filling you with rage; gain .

An expedition, recently returning from a dig in Egypt, offers to sell you an item that they found within a hidden chamber of the Bent Pyramid. You may gain a Debt Condition to gain this and 1 Relic Unique Asset.

No one else seems to see the man with the book standing on deck. He stands there, extending ink and a quill to you, enticing you to sign. You hesitate as he flips the pages of the charcoal-black book to an empty page. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain the Black Book Artifact.

Your dream takes you to the gates of Kadath. The doors open on their own accord, and a melodic, honey voice beckons you to enter (). If you pass, you remember the dream when you wake; gain this . If you fail, your eyes blacken as you walk through; gain a Corruption Condition.

You look for contraband in the cargo hold (); roll 2 fewer dice if you have a Deal Condition. If you pass, you find packages bound for Kenya; gain this . If you fail, you are mysteriously drawn to a crate that contains a statuette of a horrific beast with a bloody tongue; gain 1 Bane Condition.

A solitary green spire rises from the ocean before the ship, and the sky darkens above you. No creatures of the deep accompany its arrival, but it resonates with a haunting, powerful melody, daring you to accept its fell blessing. You may gain a Corruption Condition to retreat by 1.

A starry omen appears in the night sky, foretelling the coming of the Daemon Sultan (). If you pass, you record the information quickly, hoping to use it to change the future; gain this . If you fail, it disappears in an instant and you fall into despair; gain .

The King in Yellow speaks to you in a dream. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, gain 1 Bane Condition. You try to comprehend his horrific speech (). If you pass, he teaches you to avoid the gaze of the Crawling Chaos; gain this and you may discard .

You sit cross-legged atop the crow's nest, contemplating the abyss within you (). If you pass, you are the master of your own destiny; improve 1 skill of your choice. If you fail, your insides seethe with rage and hatred; gain a Corruption Condition. }

mysteryDetails.name: Brotherhood of the Dark Pharaoh
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Investigation of the ill-fated Carlyle expedition leads to Cairo, where rumors of an ancient queen's imminent resurrection fill you with unease, and the shadow of something much darker lies beneath the surface.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, set aside all '''''Brotherhood of the Dark Pharaoh''''' Adventures. Then draw the Investigating the Great Sphinx Adventure.

mysteryDetails.name: Cult of the Bloody Tongue
mysteryDetails.flavorText: M'Weru, a fanatical, manipulative priestess with a dark agenda, has surfaced in Kenya. From within a hidden lair, she leads a cult in service of an unspeakable deity - The Bloody Tongue.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, set aside all '''''Cult of the Bloody Tongue''''' Adventures. Then draw the Mountain of the Black Wind Adventure.

mysteryDetails.name: Cult of the Sand Bat
mysteryDetails.flavorText: You receive word that Robert Huston, the leader of a world-spanning gang of cultists, has traveled to the Outback, where he has resurrected the near-dead Cult of the Sand Bat in service of the Father of Bats.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, set aside all '''''Cult of the Sand Bat''''' Adventures. Then draw the Outback Investigation Adventure.

mysteryDetails.name: Order of the Bloated Woman
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Sir Aubrey Penhew, a devious mastermind with ill intentions, has been spotted in China. Your search leads you to Shanghai, where the Order of the Bloated Woman works to achieve some dark purpose.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, set aside all '''''Order of the Bloated Woman''''' Adventures. Then draw the Eye of Darkness Adventure.

name: Shub-Niggurath
epithet: The Black Goat of the Woods
shortDescription: During pagan rites, Shub-Niggurath absorbs worthy cultists into her amorphous body and transforms them into gof'nn hupadgh Shub-Niggurath, the goat spawn. From the wildest corners of the earth, her primal brood, the dark young, emerge to overwhelm humanity.
lore:
In the tomes of eldritch knowledge, within pages aged by the weight of centuries, there exists a dread account of Shub-Niggurath, the Black Goat of the Woods with a Thousand Young. This blasphemous entity is a force of primal fertility and unspeakable horror.

Described in ancient manuscripts as the All-Mother, Shub-Niggurath is an entity beyond mortal comprehension, an eldritch force that embodies the chaotic essence of creation and destruction. Her name, whispered in hallowed tones among those who dare delve into forbidden lore, evokes a sense of dread and reverence.

Shrouded in the misty veils of distant realms, legends speak of Shub-Niggurath as a dark deity with a form that defies earthly description. Some accounts portray her as a monstrous, amorphous mass, with appendages and protuberances that writhe and undulate in an obscene dance. Others tell of a grotesque fertility deity adorned with a profusion of twisted, horned forms.

The Black Goat of the Woods is said to dwell in shadowed groves and hidden corners of the cosmos, where the veil between dimensions is thin. Her presence is accompanied by an eerie cacophony—a symphony of disconcerting noises that echo through the eldritch realms, a manifestation of the thousand young that spring forth from her formless womb.

Worshipers of Shub-Niggurath, often deranged and devoted to the forbidden rites, partake in rituals that invoke the dark blessings of the All-Mother. These ceremonies, conducted in secluded places where the boundaries of reality are fragile, are said to unleash unspeakable forces and call forth nightmarish offspring that join the Black Goat's grotesque progeny.

The lore surrounding Shub-Niggurath is fraught with madness and terror, a testament to the ancient cosmic horror that lurks beyond the veil of human understanding. Her name, whispered in hallowed tones or inscribed in forgotten manuscripts, remains a chilling reminder of the forbidden knowledge that lies hidden in the annals of the eldritch world
gameplayRules:
* : Spawn 1 Monster on a random space. Then, if there are 10 or more Monsters on the game board, advance by 2.
* When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Shub-Niggurath awakens, flip this sheet and resolve the "Shub-Niggurath Awakens!" effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Shub-Niggurath's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside 2 Ghoul Monsters, 2 Goat Spawn Monsters, and 1 Dark Young Monster.
awakeningFlavor: The feral mother of all monstrosities has manifested! She is an enormous cloud from which dozens of tentacles extend and retract. Wherever she goes, she leaves behind large hoof prints. To behold her true, terrifying form is to come face to face with true, primal horror.
finalMystery: * When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.

city.description: You search for insight into what the Order of the Death's Head was doing before they left the city (). If you pass, you find notes about a creature; gain this and discard 1 Monster of your choice. If you fail; advance by 1.

You've captured one of the Brotherhood's knights. These assassins are rarely captured alive, and this may be your only chance of interrogate one (). If you pass, you question him briefly before he swallows a poison capsule; gain this . If you fail, he struggles and escapes; lose .

A midnight break-in at the museum has left several guards dead. Based on descriptions of the stolen items, you try to identify what was taken (). If you pass, you recognize the items as the legendary Furnace of Yeb and Torch of Nug; gain this .

In your nightmare, the chanting of the Cult of the Black Goat threatens your sanity (). If you pass, you remember the words when you wake up; gain this . If you fail, you find yourself in an open field the next morning; move to the nearest space and gain an Amnesia Condition.

You search an underground temple dedicated to a fertility goddess (-1). If you pass, you find a hidden tunnel that connects the temple to a cemetery; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, mold and spores get into your lungs; gain an Internal Injury Condition.

Blood begins to drip from your ears, nose, and mouth. A witch is casting a hex against you, and you must resist it ()! If you pass, you are able to send the hex somewhere else; gain this and 1 Monster of your choice loses . If you fail, gain a Cursed Condition.

You identify an important member of the local government as a worshiper of the Black Goat and try to persuade him into revealing the cult's secrets (). If you pass, he answers your questions; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, he frames you for a crime; gain a Detained Condition.

As he lie dying, the bleeding priest begs you to guard the sword. He tells you Brother Tristam and his Order will stop at nothing. If you make a solemn vow, he will give you his ancient blade. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and the Sword of Saint Jerome Artifact.

The Order of the Death's Head is engaged in a ritual. You must swear an oath of allegiance to prove that you are one of them. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this . If you do not gain the Condition, the ritual takes place, uninterrupted; spawn 2 Monsters each on a random space.

The zoo's night watchman shows you around after cult activity was reported there during a full moon. He soon reveals his true loyalty. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you search his apartment and find information about the local servants of the Black Goat; gain this .

You attend a production of The King in Yellow that features extremely intricate props (-1). If you pass, you recognize a powerful relic and sneak in after the show to steal it; gain the Pallid Mask Artifact. If you fail, a knight of the Order attacks you after the show; lose .

You do your best to convince the police that the mayor is a warlock (-1). If you pass, they investigate and discover the necessary evidence to arrest him; gain this . If you fail, the mayor arranges for you to have an "accident;" gain a Back Injury Condition.

According to the newspaper, the accused murderer spoke a strange phrase in French when he was arrested (). If you pass, you recognize the passage from Cultes de Goules; gain this . If you fail, his message reached his fellow cult members without being detected; advance by 1.

Brother Tristam's knights are about to perform a ritual sacrifice. He tells you that he'd be willing to let the victims go, if you agree to his bargain. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this . If you do not gain the Condition, the ritual proceeds; each Monster on the game board recovers all .

A woman with goat-like features is standing over a badly wounded policeman. Spawn a Goat Spawn Monster on your space and encounter it. If you pass the test, the policeman is able to tell you what he was investigating before he dies; gain this .

Something about this old boarding house and its proprietor seems strange (-1). If you pass, you spot small glyphs carved into the woodwork throughout your room; gain this . If you fail, you suffer a witch's hex and wake up in agony; lose and .

Someone drank the milk of Shub-Niggurath. Spawn a Goat Spawn Monster on your space. To your horror, you used the same cup (-1). If you pass, you resist its effect; gain this . If you fail, the substance affects your consciousness; gain an Amnesia Condition and become Delayed.

A noted scholar has been taken by the Order of the Death's Head, but they are willing to release him if you agree to their terms. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to free him from their ritual. If you gain the Condition; discard this and retreat by 1.

You warn the museum's curator about the thieves (-1). If you pass, he adds security and share his knowledge; gain this . If you fail, you patrol the grounds yourself but are struck by poisoned darts; gain a Poisoned Condition and move this Clue to the nearest space.

You race your car through traffic, speeding after the cultists. They try to lose you on back streets (). If you pass, you catch up to them; gain this . If you fail, your car spins out of control; lose and gain a Back Injury Condition.

You intercept the delivery of a package containing a ritual dagger and confront the intended recipient. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you find evidence in his home that a new branch of the cult of the Black Goat is being established here; gain this .

An elderly couple asks you to guard their antique books. You're certain that you can find a hiding place that won't be discovered (-1). If you pass, you're free to examine their books; gain this . If you fail, the Order of the Death's Head eventually finds you; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

The police tell you about elixirs that were used during cult rituals. You try to sneak into the police station to steal them (-1). If you pass, you sample an elixir; improve . If you fail, the police capture you by force; lose and gain a Detained Condition.

You are being hunted by Brother Tristam's knights. You keep an eye out for anyone who could be working with the Order of Death's Head (). If you fail, they find you and take your notes by force; lose and discard . }

wilderness.description: The moon is full, and a satyr-like creature pulls itself from an undulating mass of sludge. A Goat Spawn ambushes you! If you defeat it, gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you wake up the next morning with no memory of how you survived; gain an Amnesia Condition.

The cultists weave through the trees, making it hard to follow them (-1). If you pass, you watch their ritual; gain this . If you fail, you get lost in the forest; spawn a Dark Young Monster (or a random Monster if the Dark Young Monster is on the game board) on your space and encounter it.

The faces of the robed figures are hidden behind wooden goat masks. Their chanting corrupts your thoughts. You may gain a Dark Pact to gain this and improve . If you do not gain the Condition, you find yourself alone, unsure if the cultist were really there; gain a Paranoia Condition.

This area has been prepared for a sacrifice. You keep an eye out for the Cult to return (-1). If you pass, you watch them sacrifice a goat to Shub-Niggurath; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, they surprise you in the night; discard 1 Ally Asset and lose .

The hooded figure hands you a chalice, but you are suspicious of its content (-1). If you pass, you pour the foul substance on the ground and study the effect; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you drink the milk of Shub-Niggurath; a Dark Young Monster ambushes you!

The Cult of the Black Goat has chosen you as the target of their ritual hunt. You try to cover your tracks and evade all of their traps (). If you pass, you escape with your knowledge of the Cult intact; gain this . If you fail, they capture you and stone you in a cage until their next ritual; gain a Detained Condition.

A group of cultists have been eviscerated by some creature they summoned but could not control. You think you know a way to send the abomination back where it belongs (-1). If you pass, you banish the beast; gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, it throws you into a rock wall; gain a Back Injury Condition.

The locals in a small village are celebrating an ancient pagan holiday. Some of the songs and traditions seem to have occult significance (-1). If you pass, you recognize the influence of The Black Goat and stay away from the festival; gain this . If you fail, a Goat Spawn Monster ambushes you.

A hermit will help you if you find the rare plants he needs (). If you pass, he cuts your hand and applies a homemade salve to the wound that causes you to feel a connection with all creatures; you may spend to choose a space. If you spend the Health, each Monster on the chosen space loses

The cultists around the bonfire wear wooden masks that resemble some creature. You try to grab a mask in the confusion (). If you pass, you throw the mask into the fire; 1 Monster of your choice loses . If you fail, the cultists descend upon you in a frenzy; lose .

You discover a familiar face with goat-like features. Discard 1 defeated investigator token from the game board, then a Goat Spawn Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you shudder to think what ritual caused this changed; lose and gain this . If you do not defeat it, advanced by 1.

You examine the odd, moonlit lenses (). If you pass, you understand their purpose; gain this . If you fail, an abomination appears, and one of your associates is absorbed into its horrid form; discard 1 Ally Asset and a Goat Spawn Monster ambushes you!

The last person to ask about cults died out here. When you reach the spot indicated by the police, you find his remains. Gain this , then spawn a Dark Young Monster on your space and encounter it. If you defeat the Monster, gain 1 additional Clue.

You find the Cult of the Black Goat holding their ritual right where you suspected. However, you did not anticipate the creature they summoned. A Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, gain this . If you do not defeat it, the victory in ritual combat feeds the strength of Shub-Niggurath; advance by 1.

In the middle of the night, the cult of the Black Goat surrounds you and invites you to become One of the Thousand in exchange for their help. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this . If you gain the Condition, 1 Monster of your choice on any space lose .

You hear the pounding of hooves. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, the Black Goat has come to collect; flip that card. You glimpse the horrifying beast pouring from the wild like fog (). If you pass, gain this . If you fail, lose .

In an abandoned graveyard, you see the silhouette of a feasting monstrosity. A Ghoul Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, the beast begs for mercy and swears to perform a service for you; gain this and 1 Monster of your choice on any space lose .

A robed figure is drinking a foul-smelling substance from a ceremonial goblet. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you examine the goblet; gain this . If you do not defeat it, he suddenly undergoes a hideous transformation; a Dark Young Monster ambushes you!

A fluid oozes out of the rocks. You search for a place to safety collect a sample (-2). If you pass, you fill a bottle with the substance; gain this and the Milk of Shub-Niggurath Artifact. If you fail, you slip and fall into the ooze; gain a Poisoned Condition unless you discard 1 Ally Asset.

You hear strange animal sounds you've never heard before. Spawn 2 Monsters on your space. As the creatures approach, you sense a great presence that offers you power. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and defeat all Monsters on your space. If you do not gain the Condition, resolve a Combat Encounter against each Monster on your space in the order of your choice.

Inside this Roman temple, a strange item sits on the dust-covered altar. Gain 1 Weapon Artifact. As soon as you touch the item, you hear a thunderous noise. A Dark Young Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you have a chance to explore the temple; gain this .

A gypsy is selling medicinal draughts out of a horse-drawn carriage. For his special mixes, he doesn't accept money. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 Elixir Artifact. If you do not gain the Condition, he is angered and hexes you; gain a Cursed Condition.

For centuries, no one approached the area around the old Roman temple. Exploring the temple, you find an altar to the Black Goat. Gain this . However, you are not alone in the temple. A Dark Young Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, the land is no longer forsaken; retreat by 1.

As the cultists carve your skin with their daggers, you sense the presence of Shub-Niggurath. You could strike a bargain with the ancient horror. You may spend or gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this . If you gain the Condition, 1 Monster of your choice on any space loses . }

sea.description: You search the ship for a creature that's been attacking the crew (-1). If you pass, you find the beast asleep in the cargo hold and easily overpower it; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, it finds you; a Monster ambushes you!
You negotiate with the crew to fight on your behalf (-1). If you pass, they eagerly offer their help; gain this and discard 1 Monster of your choice.

One of the crew secretly worships the Black Goat, and he has set the ship on fire. You race to fight the flames (-1). If you pass, you question the cultist; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you have to abandon ship; move to the nearest space and you become Delayed.

You stop to examine a ship that has run aground (-1). If you pass, the captain's journal describes a creature that was kept in the cargo hold; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you find nothing useful; move this Clue to the nearest space.

Under the full moon, the sailor turns into a beast. You lock him in his cabin and brace the door (-1). If you pass, he's normal gain in the morning and tells you of his experience; gain this . If you fail, he escapes and dives overboard; move this Clue to the nearest space.

One of the sailors tells you that you've been marked and must be purified by fire. He brands your skin. Lose . You feel the pain break the dark influences that cling to you; gain this and you may discard a Cursed or Dark Pact Condition.

The crew is gone, and all of the navigational equipment has been destroyed. You decided to search a nearby island (). If you pass, you find evidence of cult activity when you arrive; gain this . If you fail, you wait for a rescue; become Delayed.

You can't shake the feeling that something is hunting you. You stay awake all night to watch for the threat (). If you pass, you find strange tracks on the deck of the ship; gain this . If you fail, a Monster ambushes you!

You discover that a Pinkerton Agent who had escorted a cultist to face trial has been lured into becoming One of the Thousand. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you turn them both over to the police; gain this .

The men with you on this island prove to be knights of the Order of the Death's Head. Now they hunt you like an animal (). If you pass, you return to the ship and find papers they left behind; gain this . If you fail, there is no escape; lose and gain an Internal Injury Condition.

You board a ship that seems intact, but there's no crew. You search for an explanation (-1). If you pass, you find the cargo manifest contains something unspecified but labeled as highly dangerous; gain this . If you fail, a Monster ambushes you!

You find some jewelry made of human bones on the ship. Somewhere, there's a Tcho-Tcho on board ()! If you pass, you find the creature hiding in the engine room; gain this . If you fail, it attacks you in the night; lose

In the ship's cargo hold, you find a small carving of a horrible creature. Lose . You feel a terrible connection to the beast, a bond that threatens to kill you both. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, you and 1 Monster of your choice on any space each lose .

Inside the cargo hold you find a monstrosity that was being transported to an exclusive island for a hunting expedition, but now the thing has gotten loose. A Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you check the shipping manifest; gain this .

Storm clouds loom, but you want the captain to keep moving forward (-1). If you pass, you find a yacht moored to the island; gain this . If you fail, you try to proceed on your own, but your small boat capsizes; move this Clue to the nearest space.

A nightgaunt has carried a ghoul onto the deck of the ship to find you. A Ghoul Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, the ghoul offers help in exchange for its life; gain this and 1 investigator of your choice may discard a Cursed Condition.

While the mi-go on the island worship Shub-Niggurath, you hope to grab the cylinder they've set aside (-1). If you pass, gain the Mi-go Braincase Artifact. If you fail, the mi-go pick you up and start flying; lose , move to a random space, and become Delayed.

You approach a fellow passenger who wanted to speak to you alone on deck (-1). If you pass, you notice his ring identifies him as a member of the Order of the Death's Head; gain this . If you fail, he shoves you overboard; gain a Leg Injury Condition and a Paranoia Condition.

A stench is coming out of one of the cabins. You watch the cabin, waiting for it to be empty (-1). If you pass, you find a caged ghoul inside; gain this . If you fail, you are stabbed by a cultist before he and his prisoner disappear; lose and move this Clue to the nearest space.

On the beach, you find the gnawed remains of gulls and fish. You are attacked as you examine the grisly scene. A Ghoul Monster ambushes you! If you defeat it, you discover the assailant had once been human; gain this .

Legends say that those marked by the gods will hear the voice of Cybele on this island. If you have a Dark Pact Condition, you find Latin phrases written on the walls, and the mother goddess speaks to you; gain this and lose .

Legends say a primitive form of humanity used to live on this island. You search for any evidence of these creatures (-1). If you pass, you find clay pottery and stone weapons; gain this . If you fail, rocks are thrown at you from unseen assailants; gain a Back Injury Condition.

You thought you saw someone or something floating in the water (-1). If you pass, you find the drowned corpse of a mi-go that was carrying a satchel full of documents; gain this . If you fail, a fellow passenger figures out what you've seen and attacks; a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

Returning to your cabin, you see scratches around the latch (). If you pass, you spot the trap that was set for you, and as you disarm it, you gain a sense of who built it; gain this . If you fail, pushing the door open causes a fiery explosion; lose and gain a Back Injury Condition. }

mysteryDetails.name: Blasphemy of the Black Goat
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The Black Litanies have been intoned and Yeb has been called forth from the Black Fire to purge the earth in preparation for Shub-Niggurath's arrival.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, spawn the Yeb Epic Monster on space 19.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if the Yeb Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

mysteryDetails.name: Hour of the Moon Lens
mysteryDetails.flavorText: In the small village of Goatswood, a series of peculiar mirrors are arranged on top of a pole to focus moonlight through a lens. It is said that the Cult of the Black Goat uses this lens during their dark rites.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place the {{icon|Mystery

mysteryDetails.name: Hunting the Thousand
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Shub-Niggurath's spawn, the Thousand Young, infest the planet in greater and great numbers, threatening to overrun humanity.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When a non-Epic Monster is defeated, the active investigator may spend {{Icon|clue|2

mysteryDetails.name: Nature of the All-Mother
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Shub-Niggurath naturally corrupts all life that encounters her. Everywhere her worshipers are found, all living things grow more vicious and feral.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, move each {{Icon|clue

mysteryDetails.name: Rituals in the Wild
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Bonfires roar in the wildest corners of the planet as the Cult of the Black Goat performs their bestial rituals. The cultist howl to Shub-Niggurath to let loose her children upon the Earth.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place {{Icon|et|1

mysteryDetails.name: Spawn of the Black Goat
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Shub-Niggurath's twin blasphemies will prepare the world for the Black Goat, destroying any potential challenge to their mother's reign. One of the pair, Nug, has begun its dreadful task.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, spawn the Nug Epic Monster on The Amazon.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if the Nug Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

name: Shudde M'ell
shortDescription: Shudde M'ell slumbers deep beneath the lost African city of G'harne. The ripples of his tumultuous dreams bring ruin to the world above.
gameplayRules:
* When advances to a space containing an , draw and resolve a Disaster. Then discard that Eldritch token. 
* : Each Investigator loses a total of and/or .
* When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.
* When Shudde M'ell awakens, flip this sheet and resolve the "Shudde M'ell Awakens!" effect on the back.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Shudde M'ell's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside all Shudde M'ell Special Encounters. Place on spaces 2, 5, 8, and 11 on the Doom track.Rome is devastated!
awakeningFlavor: Shudde M'ell bursts forth from his subterranean abode, cracking the earth asunder and visiting unparalleled devastation upon the cities of earth.
finalMystery: * When 3 Mysteries have been solved, investigators win the game.

city.description: No one else seems to notice the shaman that stands in the street before you, adorned with gold and bone, hand outstretched in silence. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you do not gain the Condition, a Cultist Monster ambushes you!

You partake in a proposed experiment that infuses the bearer with a serum extracted from the corpse of a cthonian (). If you pass, you survive the process; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, the serum wreaks havoc on your body; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

A man covered in piercings and tattoos attacks you while you quietly eat a warm meal in a local diner. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, he drops his weapon and flees into the night; gain this and 1 random Weapon Asset from the deck.

You witness hooded men meeting in an alley. Gain this . You keep your distance, but follow them back to their hideout (-1). If you pass, you continue to eavesdrop undetected; gain 1 additional Clue. If you fail, they catch on, and collapse their own hideout with you inside; lose .

You evaluate how best to free someone trapped in a collapsed building by a sudden earthquake (). If you pass, you carefully remove debris until the person is freed; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, the debris collapses further, injuring you both; lose .

A high strung police officer demands that you hand over your weapons (-1). If you pass, he calms down and you learn that recent cult activity has the police on edge, gain this . If you fail, nothing you say will dissuade him from confiscating your things; discard 1 Weapon possession.

A recent tremor has unearthed a maze of pitch-black tunnels beneath the city (). If you pass, you feel your way through the tunnels and find a shrine to the serpent god Apophis; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you cause a cave-in; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

A girl has been trapped by a fallen beam, but you do not know if you have the power to save her (). If you pass, adrenaline courses through you and you lift the beam; gain this and improve . If you fail, you hurt yourself in your attempt to free her; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

Tremors threaten to shake the building apart, and you summon all of your might to keep the door frame from collapsing (). If you pass, all of the building's occupants escape into the street; gain this and retreat by 1. If you fail, the building collapses into a heap; lose .

Wood and stone sail through the air as a giant worm bursts up from beneath the street. An Ancient Cthonian Epic Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you retain enough of your mental faculties through the chaos to notice that the beast has no eyes; gain this and 1 additional Clue.

You ask a librarian for Sir Amery Wendy-Smith's book On Ancient Civilizations (). If you pass, she finds it for you and it reveals much; gain this and improve . If you fail, she brings you his terrifying account of G'harne instead; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

You read a portion of Wendy-Smith's translation of the G'harne Manuscript. Gain this . Desperate for more, you bid on a translation of the remaining fragments (). If you pass, you acquire the texts; improve . If you fail, your mental state degrades; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

You speak with the increasingly erratic archaeologist Amery Wendy-Smith to learn what he knows about G'harne (-1). If you pass, he offers to join you; gain the Amery Wendy-Smith Unique Asset. If you fail, he begins to laugh manically while rocking back and forth in place; lose .

A furious-looking man names you a traitor to mankind and challenges you to a duel (-1). If you pass, once you have subdued him, he explains that he mistook you for a follower of Apophis; gain this . If you fail, you are wounded during the fight; gain 1 Injury Condition.

You are attacked in an alleyway by a would-be assassin, and try to overpower him (). If you pass, you learn that he was hired by a man with many tribal piercings; gain this and 1 random Weapon Asset from the deck. If you fail, you are gravely injured during the struggle; lose .

You hear whispers calling you down aisle after aisle of forgotten books. You try to glean meaning from the strange language (-1). If you pass, the whispers lead you to a book in a glass case; gain 1 Tome Artifact. If you fail, you wander the aisles for days; gain 1 Madness Condition.

An alchemist claims to have reproduced the effects of holy water using his own original concoction. He suggests it might afford you protection against the worm-like cthonians and begs you to be his first test subject. You may spend to gain this and 1 Talent Condition.

You pore over a stack of dusty papers in search of the location of the lost city of G'harne (-1). If you pass, you piece together excerpts from several texts to find what you seek; gain this . If you fail, you come to believe the city is both everywhere and nowhere; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You hear a weak cry for help as you pass a collapsed building, and try to find the victim (-1). If you pass, you find someone trapped beneath a fallen pillar; gain 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, the cries for help eventually stop; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You walk through a district of the city that has been remarkably unaffected by the quakes (-1). If you pass, everywhere you go you see a peculiar sign etched into the buildings; gain this . If you fail, a strange buzzing noise tugs at the fringes of your awareness; lose .

With a thundering crash, a massive worm comes barreling through a building, splinters flying inches from your head. Your instinct urges you to flee, but opportunities to study these creatures are scarce. An Ancient Cthonian Epic Monster ambushes you! You may gain 1 Injury Condition to gain this .

You sift through the debris of destroyed buildings to find anything useful that is yet unbroken (-1). If you pass, you find something; gain 1 random Weapon Asset from the deck. If you fail, you find a revolver that ends up blowing up in your hands the first time you fire it; lose .

You break into the police station to read a classified report about a recent series of ritualistic killings in areas affected by the recent earthquakes. Gain this . You try to escape without being seen (-1). If you fail, you are caught in the act and your things are confiscated; discard 1 Weapon possession.

The buildings around you rattle and shake. You attune your mind with the source of the tremors (). If you pass, you glimpse the mind of a cthonian; gain this and 1 Ritual Spell. If you fail, you have made yourself an easy target, an Ancient Cthonian Epic Monster ambushes you! }

wilderness.description: You search the debris left behind in the wake of some gargantuan creature (). If you pass, you spot something protruding from the rubble; gain this and 1 random Weapon Asset from the deck. If you fail, you are nearly buried as some of the debris collapses upon you, lose .

You explore a tunnel left behind by some sort of giant worm. Gain this . You hear a rumbling in the tunnels ahead of you and try to hide (-1). If you pass, you find a place to hide; gain 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you lead the creature toward civilization as you flee; advance by 1.

You discover a swath of scorched earth and try to determine the cause (). If you pass, you discover the fragment of a meteor that pulses when you touch it; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, something in the air warps your mind; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

Someone is darting to and fro between the trees. You attempt to follow him (). If you pass, you startle the man and he drops what he is carrying; gain this and 1 random Item Asset from the deck. If you fail, you do not notice a gaping hole in the ground before you and fall in; lose .

The glyphs on an ancient warding-stone suggest you might use it to experience the memories of a shaman long dead. However, simply touching the stone makes you itch, a vile corruption festering beneath your skin. You may gain 1 Bane Condition to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

The ground begins to tremble and shake, and a piercing shriek echoes across the landscape. An Ancient Cthonian Epic Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you carefully observe the creature's movements even as you are fighting it; gain this .

You feel the ground begin to shake and try to hold absolutely still (). If you pass, you freeze in place as a colossal worm burrows up from the ground; gain this . If you fail, your movement attracts a terrifying subterranean creature; an Ancient Cthonian Epic Monster ambushes you!

You follow the trail of uprooted trees left behind by some great, burrowing creature (). If you pass, you come across the creature's nest, and observe its comings and goings; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you become hopelessly lost; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

You examine the pieces of a shattered warding-stone and attempt to piece them back together (). If you pass, the stone hums to life, gain this and improve . If you fail, the stone explodes once more, sending rocks flying in every direction; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You find a nest of eggs left behind by the giant worms. The shells are hard as iron, but you try to crush the eggs before the worms return (). If you pass, the earth shakes with each egg you crush; gain this . If you fail, the worms return to chase you away, lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You peer down the slope of a deep crater and see something shining on a ledge below. You try to climb down to reach it (). If you pass, you find a destroyed warding-stone; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you tumble down the steep incline; gain 3 Injury Conditions.

You watch in horror as a fellow traveler is swallowed up by the earth. You dig frantically with your hands to save him (). If you pass, you uncover him, as well as a network of tunnels; gain this . If you fail, your hands are bloody and raw from the digging; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

The land is blackened and dead where a fire recently passed. You survey the charred landscape (-1). If you pass, you deduce that the fire was caused by an unnaturally destructive thunderstorm; gain this . If you fail, the bleak desolation unsettles your nerves; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You find yourself suddenly paralyzed, unable to move. The cold wind of chaos breathes heavily on the back of your neck, and a barely audible whisper offers you the power to stem the flood of darkness. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain the Vach-Viraj Chant Artifact.

You come upon a giant egg just as it is hatching, and attempt to subdue the worm-like larvae as it emerges from the shell (-1). If you pass, you study it for a time before it gathers enough strength to escape; gain this . If you fail, it nearly crushes you; gain 1 Injury Condition.

The ground shakes and trees begin to splinter in the distance, and you see a wall of water rushing toward you. You scramble to scale a rocky cliff face (-1). If you pass, you make it to safety and watch the tsunami pass; gain this . If you fail, the water slams you into a rock face; gain 1 Injury Condition.

You see a series of markings etched onto trees and stones and into the earth. You attempt to make sense of them (-1). If you pass, they lead you to a cave that contains a powerful relic; gain 1 Weapon Artifact. If you fail, you believe the signs foretell the end-times; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You come across a nest of giant eggs. Gain this . As you near the eggs, you feel yourself lose control of your body (). If you pass, you break free of the control; gain 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, you wake up days later with no memory of anything that occurred; gain 1 Bane Condition.

You sift through the rubble of an utterly destroyed shack far from civilization (-1). If you pass, you find the remains of a ritual circle; gain this and 1 random Item Asset from the deck. If you fail, you trip over a loose floorboard and fall into a puddle of pungent ooze; lose .

You spend time in the wild in order to become closer to nature, but the nights spent alone are terrifying (-1). If you pass, your time in the wild has made you stronger; improve 1 skill of your choice. If you fail, you are badly hurt one night while fleeing from a bear; gain 1 Injury Condition.

You follow a series of glowing stones that lead you to a tiny camp where some shady-looking men are talking. Gain this . You attempt to raid their camp (). If you pass, you get away unseen; gain 1 random Weapon Asset from the deck. If you fail, they leave with their weapons; advance by 1.

You attempt to piece together the broken shards of a warding-stone, such that the symbols inscribed upon them form a cohesive sequence (-1). If you pass, the symbols form an arcane chant; gain this and 1 Incantation Spell. If you fail, the symbols are burned into your mind; lose .

The earth falls away beneath your feet, and you find yourself falling toward the gaping maw of a horrifying worm creature. An Ancient Cthonian Epic Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, the severely wounded creature returns to its subterranean lair; retreat by 1.

You see a young man gripping the ledge of a freshly dug pit and try to throw him a rope (-1). If you pass, he offers payment for saving him; gain this and improve . If you fail, you drop the rope, and one of your friends falls into the pit while trying to recover it; discard 1 Ally Asset. }

sea.description: You spot shifting earth on a distant shoreline, as if something is burrowing beneath the ground. Gain this . Enraptured by the spectacle, you are barely aware of your surroundings (-1). If you fail, you stumble into the railing and some of your things fall overboard; discard 1 Item possession.

Hail the size of your fist begins to strike the deck of your ship, and you look for a place to hide (). If you pass, you hide below deck and lift some of the cargo during the chaos; gain this and 1 random Weapon Asset from the deck. If you fail, you are severely pummeled; lose .

A hooded man tells you of a great worm worshiped in times long past. Gain this . You notice his skin is covered in markings (-1). If you pass, you realize that he is a disciple of Shudde M'ell; gain 1 additional Clue. If you fail, simply looking upon the marks corrupts you; gain 1 Bane Condition.

A shaman living on an uncharted archipelago is the source of a recent slew of earthquakes. A Cultist Monster ambushes you! If you pass the test, you subdue the shaman; gain this . If you fail the test, the shaman opens up the earth, swallowing one of your companions; discard 1 Ally Asset.

Your ship navigates through a sea of flotsam from what appears to have been a great flood (-1). If you pass, you spot something useful in the debris; gain this and 1 random Item Asset from the deck. If you fail, you find only the bodies of those washed out to sea; lose .

A tiny island in the ocean harbors a fully intact warding-stone. Breaking it apart may allow you to learn more about how the mysterious stones work, but whatever horror the ward is hiding will be freed upon the world. You may advance by 1 to gain this and 1 additional Clue.

During your journey, you attempt a ritual that purports to grant prescience to the followers of Apophis (). If you pass, the ritual works; gain this and improve . If you fail, you are deemed unworthy; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You do not remember seeing the man in black when your ship left port, but his offer seems genuine. He offers you knowledge of how to use water against the cthonians for an undisclosed favor at a future date. You may gain a Dark Pact Condition to gain this and retreat by 1.

You keep a lookout for anything in the water that might slow the ship (). If you pass, you divert the ship around the drowned corpse of a massive worm; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, the dark waters call to you; lose and gain 1 Madness Condition.

The corpse of a giant worm has washed up on an island. You dig through its entrails in search of anything it might have swallowed (). If you pass, you find a piece of a warding-stone; gain this and improve . If you fail, prolonged exposure to its alien physiology makes you ill; lose .

A high-pitched whining noise is getting louder and louder (-1). If you pass, you see something streaking through the air toward you and dive aside; gain this . If you fail, something crashes into the deck and you are peppered with razor-sharp splinters of wood; gain 1 Injury Condition.

The seas churn and islands tremble as a volley of meteorites falls all around. You watch where they land (-1). If you pass, you note where they fall; gain this and 1 additional Clue. If you fail, you are too distracted to notice the crates of cargo sliding toward you; gain 1 Injury Condition.

You spot a man floating in the water, and dive in to rescue him (). If you pass, you drag the man aboard the ship, and he tells you that his village was destroyed by a great worm; gain this . If you fail, you nearly drown trying to reach him; lose and gain 1 Injury Condition.

You spend several hours observing an impressive meteor shower (-1). If you pass, you realize that the meteor fragments are not burning up as they enter the atmosphere; gain this . If you fail, you become entranced by the fiery display; gain 1 Madness Condition.

An elderly monk, sitting cross-legged on a rock in the middle of the ocean, riddles you to test your worth (-1). If you pass, the priest gifts you with a vial of consecrated seawater; gain the Tikkoun Elixir Artifact. If you fail, he cackles maniacally and disappears; gain 1 Madness Condition.

You navigate using some old sea charts, improvising based on current conditions (). If you pass, you deftly navigate the reefs that have appeared in recent months; gain this and 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, the ship runs aground, throwing you sharply into a wall; gain 3 Injury Conditions.

As you lead a team to a volcano at the center of a small islet, a tremor knocks one of your companions off-balance (-1). If you pass, you steady your companion; gain this and 1 random Ally Asset from the deck. If you fail, you watch as your companion falls into the caldera; lose .

Atop a hill on a deserted island, a strange object protrudes from the ground. You try to pull it out, storm clouds gathering as you struggle (). If you pass, it comes free with a mighty crash; gain the Lightning Gun Artifact. If you fail, you are struck by lightning and severely burned, lose .

You try to pry open a crate marked with the word "G'harne" (-1). If you pass, you find the box to be full of shattered fragments of stone; gain this . If you fail, the crate slides around while you struggle to open it, crushing you against a wall; gain 1 Injury Condition.

You compare two waterlogged maps that were found on islands long thought lost to rising sea levels (-1). If you pass, you find evidence connecting Stonehenge with G'harne; gain this . If you fail, nothing seems to make sense anymore; gain 1 Madness Condition.

Fear grips you as you feel an outside force assault your mind (-1). If you pass, you fight it off and peer inside its mind as you do; improve 1 skill of your choice. If you fail, you slide around, slamming into walls and railings as you fight to retain control; gain 1 Injury Condition.

A lunatic hermit on a small islet in the middle of the ocean allegedly knows the true weakness of the cthonians, but he demands that you trade him something in return for the undoubtedly valuable information. You may discard 1 Item possession to gain this .

An old witch of the sea teaches you a trick to use against the cthonians (). If you pass, you easily master the complex rite; gain this and 1 Glamour Spell. If you fail, the miscast magic rends the flesh from your bones; lose .

You train tirelessly during your lengthy voyage, knowing that the devastated cities of the world will offer you no succor (). If you pass, you unlock potential you never knew you possessed; gain 1 Talent Condition. If you fail, the strain on ill your body is too great; lose . }

mysteryDetails.name: Bringer of Ruin
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Every twenty-three years, the great worm Shudde M'ell returns to the lost city of G'harne to commune with his children, stirring them into a frenzy and inciting them to bring ruin to the civilized cities above.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Research Encounter, he may spend {{Icon|clue|1

mysteryDetails.name: Disaster Relief Effort
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Weary and without hope, the people of the ruined cities of humanity look to those more fortunate than themselves to deliver them from destitution.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: After an investigator resolves a Devastation Encounter, he may attempt to organize a relief effort to help the displaced civilians ({{Influence

mysteryDetails.name: Exploring G'harne
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The ancient city of G'harne was founded by the Elder Things, and in eons past served to guard Shudde M'ell's subterranean prison. Now it is abandoned, and there are those who aim to profit from its untold riches.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place the {{Icon|mystery

mysteryDetails.name: Renewing the Seal
mysteryDetails.flavorText: The warding-stones that once imprisoned Shudde M'ell and his progeny have long since been stolen or destroyed, but with proper arcane knowledge, they might be forged anew.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, place {{Icon|et|1

mysteryDetails.name: The Burrowers Beneath
mysteryDetails.flavorText: Beneath the Earth's crust, the eldest of Shudde M'ell's children burrow between continents, creating tremors of increasingly worrisome magnitude and frequency.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText: When this card enters play, spawn a number of Ancient Cthonian Epic Monsters equal to half {{NoInvestigators

mysteryDetails.name: The Worldrender
mysteryDetails.flavorText: A cthonian of immeasurable power has emerged in the deserts of northern Africa. Near continuous earthquake repel those who would face it, and soon the entire region will be reduced to ash and rubble.
mysteryDetails.mysteryText:
When this card enters play, spawn the Worldrender Epic Monster on The Pyramids.

If an investigator would gain an Artifact he may gain the Vach-Viraj Chant Artifact instead.

At the end of the Mythos Phase, if The Worldrender Epic Monster has been defeated, solve this Mystery.

name: Syzygy
shortDescription: When the planets align with the center of the universe and the Earth falls under the shadow of an eclipse, that which would devour all life seeks to pierce the veil that keeps the darkness at bay.
lore: Syzygy doesn't refer to an Old One. A syzygy is a cosmic alignment.
gameplayRules:
* When the Omen advances to the space of the Omen track, place on that space.
* At the end of the Mythos Phase, if 2 Mysteries have been solved or there are on the space of the Omen track, flip this sheet and and resolve "The Portal Opens!" effect.
* If advances to zero, investigators lose the game.
thumb|220px|right|Front of Syzygy's sheet
setupInstructions: Set aside all Syzygy Special Encounters. Set up the Mystic Ruins Encounter deck.
awakeningFlavor: The solar eclipse has begun, shrouding the Earth in darkness. Azathoth's gaze falls upon humanity. Only the power left behind by those who once fought the outer gods can close the portal.
awakeningEffects:
on this sheet for each solved Mystery.
Then shuffle the Mystic Ruins Encounter deck.

Final Mystery
As an encounter, an investigator on the Mystic Ruins space may draw and resolve a Sealing the Portal Special Encounter.
